The Queen brings Iris a raincoat and boots!

"Want to try it?" asks the Queen.

Iris nods!

She puts on the raincoat. She pulls on the boots!

The Queen opens the door. Iris steps outside!

The rain falls on her hood. Pat, pat, pat!

Iris sees a big puddle near the steps.

She jumps! SPLASH!

Water flies everywhere!

Iris laughs! She jumps again! SPLASH!

Then again! SPLASH, SPLASH!

Iris runs through the garden, jumping in every puddle!

She watches worms wiggle. She sees a snail climbing!

She catches raindrops in her hands!

The rain makes everything look shiny! Fresh! New!

"Rain isn't boring!" Iris calls. "It's fun!"

The rain stops. The sun peeks out!

Iris takes off her raincoat and boots.

She's wet and muddy, but smiling!

"Did you have fun?" asks the Queen.

"Yes! I like sunny days. But rainy days are good too!"

From that day on, Iris smiles when rain clouds come!

questions.question: What kind of weather does Princess Iris love?
What does Iris watch racing down the window glass?
What does the Queen give Iris to play outside in the rain?
What did Iris discover about rainy days by the end of the story?
options: They are fun and good too

title: The Castle in the Clouds
description: A story about the castle in the clouds.
content:
Princess Mira loves to look at the sky.

Every day, she lies in the grass and watches the clouds.

Some clouds look like animals! Some look like boats!

But today, Mira sees something different!

One cloud looks like a castle! With towers! Windows! Even a little door!

"I want to visit that castle," says Mira.

Mira stands up. But the cloud castle is too far away!

She climbs a tall tree. One branch! Two branches! Three branches!

But the cloud castle is still too far!

A large white bird lands on her branch.

"Why are you so high up?" asks the bird.

"I want to visit the cloud castle," says Mira.

"I can help you. Climb on my back," says the bird.

Mira's eyes go wide. "Really?"

Mira climbs onto the bird's back. She holds on tight!

The bird flaps its big wings and lifts into the air!

Up they go! Higher and higher!

The wind blows through Mira's hair!

"We're flying!" Mira shouts happily!

The bird flies to the cloud castle!

Towers of soft, fluffy cloud! Windows that sparkle!

The bird lands on a cloud step.

Mira walks toward the little door.

Inside, everything is soft and white!

Cloud furniture! Cloud curtains! Cloud table!

A tiny cloud person appears. "Welcome, Princess!"

"Is this your castle?" asks Mira.

"Yes! Would you like some cloud tea?"

Mira sits at the cloud table.

The cloud person pours tea.

Mira takes a sip. It tastes sweet and light, like mist!

"This is wonderful!" says Mira.

After tea, Mira thanks the cloud person.

"Come back anytime," says the cloud person.

The bird flies Mira home.

Mira waves as the bird flies away.

The cloud castle is real! And she can visit whenever she wants!

questions.question: What unique thing does Princess Mira see in the clouds one day?
options: A castle with towers and windows

questions.question: How does Princess Mira finally reach the cloud castle?
options: She builds a very tall ladder.
She jumps very high from a tree.
A large white bird carries her.
She finds a secret magic path.

questions.question: What does the tiny cloud person offer Mira inside the castle?
What is special about the cloud castle according to the cloud person at the end of Mira's visit?
options: It only appears once a year.

title: The Princess and the Gentle Dragon
description: A story about the princess and the gentle dragon.
content:
Princess Lily is picking berries in the forest.

She hears a sound. A low, rumbling sound!

Behind the bushes, she sees something big and green!

A dragon!

Lily freezes. But the dragon doesn't look scary. It looks... sad.

The dragon spots Lily. He steps back.

"Please don't be afraid," says the dragon quietly. "I won't hurt you."

"Why do you look sad?" asks Lily.

"Everyone is afraid of me. They run away."

"You don't look scary to me," says Lily. "What's your name?"

"Ember," says the dragon.

"I'm Lily. Do you want a berry?"

Ember leans down carefully and eats one berry from Lily's hand.

"It's good," says Ember.

"Want to help me pick more?" asks Lily.

Ember follows Lily through the forest.

Lily picks berries from low bushes.

Ember stretches his long neck to reach the high berries!

He drops them gently into Lily's basket.

"You're very helpful!" says Lily.

They pick until the basket is full!

They walk back toward the palace.

But at the edge of the forest, Ember stops.

"I can't go further. People will be afraid."

"What if I tell them you're my friend?" asks Lily.

They walk to the palace gates.

Two guards raise their swords! "Dragon! Stay back!"

"Wait!" calls Lily. "This is Ember. He's my friend. He helped me pick berries!"

The guards lower their swords slowly.

"Your... friend?" says one guard.

"Yes," says Lily firmly. "He's gentle and kind."

"I don't want to cause trouble," says Ember quietly.

Lily holds up her basket. "He picked all the high berries for me!"

The guards look at each other. Then they step aside.

"Alright. But stay close to the princess."

Ember's tail wags! "Thank you!"

Lily brings Ember to the palace garden.

The King and Queen are surprised. But they see how gentle Ember is!

"You may visit anytime," says the King.

From that day on, Ember visits Lily often!

And no one is afraid of Ember anymore!

He's just Lily's friend!

questions.question: What is Princess Lily doing when she first encounters Ember the dragon?
options: Reading a book by a stream.

questions.question: Why does Ember the dragon appear sad to Lily?
options: Everyone is afraid of him and runs away.
He has a thorn in his paw.

questions.question: How do the palace guards initially react when they see Ember with Princess Lily?
options: They raise their swords and tell him to stay back.
They ask him to help with chores.

questions.question: What does the King say to Ember after seeing how gentle he is?
options: He can live in the stables.
He needs to prove his bravery first.

title: Pearl and the Underwater Palace
description: A story about pearl and the underwater palace.
content:
Pearl is a young mermaid! Her tail shimmers when she swims!

She lives in an underwater palace made of coral and shells.

Today, Pearl swims down a hallway she's never seen before!

At the end is a door covered in seaweed.

"I wonder what's in there," says Pearl.

Pearl opens the door.

Inside is a room filled with treasures!

Shiny pearls in bowls! Colorful shells on shelves! A silver mirror!

Pearl picks up a pink shell and holds it to her ear.

She hears the ocean, even though she's already in the ocean!

Pearl notices something rolled up in the corner.

A map!

The map shows the palace and the ocean.

An X marks a spot far from the palace.

"Treasure!" says Pearl. "I have to find it!"

Pearl finds her friend, Finn the fish.

"Finn! Look!" She shows him the map.

"That's near the kelp forest," says Finn. "Will you come with me?"

Finn nods. "Of course!"

They swim out into the open ocean!

The kelp forest is tall and green!

Pearl and Finn swim through carefully.

"The X should be close," says Pearl.

Finn points! "There! Behind that big rock!"

Behind the rock is a small wooden chest!

Pearl and Finn pull it out together.

"It's heavy!" says Finn.

Pearl opens it! Inside are glowing shells! They shine like stars!

"Beautiful," Pearl whispers.

Pearl and Finn carry the chest back to the palace.

"These belonged to your great-grandmother," says the Sea Queen.

"Can I keep them?" asks Pearl.

"Of course. But treasures are best when shared," says the King.

Pearl places the glowing shells in different rooms!

One in the throne room! One in the hallway! One in her bedroom!

The shells glow softly, lighting up the whole palace!

"Now everyone can enjoy them," says Pearl.

The palace feels warmer and brighter!

And Pearl knows there are still more rooms to explore!

questions.question: What does Pearl discover in the never-before-seen hallway of her palace?
options: A room full of treasures and a map
An exit to the dry land

questions.question: Who does Pearl ask to accompany her on the treasure hunt?
What treasure do Pearl and Finn find behind a big rock?
options: A small wooden chest with glowing shells

questions.question: What does Pearl do with the glowing shells after the King tells her treasures are best when shared?
options: She keeps them all in her bedroom.
She hides them in a secret spot.
She places them in different rooms to light up the palace.
She trades them for new toys.

title: The Fairy Who Lost Her Sparkle
description: A story about the fairy who lost her sparkle.
content:
Willow is a fairy with bright wings!

Her wings used to sparkle—gold, silver, shimmering!

But today, her wings are dull. No sparkle. No shine.

"What happened?" says Willow, worried.

She tries to shake her wings. Nothing!

She sits on a mushroom and frowns.

Her friend Skip, a bluebird, flies over.

"Why do you look sad?" asks Skip.

"My wings lost their sparkle," says Willow.

"Maybe you need to do something to get it back," says Skip.

They walk into the forest to look.

Willow hears a tiny voice. "Help! I'm stuck!"

A beetle is trapped under a leaf!

Willow lifts the leaf. The beetle crawls out!

"Thank you!" says the beetle.

Willow smiles. But her wings still don't sparkle.

They find a flower drooping in the sun.

"It needs water," says Skip.

Willow finds a puddle. She fills her hands with water and pours it on the flower!

The flower perks up! "Thank you, fairy!"

But Willow's wings are still dull.

They hear crying. A baby bunny is lost!

"I can't find my family," sniffles the bunny.

Willow and Skip search. They find the bunny family!

Willow leads the baby bunny back!

"Thank you!" says the mother bunny.

Suddenly, Skip gasps! "Willow! Look!"

Willow's wings are glowing! Just a little, but they're sparkling again!

"It's working!" says Willow.

"You helped the beetle. You helped the flower. You helped the bunny," says Skip. "Every time you helped, your wings got brighter!"

"So my sparkle comes from helping others?" asks Willow.

"I think so!" says Skip.

From that day on, Willow helps someone every day!

She carries seeds! She guides butterflies! She shares berries!

And every time she helps, her wings sparkle more!

Soon, they're brighter than ever—gold, silver, shimmering!

Willow knows exactly how to keep her sparkle!

questions.question: What is Willow's main problem at the beginning of the story?
options: Her wings have lost their sparkle.
She is lost in the forest.
She has run out of fairy dust.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT one of the ways Willow helps others in the forest?
options: She helps a beetle stuck under a leaf.
She gives food to a hungry squirrel.
She helps a lost baby bunny find its family.

questions.question: What does Skip the bluebird realize causes Willow's wings to sparkle again?
How does Willow ensure her wings remain sparkling from that day on?
options: She rubs them with special leaves.

title: Rosie's Rainbow Wings
description: A story about rosie's rainbow wings.
content:
Rosie is a young fairy with special wings!

Most fairies have wings that are one color—pink, blue, or green.

But Rosie's wings change colors!

When she's happy, they turn bright yellow!

When she's sad, they turn soft blue!

Rosie's wings show exactly how she feels!

This morning, Rosie wakes up and her wings are gray.

Gray is not a happy color.

"I just feel... gray," says Rosie.

Her mother hugs her. "Let's see if we can change that."

Rosie's mother gives her breakfast. Berries and honey!

Rosie eats a little. It tastes good!

Her wings turn from gray to light purple! A little better!

"Want to go outside?" asks her mother.

Rosie nods.

The garden is full of flowers!

Rosie sees a butterfly land on a daisy.

She watches it.

Her wings start to turn green! Calm green!

"Better?" asks her mother.

"A little," says Rosie.

Rosie hears a voice! "Rosie!"

It's her friend, Bloom!

"I came to play!" says Bloom.

Rosie's wings turn bright yellow! Happy yellow!

"You came!" says Rosie, smiling.

Rosie and Bloom play in the garden!

They hide behind trees! They chase each other!

Rosie laughs! Her wings turn orange—excited orange!

When they sit to rest, her wings turn soft blue—peaceful blue!

By afternoon, Rosie's wings have been many colors!

Gray, purple, green, yellow, orange, pink, blue!

"Your wings are beautiful," says Bloom. "They show how you feel!"

Right now, they're yellow. Happy yellow!

"I'm glad you came," says Rosie. "I felt gray this morning. But now I feel happy!"

That evening, Rosie sits with her mother.

"My wings were so many colors today," says Rosie.

"That's okay," says her mother. "Feelings change. All feelings are okay."

Rosie nods. "I like that my wings show my feelings!"

Rosie yawns. Her wings turn sleepy lavender.

"Time for bed," says her mother.

Tomorrow, her wings will be new colors! And that's okay!

questions.question: What makes Rosie's fairy wings unique?
options: They can glow in the dark.
They change colors based on her feelings.
They are made of real flowers.

questions.question: What color are Rosie's wings when she first wakes up feeling 'gray'?
What causes Rosie's wings to turn bright yellow?
options: Her friend Bloom coming to play.

questions.question: What important message does Rosie's mother convey about feelings at the end of the story?
options: Feelings change, and all feelings are okay.
You should hide your sad feelings.
Wings should always be one color.

title: The Fairy's Magic Paintbrush
description: A story about the fairy's magic paintbrush.
content:
Clover is a young fairy who loves to paint!

She paints flowers! Trees! The sky!

One day, Clover finds a paintbrush in the grass.

It glows softly!

Clover picks it up. "I wonder what this does."

She dips it in blue paint. Touches it to a rock.

The blue paint swirls and becomes water!

"The paintbrush is magic!" gasps Clover.

She tries again. She paints yellow on the ground.

The paint glows and becomes real flowers—bright yellow daisies!

"This is amazing!" says Clover.

Clover sees a bird on a branch. The bird looks thin and tired.

"Are you hungry?" asks Clover.

The bird nods weakly. "I can't find any berries."

Clover dips her brush in red paint.

She paints berries on the bush!

The paint glows and becomes real, juicy berries!

The bird eats the berries happily! One, two, three, four!

Soon, the bird looks healthier!

"Thank you, fairy!" says the bird.

Clover keeps walking, looking for someone else to help.

Clover finds a rabbit shivering under a tree.

"What's wrong?" asks Clover.

"I'm so cold. My burrow has a hole in it," says the rabbit.

Clover dips her brush in brown paint.

She paints a patch over the hole!

The paint glows and becomes real, solid dirt!

The rabbit goes inside. "It's warm now! Thank you, fairy!"

Clover continues through the forest.

Clover meets a butterfly sitting on a leaf.

"Why do you look sad?" asks Clover.

"I'm lonely. All my friends flew south," says the butterfly.

Clover dips her brush in many colors—orange, yellow, purple, pink!

She paints butterflies in the air!

The paint glows... and the painted butterflies come to life!

The butterflies flutter around! "Friends!" says the butterfly happily. "Thank you!"

Clover looks at her magic paintbrush. It's still glowing!

"I can help so many people with this," says Clover.

And every day, Clover uses her magic paintbrush to help others!

The magic never runs out. Because kindness never runs out either!

questions.question: What special ability does Clover's magic paintbrush have when she dips it in blue paint and touches a rock?
options: It turns the rock into a bird.
The paint swirls and becomes water.

questions.question: How does Clover help the hungry bird who can't find berries?
options: She paints real, juicy berries on a bush.
She flies to a far-off tree to gather berries.
She shares her own lunch with the bird.
She turns a leaf into a berry.

questions.question: How does Clover use her magic paintbrush to help the shivering rabbit?
options: She paints a warm blanket for it.
She paints a patch over the hole in its burrow.
She paints a new, bigger burrow.

questions.question: What happens when Clover paints colorful butterflies in the air for the lonely butterfly?
options: The painted butterflies come to life and become friends.
The colors disappear into the air.

title: Stella and the Sleepy Stars
description: A story about stella and the sleepy stars.
content:
Stella is a star fairy!

Every night, she helps the stars get ready for bed.

As the sun sets, Stella flies up into the sky.

The stars are still twinkling brightly!

"Time to get ready," Stella calls.

But the stars keep twinkling!

Stella flies to the biggest star first.

"You've been shining all night. Aren't you tired?"

The big star yawns. "A little."

"Then it's time to rest," says Stella.

She touches the star with her wand. Sparkles fall!

The star's light grows dimmer. Softer.

"That feels nice," says the star, yawning.

Stella flies to the next star. And the next. And the next!

Each time, she touches them with her wand.

Each time, the stars' lights grow softer!

"Good night," Stella whispers.

Soon, many stars are resting!

But one small star is still shining brightly!

"It's time to sleep, little star."

"I'm not tired! I want to keep shining!" says the small star.

"Even stars need rest," says Stella.

"But what if no one sees me tomorrow?"

"You'll shine even brighter after you rest," says Stella.

Stella settles on a cloud beside the star.

"Let me tell you a story," she says.

She tells about the moon, who rests every morning and comes back brighter!

She tells about the sun, who sets every evening and rises strong!

"Rest makes you stronger," says Stella.

The small star listens. "Really? I'll be brighter after I rest?"

"Really," says Stella.

The star yawns. "Okay. I'll try."

Stella touches the star gently.

The star's light grows softer, dimmer, peaceful.

"Good night, little star," Stella whispers.

Stella looks around. All the stars are resting! Their lights are soft and faint!

The sky is dark and quiet.

"Good work, Stella," says the moon.

Stella flies down to her cloud bed.

She's tired too!

She lies down and pulls a cloud blanket over herself.

Above her, the sleeping stars twinkle just a little.

Stella closes her eyes.

Tomorrow night, the stars will wake up and shine brightly again!

questions.question: What is Stella's job as a star fairy?
options: To help the stars get ready for bed.

questions.question: How does Stella help the big stars get ready for bed?
options: She tells them to close their eyes.
She touches them with her wand, and their light grows dimmer.
She covers them with cloud blankets.

questions.question: Why is the small star initially unwilling to go to sleep?
options: It is afraid of the dark.
It wants to keep shining and fears no one will see it tomorrow.
It is too excited to sleep.
It has to finish a game first.

questions.question: What story does Stella tell the small star to convince it that resting is good?
options: A story about a brave knight.
A story about the moon and sun, who rest and return brighter.
A story about a sleepy cloud.
A story about a lost star.

title: Finn and the Dragon's Egg
description: A story about finn and the dragon's egg.
content:
Finn is exploring the forest near his village.

He's a young knight with a wooden sword and a brave heart!

Behind a fallen log, Finn finds something shiny!

An egg! A big egg covered in green scales!

Finn touches it gently. It's warm!

"A dragon egg," Finn whispers.

Finn looks around. No dragon nest!

The egg shouldn't be alone. It needs its mother!

Finn picks up the egg carefully. Heavy, but he can carry it!

"I'll find where you belong," says Finn.

He starts walking deeper into the forest.

Finn walks for a long time. The trail gets steeper!

Then he hears a rumbling sound. Like thunder!

Finn keeps walking toward the sound.

Around a big rock, Finn sees her!

A giant green dragon! Bigger than Finn's house!

The dragon looks sad. She's searching through bushes.

"Looking for something?" Finn calls.

The dragon turns. She sees Finn holding the egg!

Her eyes go wide!

"I found this in the forest," says Finn. "Is it yours?"

The dragon comes closer. Slowly. Carefully.

She sniffs the egg. Then makes a happy rumbling sound!

"Thank you, little knight," says the dragon.

Finn hands her the egg gently.

The dragon cradles it!

"You brought my baby back," says the dragon. "You are very brave."

"I just wanted to help," says Finn.

The dragon plucks a green scale from her tail. It shimmers!

"Take this. A dragon scale brings protection!"

Finn takes the scale. "Thank you!"

The dragon offers to fly Finn home!

Finn climbs onto her back. They soar through the air!

The trees look tiny below!

Finn laughs. "This is amazing!"

The dragon lands near Finn's village.

"Will I see you again?" asks Finn.

"Anytime you need help, hold the scale. I'll come," says the dragon.

Finn waves as she flies away.

He looks at the green scale in his hand. It still shimmers!

He helped someone today. And he made a dragon friend!

Being brave feels good!

questions.question: What shiny object does Finn find behind a fallen log in the forest?
options: A piece of a knight's armor

questions.question: Why does Finn decide to carry the egg deeper into the forest?
options: He wants to keep it as a pet.
He wants to show it to his friends.
He believes it belongs to a dragon mother and shouldn't be alone.
He plans to cook it for dinner.

questions.question: What gift does the mother dragon give Finn for returning her egg?
options: A shimmering green dragon scale for protection.
A ride on her back to a hidden treasure.

questions.question: What does the dragon offer to do for Finn at the end of their meeting?
options: Help him find more dragon eggs.

title: Leo and the Giant's Garden
description: A story about leo and the giant's garden.
content:
Leo lives in a small village at the bottom of a hill.

At the top is a giant's garden. No one goes there!

The wall is too tall!

But Leo is curious. He wants to see inside!

One morning, Leo climbs the hill.

Leo walks along the wall. He finds a crack! Small, but big enough for him!

Leo squeezes through.

On the other side, everything is HUGE!

Flowers as tall as trees! Grass up to Leo's knees!

"Whoa," says Leo.

Leo hears crying. He finds a giant sitting on a bench!

The giant is huge! But he looks sad.

"Why are you crying?" Leo calls up.

"My garden is dying. I don't know why!" says the giant.

Leo looks at the garden. The flowers are drooping! The vegetables look sick!

"When did you water them?" asks Leo.

"This morning. I water every day," says the giant.

"Can I see your watering can?" asks Leo.

Leo climbs up to look inside the can.

The water smells funny. Bad!

"This water is old! That's why your plants are sick!"

The giant gasps. "Really?"

"You need fresh water. Is there a stream nearby?"

The giant nods. "Yes!"

The giant picks up his watering can.

"Will you come with me?" asks the giant.

Leo nods. "Of course!"

The giant puts Leo on his shoulder.

They walk to the stream. The giant fills his can with fresh, clean water!

Back at the garden, the giant waters all the plants!

Leo helps by pointing. "This one! And that one!"

The giant is careful. Gentle.

All the plants have fresh water!

"Thank you, Leo. You saved my garden!" says the giant.

The giant walks Leo back to the crack in the wall.

"Come visit anytime. I'll leave the gate unlocked!"

"I will! And I'll teach you more about plants!" says Leo.

Leo walks down the hill, smiling.

He helped a giant today. And made a new friend!

questions.question: How does Leo manage to enter the giant's garden?
options: He squeezes through a crack in the wall.

questions.question: Why is the giant crying when Leo finds him?
options: He has lost his favorite toy.

questions.question: What does Leo discover is the problem with the giant's garden?
options: The plants are getting too much sun.
The giant is watering them with old, bad-smelling water.
Insects are eating all the plants.
The soil is not rich enough.

questions.question: What does the giant promise Leo at the end of the story?
options: To give him all the vegetables from the garden.
To leave the garden gate unlocked so Leo can visit anytime.
To teach Leo how to be a giant.

title: Kai and the Storm Sword
description: A story about kai and the storm sword.
content:
Kai is playing by the river when the storm comes!

Dark clouds! Thunder! Lightning!

Then something falls from the clouds!

CLANG!

A sword lands in the mud near Kai's feet!

It glows blue! And it hums!

Kai picks up the sword.

The moment he touches it, the humming gets louder!

The sword feels light. Like it's made of air!

Kai swings it. Whoosh! A small breeze blows!

"This sword controls wind!" says Kai.

A tiny glowing person appears!

She has silver wings!

"I am Gale. Guardian of the Storm Sword," she says.

"I found your sword," says Kai.

"The sword found you. It only appears to those who are brave," says Gale.

"Come," says Gale.

Kai follows Gale through the forest.

They reach a village!

A huge windstorm is blowing! Roofs are flying off! Trees are breaking!

"The storm is out of control. Only the Storm Sword can stop it," says Gale.

"Point the sword at the wind and command it to stop," says Gale.

Kai raises the sword. He points it at the swirling wind.

"STOP!" Kai shouts.

The sword glows! A beam of blue light shoots out!

The wind... slows down! Just a little!

"Keep going!" says Gale.

Kai focuses. He points the sword at the strongest winds!

"STOP!" he shouts again.

The sword hums! The light gets brighter!

The wind slows more! And more!

Finally, it stops completely!

The storm is gone! The sky clears!

The village is safe!

The villagers come out. "You saved us!" says an old woman.

Kai smiles. "The sword helped."

"No. You helped. The sword only works for someone brave," says Gale.

"Can I keep it?" asks Kai.

Gale nods. "The sword is yours now. Use it to protect others."

Kai holds the sword carefully.

He stopped a storm today. He saved a village!

Being brave feels powerful!

questions.question: What happens the moment Kai touches the glowing blue sword?
Who is Gale, the tiny glowing person who appears after Kai finds the sword?
What problem is the village facing that Kai needs to solve with the Storm Sword?
What does Gale tell Kai about how the Storm Sword works?
options: It only works with a magic spell.
It works by itself without any commands.
It only appears to and works for those who are brave.

title: Theo and the Underwater Crown
description: A story about theo and the underwater crown.
content:
Theo loves to swim!

Every day, he dives off the big rock by the beach.

Today, Theo dives deeper than usual.

At the bottom, something glows!

Theo swims closer. It's a crown! Made of silver and covered in seashells!

Theo grabs it and swims back up.

Theo sits on the beach, looking at the crown.

It's beautiful. But it's not his!

"Someone must be looking for this," says Theo.

He decides to find the owner.

Theo sees a crab on a rock. The crab looks sad.

"What's wrong?" asks Theo.

"I lost my king's crown," says the crab. "He's going to be upset!"

Theo's eyes go wide. "Your king?"

"Yes. The King of the Crabs. His crown fell into the ocean yesterday."

Theo takes the crown out of his bag. "Is this it?"

The crab's eyes go HUGE. "YES! You found it!"

"The king will be so happy! Come with me!" says the crab.

Theo follows the crab to a pile of rocks.

Under the rocks is an underwater cave!

Theo takes a deep breath and dives.

Inside, the King of the Crabs sits on a coral throne!

He's bigger than the other crabs! He has a seaweed beard!

"This boy found your crown!" says the little crab.

Theo holds up the crown.

The king's face lights up! "My crown!"

The king puts the crown back on. "You are very honest! You could have kept it."

"It wasn't mine," says Theo.

The king nods. "As a reward, I give you this."

He hands Theo a small shell. "This is a breathing shell. Hold it when you dive, and you can breathe underwater!"

Theo holds the shell. He dives deeper.

He breathes! Underwater! Like he has gills!

"This is amazing!" says Theo.

Theo swims back to the surface.

Now he can explore the whole ocean!

Theo dives back down. He swims past fish! He sees coral reefs! He waves to dolphins!

The ocean is full of wonders!

Being honest feels rewarding!

questions.question: What special item did Theo find at the bottom of the ocean?
Why did Theo decide not to keep the crown he found?
options: He knew it belonged to someone else
He didn't like how it looked

questions.question: What was Theo's reward for returning the King of the Crabs' crown?
What could Theo do with his new breathing shell?

title: Jasper and the Knight's Shield
description: A story about jasper and the knight's shield.
content:
Jasper walks through the market with his father.

In a shop window, Jasper sees a shield! Dusty and dented, with a lion painted on it!

"Can I go inside?" asks Jasper.

An old man sits behind the counter.

"That shield belonged to Sir Lionheart. A great knight!" says the old man.

"Can I hold it?" asks Jasper.

The old man hands Jasper the shield.

The moment Jasper touches it, the shield glows!

The lion on the front moves! It roars silently!

"It chose you," says the old man. "The shield only glows for someone brave. Take it!"

Jasper carries the shield home.

He hears shouting! A runaway cart is rolling down the hill! Headed for children!

"Move!" someone yells.

The children freeze, scared!

Jasper runs toward them!

Jasper raises the shield. He plants his feet!

The cart crashes into the shield! BANG!

The shield holds! It doesn't crack!

The cart stops! The children are safe!

The lion on the shield glows brighter!

"The shield protected me," says Jasper.

The children run over. "You saved us!"

An old woman walks over. "That's Sir Lionheart's shield. You're a true knight now."

Jasper wants to meet Sir Lionheart.

He walks to a cottage by the woods.

An old knight answers the door.

"I have your shield," says Jasper.

Sir Lionheart smiles. "It was mine. But now it's yours."

"A knight's job is to protect. Will you do that?" asks Sir Lionheart.

Jasper looks at the shield. The lion watches him.

"I promise," says Jasper.

Sir Lionheart pats his shoulder. "Then you're a knight."

Jasper walks home, shield on his arm.

He protected people. And made a promise!

Being a knight feels important!

questions.question: What special feature did the shield have when Jasper touched it?
How did Jasper use the shield to help the children?
options: He threw it at a monster
He used it to stop a runaway cart
He used it to build a fort
He used it to signal for help

questions.question: Who was the original owner of the shield?
What promise did Jasper make to Sir Lionheart?
options: To polish the shield every day

title: River and the Forest Torch
description: A story about river and the forest torch.
content:
River is walking home from his friend's house.

It's getting dark. The forest path is hard to see!

River wishes he had a light.

Suddenly, he sees a glow in the bushes!

A torch! Burning brightly!

"Magic," River whispers.

River picks up the torch.

A warm voice speaks. "Hello, traveler."

"The torch is talking!" says River.

"I am the Forest Torch. I light the way for those who are lost," says the voice.

"I'm not lost. Just walking home."

"Then I will help you. Hold me high."

River holds the torch up!

The light spreads wide! It lights up the whole path!

River can see everything! Trees! Stones! The way home!

"Thank you," says River.

The forest doesn't feel scary anymore!

River hears a voice. "Help! Is anyone there?"

He finds a girl sitting by a tree. Her ankle is hurt!

"I tripped. I can't walk. And it's getting dark," she says.

River holds up the torch. "I can help you get home."

The girl leans on River's shoulder.

River holds the torch high so they can both see!

They walk slowly through the forest.

"What's your name?" asks the girl.

"River. What's yours?"

"Ember. Thank you for helping me."

They reach Ember's village.

Her mother runs out. "Ember! I was worried!"

"River helped me. He had a magic torch," says Ember.

Ember's mother looks at the torch. "That's the Forest Torch. It only appears to kind people. Keep it!"

"Will you stay with me?" asks River.

"As long as you use me to help others," says the torch.

River nods. "I promise."

The torch burns brighter!

From that day on, River carries the Forest Torch!

Whenever someone is lost, he finds them!

Whenever someone needs light, he brings it!

The forest is never dark when River is around!

Being helpful lights the way!

questions.question: What glowing object did River find in the bushes?
What did the Forest Torch say its purpose was?
options: To light the way for those who are lost

questions.question: Who did River help with the Forest Torch?
options: A girl with a hurt ankle
An old man looking for berries

questions.question: What condition did the Forest Torch have for River to keep it?
options: As long as he kept it polished
As long as he used it to help others
As long as he never let its flame go out
As long as he only used it at night

title: Ash and the Stone Guardian
description: A story about ash and the stone guardian.
content:
Ash lives in a village with a big stone statue in the square.

The statue is a knight! Tall! Strong! Holding a stone sword!

One evening, Ash sees something strange.

The statue's eyes are glowing!

Ash walks closer. The statue moves!

Its stone arm lifts! Its head turns!

"Do not be afraid," says the statue. Its voice is deep and slow.

"You're alive?" says Ash.

"I am the Stone Guardian. I wake when danger is near."

"What danger?" asks Ash.

The Guardian points toward the hills. "A rockslide. It will hit the village tonight."

"Can you stop it?"

"I am strong but slow. I cannot reach the hills in time. But you can run fast. Ring the warning bell!"

Ash runs to the bell tower!

He climbs the stairs fast!

At the top, Ash grabs the rope and pulls!

CLANG! CLANG! CLANG!

People come out. "What's wrong?"

"Rockslide! Get to high ground!" Ash shouts.

The villagers listen! They grab their children! They help the elders!

Everyone moves to the high ground!

Ash keeps ringing until everyone is safe!

Then he runs back to the square.

The Stone Guardian has moved!

He's standing at the edge of the village, facing the hills!

"They're safe," says Ash.

"Good. Now we wait," says the Guardian.

Rocks start tumbling down the hill!

The Guardian raises his stone sword!

CRASH!

The rocks hit the sword! They break apart! They scatter harmlessly!

When the rockslide stops, the Guardian lowers his sword.

"You saved the village. You acted quickly," says the Guardian.

"You warned me," says Ash.

The Guardian's stone face smiles. "We protected them together."

The Guardian returns to the square and becomes still.

But Ash knows the truth.

The Guardian is always watching!

Being quick can save lives!

questions.question: What strange thing did Ash notice about the stone statue in the square?
options: It had a crack in its arm

questions.question: What danger did the Stone Guardian warn Ash about?
How did Ash warn the villagers about the danger?
options: He sent a bird with a message

questions.question: How did the Stone Guardian protect the village from the rockslide?
options: He built a wall of stones
He used his stone sword to break the rocks
He pushed the rocks away with his hands
He used magic to make the rocks disappear

title: Blaze and the Phoenix Feather
description: A story about blaze and the phoenix feather.
content:
Blaze is playing in the field when something falls from the sky!

A feather!

But not a normal feather. This one glows orange and red! Like fire!

Blaze picks it up. It's warm, but it doesn't burn!

"A phoenix feather," Blaze whispers.

Blaze holds the feather up. It glows brighter!

A small flame appears in Blaze's hand!

The flame doesn't hurt! It dances in his palm like a tiny friend!

"Whoa," says Blaze.

The flame speaks in a crackling voice. "Hello, keeper. I am Phoenix Fire. The feather chose you!"

"Chose me for what?" asks Blaze.

"To carry the phoenix's flame. To bring warmth and light where it's needed."

That night, a freezing wind blows through the village!

Colder than ever! Snow falls! The fires go out!

People huddle in their homes, shivering!

Blaze looks at the phoenix feather.

"This is when I'm needed," says Blaze.

He runs outside!

Blaze goes to the first house.

He touches the feather to the cold hearth.

WHOOSH! A warm fire springs to life!

"Thank you!" says the family.

Blaze runs to the next house! And the next!

At each one, he touches the feather to the hearth!

Each time, a fire lights!

Blaze reaches the village square.

Everyone is gathered, cold and scared!

"We need a fire!" someone says.

Blaze holds up the phoenix feather!

He touches it to the pile of wood!

A huge bonfire erupts! Warm! Bright! Beautiful!

Everyone gathers around!

As the fire burns, something rises from it!

A bird made of flames! The phoenix!

It spreads its fiery wings and looks at Blaze.

"You used my feather well," says the phoenix.

"I just wanted to help," says Blaze.

The phoenix nods. "The feather is yours. Use it wisely."

The phoenix flies into the sky, leaving sparks!

The village is warm now! Safe!

Blaze looks at the feather. It still glows!

He's the keeper of the phoenix flame!

Being warm-hearted brings light to others!

questions.question: What unique item did Blaze find falling from the sky?
What happened when Blaze picked up the phoenix feather?
options: A small flame appeared in his hand

questions.question: How did Blaze help the village during the freezing wind?
options: He used the feather to light fires in homes
He made hot soup for everyone

questions.question: What animal appeared from the bonfire Blaze started in the village square?

title: The Fairy Who Collected Wishes
description: A story about the fairy who collected wishes.
content:
Pip is a small fairy who lives near the meadow.

Every morning, she flies out looking for dandelions!

The white, fluffy ones!

Pip knows a secret. Each white puff holds a wish inside!

Today, Pip finds three dandelions!

She touches one. The white seeds float up!

Pip flies after the floating seeds!

She cups her tiny hands and catches one! Then another! Then one more!

Each seed tingles in her palms! Warm and light!

These are wishes now! Real wishes!

Pip tucks them in her pocket.

"I'll find someone who needs you," she whispers.

Near a big oak tree, Pip hears crying.

A small bird sits on a branch. Its wing droops!

"What's wrong?" asks Pip.

"My wing hurts. I can't fly," says the bird.

Pip pulls out one dandelion seed. "Make a wish."

The bird closes its eyes.

Pip blows gently on the seed. It sparkles!

The bird's wing straightens! It flaps! "It doesn't hurt anymore!"

The bird flies up to its nest! "Thank you!"

One wish used! Two left!

Pip finds drooping flowers. Their petals are dry!

"You need water," says Pip.

She takes out the second seed. Sets it on the soil and blows!

The seed sparkles and sinks!

Water bubbles up from the ground! A tiny spring!

The water flows around the flowers' roots!

The flowers lift their heads! Their petals brighten!

Two wishes used! One left!

Back at the meadow, Pip sees a rabbit sitting alone.

"Why do you look sad?" asks Pip.

"I'm lonely. I wish I had a friend," says the rabbit.

Pip holds out the last seed. "Blow on this and make your wish."

The rabbit blows! The seed floats up and sparkles!

From across the meadow, another rabbit hops over!

"Hello! Want to play?" says the new rabbit.

"Yes!" says the first rabbit.

The two rabbits hop away together!

All three wishes used! All three worked!

Pip flies home, already thinking about tomorrow's dandelions!

questions.question: What does Pip the fairy collect from dandelions?
What happened when Pip blew gently on a dandelion seed for the little bird?
options: The bird sang a beautiful song
The seed turned into a berry

questions.question: How did Pip use the second wish to help the drooping flowers?
options: She gave them colorful new petals
She made a tiny spring of water appear
She protected them from the sun

questions.question: What was the rabbit's wish that Pip helped grant?
options: To be able to jump higher

title: The Lion and the Thorn
description: Follow the journey of male lion, female mouse in this story about the lion and the thorn.
content:
A big lion walks through the forest.

He is strong. He has a loud roar.

Suddenly, the lion stops. "OW!"

Something is stuck in his paw.

A sharp thorn!

The lion tries to pull it out, but it hurts too much.

The lion sits down. He holds his paw and whimpers.

A tiny mouse hears the sound.

She runs over. "What's wrong, Lion?"

"A thorn is stuck in my paw," says the lion. "It hurts."

The mouse looks closely. The thorn is very small.

"I can help," says the mouse.

The lion looks at her. "You? But you're so tiny."

"Tiny can be helpful," says the mouse.

The lion holds still.

The mouse uses her little teeth. She tugs on the thorn gently.

Pull. Pull. Pull.

POP!

The thorn comes out!

The lion lifts his paw. "It doesn't hurt anymore!"

He looks at the tiny mouse. "Thank you. You saved me."

"You're welcome," says the mouse.

The lion smiles. "I thought I was too big to need help from someone small."

"Everyone needs help sometimes," says the mouse. "Big or small."

The lion nods. "You're right."

From that day on, the lion and the mouse are friends.

When the lion walks through the forest, the mouse rides on his back.

They help each other.

The lion is strong. The mouse is clever.

Together, they make a great team.

questions.question: What was stuck in the lion's paw?
Who offered to help the lion with his painful paw?
How did the mouse remove the thorn from the lion's paw?
options: She pulled it out with her little teeth
She asked other animals for help

questions.question: What lesson did the lion learn from the mouse?
options: That he shouldn't trust small animals
That he should always be careful where he steps
That even big creatures sometimes need help from small ones

title: The Ant's Heavy Load
description: Follow the journey of female ant in this story about the ant's heavy load.
content:
Annie is a little black ant.

She finds a big crumb of bread near a picnic blanket.

It's the biggest crumb she's ever seen!

"I'll bring this home," says Annie.

She tries to lift it. Too heavy!

Annie pushes the crumb. It moves just a little.

She pushes again. The crumb rolls a tiny bit.

Annie is tired already.

"This is too hard," she says.

But she doesn't want to leave the crumb behind.

Annie's friend, Benny, walks by.

"What are you doing, Annie?" asks Benny.

"Trying to move this crumb," says Annie. "But it's too heavy."

Benny looks at the crumb. "I'll help!"

Benny pushes from one side. Annie pushes from the other.

The crumb rolls a little farther!

Two more ants see them pushing.

"Need help?" they ask.

"Yes, please!" say Annie and Benny.

Now four ants are pushing the crumb.

It rolls faster now. Down the path. Closer to the ant hill.

More ants join in!

Five ants. Six ants. Seven ants!

They all push together.

The crumb rolls and rolls. All the way to the ant hill!

"We did it!" cheers Annie.

The ants share the crumb. Everyone gets a piece.

Annie smiles. "I couldn't do it alone. But together, we could!"

Benny nods. "Working together makes hard things easier."

The ants munch on their crumb happily.

Together is better.

questions.question: What did Annie the ant find that was too heavy to carry alone?
Who was the first ant to offer help to Annie?
How did the ants finally manage to move the heavy crumb?
options: More and more ants joined in to push it together
They waited for the wind to blow it

questions.question: What important lesson did Annie learn from this experience?
options: It's better to find smaller crumbs
Working alone is the fastest way
Working together makes hard things easier
Ants are stronger than they look

title: How the Bear Lost His Tail
description: Follow the journey of male bear in this story about how the bear lost his tail.
content:
Long, long ago, bears had long, fluffy tails.

Bruno the bear had the longest tail of all.

He was very proud of it.

"My tail is beautiful," Bruno said. "Long and fluffy and perfect."

He swished it everywhere he went.

One winter day, Bruno saw a fox by the frozen pond.

The fox had a pile of fish.

"Where did you get all those fish?" asked Bruno.

The fox smiled. "I used my tail to catch them!"

Bruno's eyes went wide. "Your tail? How?"

"It's easy," said the fox. "Just stick your tail in the ice hole and wait. The fish will bite!"

Bruno looked at the frozen pond. There was a small hole in the ice.

"I'll try it!" said Bruno.

He sat down and put his long tail through the hole.

Bruno sat and waited.

And waited.

And waited.

His tail started to feel cold. Very cold.

"How long do I wait?" Bruno called to the fox.

But the fox was gone!

Bruno tried to pull his tail out.

It wouldn't move!

His tail was frozen in the ice!

Bruno pulled harder. SNAP!

His tail broke off! Only a tiny stub was left.

"My beautiful tail!" cried Bruno.

From that day on, all bears have short tails.

Bruno learned not to believe tricky foxes.

He also learned that short tails are just fine.

They don't get frozen in ice.

And that's how bears got short tails.

questions.question: What special physical feature did bears have long ago, according to the story?
Who tricked Bruno the bear into putting his tail in the ice hole?
What did the trickster animal tell Bruno would happen if he put his tail in the ice hole?
What happened to Bruno's tail when he tried to pull it out of the ice?
options: It broke off, leaving a stub
It became very cold and numb

title: The Rainbow Maker
description: Follow the journey of female fairy in this story about the rainbow maker.
content:
After a big storm, the sky is gray and wet.

All the forest animals look sad.

A tiny fairy named Iris flies down from the clouds.

She has colorful wings and a paintbrush in her hand.

"I will make something to cheer everyone up," says Iris.

Iris dips her paintbrush in red paint.

She paints a big red stripe across the sky.

Then she dips her brush in orange.

She paints an orange stripe right next to the red one.

The animals below watch. "What is she doing?"

Iris keeps painting.

Yellow stripe. Green stripe. Blue stripe.

Each color lines up next to the last one.

The sky starts to glow!

"It's beautiful!" says a bird.

Iris adds two more colors.

Indigo. Violet.

Now there are seven colorful stripes arching across the sky.

It glows brighter and brighter.

Iris steps back to look. "Perfect!"

The animals stare up at the colorful arch.

"What is it?" asks a rabbit.

"It's a rainbow," says Iris. "It appears after storms to remind everyone that sunshine is coming."

The animals smile. The rainbow makes them feel happy!

From that day on, rainbows appear after every storm.

Iris paints them with her magic paintbrush.

And whenever people see a rainbow, they remember:

After the rain, something beautiful always comes.

questions.question: What is the name of the tiny fairy who flies down from the clouds after a storm?
What was the sky like after the big storm, making the forest animals sad?
What did Iris use to paint the colorful stripes across the sky?
How many colors did Iris use to make the rainbow?

title: The Crow and the Water Jug
description: Follow the journey of male crow in this story about the crow and the water jug.
content:
Crow is very thirsty.

He flies over fields. Over trees. Looking for water.

Finally, he sees a tall jug sitting on a rock.

"Water!" croaks Crow.

He lands next to the jug and looks inside.

There IS water in the jug!

But it's at the bottom. Too far down.

Crow sticks his beak in. He can't reach!

He tries to tip the jug over. Too heavy!

"How do I get the water?" wonders Crow.

Crow looks around. He sees small pebbles on the ground.

He picks up one pebble in his beak.

He drops it into the jug. Plop!

The water moves up. Just a tiny bit.

"Hmmm," thinks Crow.

Crow picks up another pebble. Plop!

The water rises a little more!

Crow gets excited. He picks up more pebbles!

Plop! Plop! Plop!

One pebble at a time. Into the jug.

The water keeps rising!

Higher. Higher. Closer to the top!

Crow keeps dropping pebbles. He doesn't stop.

Almost there!

Finally, the water reaches the top of the jug!

Crow dips his beak in and drinks.

Cool. Fresh. Perfect!

"I did it!" croaks Crow happily.

Sometimes, small steps solve big problems.

questions.question: What was the crow's main problem at the beginning of the story?
options: The water in the jug was too far down.
He was lost in the forest.
The jug was too small for him.

questions.question: How did the crow first try to get the water from the jug?
options: He tried to tip the jug over.
He stuck his beak in to reach.
He asked other animals for help.

questions.question: What did the crow use to make the water rise in the jug?
What lesson did the crow's actions teach?
options: Small steps can solve big problems.

title: The Honest Woodcutter
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the honest woodcutter.
content:
A boy named Sam plays by the river every day.

He has a toy boat. Wooden with a red sail.

Today, Sam is sailing his boat in the shallow water.

The boat floats beautifully!

Sam loves his boat.

Sam pushes the boat too hard.

SPLASH!

The boat goes into the deep part of the river!

The current pulls it away. Faster and faster!

"My boat!" cries Sam.

He watches it disappear downstream.

Sam sits on the riverbank. Sad.

Suddenly, the water begins to glow!

A spirit rises from the river. She's made of water and light.

"Why are you crying?" asks the River Spirit.

"I lost my boat," says Sam.

The River Spirit dives back into the water.

She comes back up holding a boat!

But it's gold! Shiny and golden!

"Is this your boat?" asks the River Spirit.

Sam shakes his head. "No. Mine is wooden."

The River Spirit dives again.

This time she holds up a silver boat! Sparkly and beautiful!

"Is THIS your boat?" asks the River Spirit.

Sam shakes his head again. "No. Mine has a red sail."

The River Spirit smiles.

She dives one more time.

She comes back with Sam's wooden boat! Red sail and all!

"THIS is my boat!" says Sam happily.

"You're honest," says the River Spirit. "You can keep all three boats as a reward."

Sam takes all three boats. But his favorite is still the wooden one.

Being honest is always the best choice.

questions.question: What kind of boat did Sam lose in the river?
options: A gold boat with a blue sail.
A wooden boat with a red sail.
A silver boat with a green sail.
A plastic boat with no sail.

questions.question: What was the first boat the River Spirit showed to Sam?
Why did the River Spirit give Sam all three boats?
options: Because Sam was the fastest runner.

questions.question: What is the main lesson of 'The Honest Woodcutter'?
options: It's good to play by the river.
Gold boats are better than wooden boats.
Honesty is always the best choice.

title: The Hare's Lesson
description: Follow the journey of male hare in this story about the hare's lesson.
content:
Hare is the fastest animal in the forest.

He can run faster than anyone!

"I'm so fast!" brags Hare. "Nobody can beat me!"

Turtle overhears. "I can race you."

Hare laughs. "You? You're so slow!"

But Turtle doesn't give up. "Let's race to the big oak tree."

All the forest animals gather to watch.

"Ready. Set. Go!" shouts Fox.

Hare zooms ahead! So fast! He's already halfway there!

Turtle moves slowly. Step. Step. Step.

Hare looks back. Turtle is so far behind!

"This is too easy," says Hare. "I have plenty of time."

He sees a shady spot under a bush.

"I'll just rest for a minute," says Hare.

He lies down. So comfortable...

Hare closes his eyes. Just for a moment.

But the warm sun feels so nice.

Hare falls asleep!

Meanwhile, Turtle keeps walking. Step. Step. Step.

Slow but steady. Never stopping.

Turtle passes the sleeping Hare.

Step. Step. Step.

The other animals watch quietly.

Turtle gets closer to the oak tree.

Closer. Closer.

Hare wakes up!

He jumps up. "Oh no! How long was I asleep?"

He looks ahead. Turtle is almost at the oak tree!

Hare runs as fast as he can!

But it's too late. Turtle touches the tree first.

"I win!" says Turtle.

Hare learned an important lesson: Never be too confident. Slow and steady wins the race.

questions.question: What did Hare brag about in the forest?
Why did Hare stop during the race with Turtle?
options: He felt tired and took a nap.
He wanted to wait for Turtle.

questions.question: How did Turtle win the race?
options: He ran very fast at the end.
He moved slowly but never stopped.

questions.question: What important lesson did Hare learn at the end of the story?
options: Slow and steady wins the race.
Oak trees are very far away.

title: The Wind and the Sun
description: Follow the journey of inanimate elements in this story about the wind and the sun.
content:
High in the sky, Wind and Sun are arguing.

"I'm stronger than you!" says Wind.

"No, I'm stronger!" says Sun.

They argue and argue.

Finally, they decide to have a contest.

Down below, a man walks along the road.

He wears a thick coat.

"See that man?" says Sun. "Whoever can make him take off his coat is the strongest."

"Easy!" says Wind. "I'll go first!"

Wind starts blowing!

WHOOOOSH!

Strong gusts of wind push against the man.

The wind pulls at his coat.

But what does the man do?

The man holds his coat tighter!

He buttons it up. He wraps it around himself.

The harder Wind blows, the tighter the man holds his coat!

Wind blows and blows. But the coat stays on.

Finally, Wind gives up. Tired.

"My turn," says Sun.

Sun shines down gently. Warm rays of light.

The man starts to feel warm.

He unbuttons his coat. Just a little.

Sun shines warmer. Brighter.

The man gets hot!

He takes off his coat completely!

He carries it over his arm.

"I win!" says Sun.

Wind is quiet. Sun was right.

Sometimes being gentle is stronger than being forceful.

questions.question: What were Wind and Sun arguing about?
options: Who could make it rain more.

questions.question: How did Wind try to make the man take off his coat?
options: By blowing strong gusts of wind.

questions.question: What did the man do when Wind blew harder?
options: He took off his coat immediately.

questions.question: How did Sun succeed in making the man take off his coat?
options: By shining gently and making him warm.
By blowing him off his feet.

title: The Grateful Fox
description: Follow the journey of female fox, girl in this story about the grateful fox.
content:
Mia is walking through the forest picking berries.

She hears a sound. Whimpering.

Mia follows the sound to a clearing.

A fox! Her paw is caught in a trap!

The fox looks scared.

"Don't worry," Mia says gently. "I'll help you."

Mia kneels down carefully.

The fox watches with big eyes.

Mia presses the trap open. Click!

The fox pulls her paw free!

The fox licks her paw. Sore, but not badly hurt.

She looks at Mia. Their eyes meet.

The fox nods once. Then runs into the forest.

Mia smiles. "You're welcome, fox."

Mia goes home with her berries.

Weeks pass.

One day, Mia is in the forest again.

Fog rolls in. Thick and white.

Mia can't see the path anymore!

"Which way is home?" Mia feels worried.

Suddenly, Mia hears a bark.

The fox appears through the fog!

She barks again and starts walking.

Mia follows the fox. Step by step through the fog.

The fox knows the way!

The fog clears. Mia can see her house!

She's home! Safe!

The fox sits and looks at Mia.

"Thank you for helping me," says Mia.

The fox barks once. Then disappears into the forest.

Mia learned: Kindness always comes back to you.

questions.question: What was Mia doing when she first found the fox?
How did Mia help the fox?
options: She picked up its lost cub.
She released its paw from a trap.

questions.question: When did the fox return to help Mia?
options: When Mia was lost in a thick fog.
When Mia was hungry in the forest.
When Mia fell and hurt her knee.
When Mia was picking more berries.

questions.question: What is the main message of 'The Grateful Fox'?
options: It's dangerous to walk in the forest.
Foxes are good at finding paths.
Kindness always comes back to you.
Always carry a map when you walk.

title: Two Goats on a Bridge
description: Follow the journey of male goats in this story about two goats on a bridge.
content:
Two goats live on opposite sides of a river.

One goat is brown. One goat is white.

Between them is a narrow wooden bridge.

Only one goat can cross at a time.

One morning, both goats want to cross.

The brown goat steps onto the bridge from his side.

The white goat steps onto the bridge from his side.

They meet in the middle!

Neither goat can pass!

"Move!" says the brown goat. "I was here first!"

"No, I was!" says the white goat. "You move!"

They push against each other. Head to head.

Neither goat will back up.

They're both very stubborn!

They push harder!

The bridge wobbles.

"Stop pushing!" says the white goat.

"You stop!" says the brown goat.

Push, push, push!

The bridge wobbles more!

Both goats lose their balance!

SPLASH!

They both fall into the river below!

The water is cold. The current is strong.

Both goats swim to the shore. Wet and tired.

The next day, both goats want to cross again.

They meet in the middle of the bridge.

But this time...

"You can go first," says the brown goat. He backs up.

"Thank you!" says the white goat. He crosses.

Then the brown goat crosses.

Now both goats are happy. Taking turns is better than fighting!

questions.question: What was the problem with the bridge that the two goats wanted to cross?
options: Only one goat could cross at a time.

questions.question: What happened when the two goats first met in the middle of the bridge?
options: They both backed up and let the other pass.
They stopped to chat for a while.
They pushed each other and fell into the river.
They decided to build a new bridge.

questions.question: How did the goats solve their problem on the second day?
options: They waited for a human to help them.
One goat backed up to let the other pass.
They both jumped over the bridge.
They decided not to cross the bridge.

questions.question: What lesson did the two goats learn?
options: Taking turns is better than fighting.

title: The Oak and the Reed
description: Follow the journey of inanimate plants in this story about the oak and the reed.
content:
In a meadow grows a big oak tree.

Strong. Tall. Thick trunk.

"I'm the strongest in the meadow!" says Oak proudly.

Next to the river grows a thin reed.

Flexible. Bendy. Green.

Reed says nothing. Just sways in the breeze.

"Look at me!" says Oak. "My trunk is so thick! My branches are so strong!"

Reed bends in the wind. "That's nice, Oak."

"You're so thin," says Oak. "One strong wind could break you!"

Reed just smiles. "Maybe."

Dark clouds gather. A storm is coming!

Wind starts to blow. Harder and harder!

Oak stands firm. "I won't bend! I'm too strong!"

Reed bends with the wind. All the way down. Then back up.

The wind blows stronger! WHOOOOOSH!

Oak refuses to bend. "I will not move!"

His branches creak. His trunk groans.

Reed bends low to the ground. The wind passes over.

The wind blows the hardest it's ever blown!

Oak still won't bend.

CRACK!

Oak's trunk splits! He falls over with a crash!

Reed bends all the way down. Touching the ground. Then springs back up!

When the storm passes, Oak is broken.

But Reed stands tall again. Swaying gently.

"Sometimes," says Reed softly, "being flexible is stronger than being rigid."

Oak learned: It's okay to bend. That's how you survive storms.

questions.question: How did Oak describe himself to Reed?
What did Reed do when the strong wind of the storm blew?
options: It stood firm and refused to move.
It bent low to the ground with the wind.
It flew away with the wind.

questions.question: What happened to the Oak tree during the storm?
options: Its trunk split, and it fell over.

questions.question: What is the main lesson taught by 'The Oak and the Reed'?
options: It's important to be rigid and unmoving.
Being flexible can be stronger than being rigid.
Reeds are better than oak trees.

title: The Boy Who Cried Dragon
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the boy who cried dragon.
content:
A boy named Jake watches his family's sheep in the meadow.

It's boring. Just sitting and watching.

Jake wants excitement!

"I know!" thinks Jake. "I'll play a trick!"

Jake runs toward the village. "DRAGON! DRAGON!"

The villagers hear him. They grab sticks and run to help!

"Where's the dragon?" they ask.

Jake giggles. "Just kidding! No dragon!"

The villagers are not happy. They go back to the village.

The next day, Jake is bored again.

"That was fun," thinks Jake. "I'll do it again!"

He runs toward the village. "DRAGON! DRAGON!"

Again, the villagers run to help!

Again, there's no dragon.

"Stop lying!" says one villager. They all go home angry.

On the third day, Jake is watching sheep.

He hears a sound. Loud footsteps. Heavy breathing.

Jake looks up.

A REAL dragon is coming over the hill!

Big. Green. Breathing smoke!

Jake is terrified!

He runs toward the village. "DRAGON! DRAGON! PLEASE HELP!"

But the villagers hear him and shake their heads.

"He's lying again," says one.

"Ignore him," says another.

Nobody comes to help.

Jake has to face the dragon alone!

But the dragon just walks past. It wasn't interested in Jake at all.

Jake learned a hard lesson: If you lie too many times, people won't believe you when you tell the truth.

From that day on, Jake never lied again.

questions.question: Why did Jake first cry 'DRAGON!'?
options: He was bored and wanted to play a trick.
He needed help with his homework.

questions.question: What was the villagers' reaction when Jake cried 'DRAGON!' for the second time?
options: They ran even faster to help him.
They were not happy and told him to stop lying.
They brought him a new toy.
They asked him to come play with them.

questions.question: What happened when a real dragon appeared?
options: The villagers immediately came to help Jake.
The dragon ate all the sheep.
The villagers thought Jake was lying again and didn't help.
Jake bravely fought the dragon alone.

questions.question: What important lesson did Jake learn from his experience?
options: It's fun to play tricks on people.
If you lie too many times, people won't believe you.

title: Why Owls Hunt at Night
description: Follow the journey of female owl in this story about why owls hunt at night.
content:
Long ago, Owl hunted during the day like other birds.

She would wake up when the sun rose.

Owl would fly around looking for food.

But the daytime was so bright! The sun hurt her big eyes.

Owl struggled to see.

One day, all the daytime birds had a meeting.

"Let's fly to the Great Tree!" said Eagle. "There are delicious berries there!"

All the birds flew together.

Owl flew too, squinting in the bright sun.

She could barely see where she was going!

The birds reached the Great Tree.

Berries everywhere! Red, blue, purple!

The birds ate and ate.

But Owl couldn't see the berries clearly. Too much sunlight!

She got only a few berries. Her eyes watered from the bright light.

Owl flew home sad and still hungry.

That evening, as the sun set, Owl noticed something.

Her eyes didn't hurt anymore!

The dim light felt comfortable!

"I can see perfectly now!" said Owl.

Owl flew out into the twilight.

She could see everything! Mice running. Bugs flying.

Her big eyes were perfect for low light!

Owl caught plenty of food. More than she'd ever caught during the day!

"This is wonderful!" said Owl.

From that day on, Owl only hunted at night.

While other birds slept, Owl flew through the darkness.

Her big eyes saw everything.

"The night has its own treasures," said Owl.

And that's why owls hunt at night!

questions.question: What problem did Owl have when she hunted during the day?
options: She was too slow to catch food.
The bright sun hurt her big eyes.
She was scared of the daytime.

questions.question: What happened when Owl tried to eat berries with other birds in the daytime?
options: She couldn't see the berries clearly due to the sunlight.
She got lost on the way.
She ate too many and got a stomach ache.

questions.question: When did Owl discover she could see perfectly?
options: In the middle of a sunny afternoon.
As the sun was setting and the light was dim.

questions.question: What is the main reason owls hunt at night in this story?
options: Because all the other birds are sleeping.
Because their eyes are perfectly suited for low light.
Because they like the quiet of the night.
Because there is more food available at night.

title: The Mountain That Grew
description: Follow the journey of inanimate mountain in this story about the mountain that grew.
content:
Once there was a tiny hill in a meadow.

Not a mountain. Just a small bump in the ground.

"I wish I could be tall like a real mountain," sighed the hill.

A wise cloud heard the hill's wish.

"I can help you," said Cloud.

"Every time someone climbs you with kindness in their heart, you will grow a little taller," said Cloud.

"Really?" asked the hill.

"Really," said Cloud. Then she floated away.

The hill waited. Hopeful.

A little girl came to the hill.

She was picking flowers for her sick grandmother.

"This hill is perfect to see over!" she said.

She climbed the hill gently, careful not to step on any flowers.

When she reached the top, the hill grew! Just a little bit taller!

Days later, a boy came to the hill.

He was looking for his lost puppy.

"Maybe I can see him from up there!" he said.

He climbed the hill carefully, watching where he stepped.

When he reached the top, the hill grew again! A bit taller!

More and more people climbed the hill with kind hearts.

A woman looking for herbs to heal people.

A man searching for his father's lost ring.

Children playing a gentle game.

Each time someone climbed with kindness, the hill grew!

Years passed.

The little hill grew taller and taller!

Now it was a real mountain! Big and tall!

"I'm a mountain now!" said the mountain happily.

And to this day, it keeps growing whenever someone climbs it with a kind heart.

questions.question: What did the tiny hill wish for?
options: To have a river flow around it.
To be tall like a real mountain.
To have animals live on it.

questions.question: What condition did the wise cloud give for the hill to grow?
options: It would grow every time it rained.
It would grow every time someone planted a tree.
It would grow a little taller every time someone climbed it with kindness.
It would grow if no one climbed it for a year.

questions.question: What was the little girl doing when she first climbed the hill?
options: Picking flowers for her sick grandmother.
Having a picnic with her family.

questions.question: How did the tiny hill eventually become a mountain?
options: It was pushed up by an earthquake.
A wizard used magic to make it grow.
People kept building on top of it.
Many people climbed it with kind hearts over the years.

title: The First Snowflake
description: Follow the journey of female winter spirit in this story about the first snowflake.
content:
Long, long ago, winter was just cold and dark.

No snow. No ice. Just cold wind and gray skies.

The Winter Spirit, Neve, felt sad.

"Winter is so bare," she said. "I wish I could make it beautiful."

She thought and thought.

One night, Neve looked up at the stars.

"Stars are beautiful," she said. "What if I could make tiny stars that fall?"

Neve reached up and touched a star.

She pulled down a tiny piece of starlight.

It was cold and white in her hand.

Neve shaped the starlight carefully.

She made it flat and delicate.

She gave it six points, like a star.

"Perfect!" said Neve.

She held the first snowflake!

Neve let the snowflake go.

It floated down, down, down.

Swirling through the air.

It landed on the ground. Soft and white.

"Beautiful!" whispered Neve.

Neve made more snowflakes!

Hundreds! Thousands! Millions!

Each one a little different.

They all floated down together.

The world turned white and sparkling!

Children woke up and looked outside.

"What's this white stuff?" they asked.

They ran outside and caught snowflakes on their tongues!

"It's wonderful!" they laughed.

Neve smiled. "I'll make snowflakes every winter."

And that's how the first snowflake was born!

questions.question: Who was the Winter Spirit in the story?
What did Neve wish for to make winter beautiful?
What did Neve use to make the first snowflake?
How many points did Neve give the first snowflake?

title: Thunder's Drum
description: Follow the journey of male thunder giant in this story about thunder's drum.
content:
High in the clouds lives a gentle giant named Boom.

Boom is big but very kind.

He has a special drum. The biggest drum in the world!

When Boom plays his drum, it makes thunder!

BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!

Down below, people hear the thunder.

Some are scared. "What's that loud sound?"

But Boom doesn't want to scare anyone.

He just wants to help!

His drum has an important job.

Boom watches the villages below.

When he sees storm clouds gathering, he knows what to do.

He picks up his drumsticks.

BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!

He plays his drum loud!

The people hear the thunder.

"A storm is coming!" they say.

They bring their animals inside.

They close their windows.

They get ready for the rain!

Boom's drum warned them!

After the storm passes, the sun comes out.

Boom plays his drum one more time.

BOOM!

Softer this time. Gentler.

"The storm is over," people say. "It's safe now."

They go back outside.

Boom smiles from his cloud.

"My drum helps people," says Boom happily.

Every time you hear thunder, remember:

It's just Boom, the gentle giant, playing his drum.

He's protecting you and warning you.

Thunder isn't scary. It's helpful!

questions.question: What is the name of the gentle giant who lives in the clouds?
What does Boom's special drum create?
Why does Boom play his drum loudly when he sees storm clouds?
options: To warn people a storm is coming

questions.question: What do people do after Boom plays his drum and the storm passes?

title: How Fire Came to the Village
description: Follow the journey of male boy, female firebird in this story about how fire came to the village.
content:
Long ago, people had no fire.

Nights were cold and dark.

Food was cold. Houses were cold.

A brave boy named Kai wanted to help his village.

"I'll find fire," said Kai.

The elders told Kai: "Fire lives with the Firebird on top of the Great Mountain."

"I'll climb the mountain!" said Kai.

Everyone said it was too dangerous.

But Kai didn't give up.

Early one morning, he started climbing.

Kai climbed all day.

Higher and higher!

The air got colder. His legs got tired.

But Kai kept going.

Finally, as the sun set, he reached the top!

At the top of the mountain sat a beautiful bird.

Her feathers glowed red and orange like flames!

"Are you the Firebird?" asked Kai.

"I am," said the Firebird. Her voice crackled like fire.

"I need fire for my village," said Kai bravely.

The Firebird looked at Kai. "You climbed all this way?"

"Yes," said Kai. "My people are cold."

The Firebird saw Kai's kind heart.

She plucked one of her glowing feathers.

"Take this," she said. "It will never stop burning."

Kai carried the feather down the mountain carefully.

When he reached the village, people gathered around.

The feather glowed bright!

They used it to light torches. To warm their homes. To cook their food.

"Thank you, Kai!" everyone cheered.

From that day on, the village always had fire.

And they remembered Kai, the brave boy who climbed the mountain.

questions.question: Who was the brave boy who wanted to find fire for his village?
Where did the elders say fire lived?
options: On top of the Great Mountain with the Firebird

questions.question: What did the Firebird give Kai to bring back to his village?
What did the villagers use the fire for once Kai brought it back?
options: To warm their homes and cook their food

title: The Moon's Lost Piece
description: Follow the journey of female moon in this story about the moon's lost piece.
content:
The Moon used to be perfectly round.

Full and bright every single night!

But one night, a piece of the Moon broke off!

She looked down at herself.

"Oh no! I'm not round anymore!"

The Moon felt sad.

"I need to find my missing piece!" said the Moon.

She looked everywhere in the sky.

Behind clouds. Behind stars.

But she couldn't find it anywhere!

The Moon grew smaller and smaller.

Down on Earth, a boy named Leo looked up.

"The Moon looks different," said Leo. "She's not round anymore!"

Leo wanted to help!

"I'll find the Moon's piece!" said Leo.

He searched all night.

Leo looked in the forest. Not there.

He looked by the river. Not there.

He looked in the meadow.

And there it was! A glowing piece! Shaped like a crescent!

"I found it!" said Leo.

But how could Leo get it back to the Moon?

Leo held the piece up high. As high as he could reach.

"Please come back!" he called to the Moon.

The Moon saw Leo! She saw her missing piece!

The Moon sent down a beam of light.

The beam touched the piece in Leo's hands.

Whoosh! The piece floated up, up, up!

It flew back to the Moon and attached perfectly!

The Moon was round again! Full and bright!

"Thank you, Leo!" called the Moon.

And every month after, the Moon remembered Leo's kindness. She showed him all her different shapes—full, crescent, half—just to say thank you.

questions.question: How did the Moon look before she lost a piece?
Who found the Moon's missing piece on Earth?
What shape was the glowing piece Leo found?
How did the Moon get her missing piece back from Leo?
options: The Moon sent down a beam of light to retrieve it

title: Why the Sea Is Salty
description: Follow the journey of male giant in this story about why the sea is salty.
content:
Long ago, the sea was not salty.

It tasted like fresh water!

But then something happened.

A giant named Grom found a magic salt grinder.

"This grinder makes salt forever!" said Grom.

Grom loved the salt grinder!

He ground salt on his food. Sprinkle, sprinkle!

Delicious!

He ground salt for his friends.

Everyone loved it!

"More salt! More salt!" they cheered.

One day, Grom was on a boat in the middle of the sea.

He wanted to eat his lunch.

He pulled out his magic salt grinder.

"Just a little salt," said Grom.

He started grinding. Sprinkle, sprinkle.

But Grom's hands were wet!

The grinder slipped!

SPLASH!

It fell into the sea!

"Oh no!" cried Grom.

He tried to reach it, but it sank too fast!

Down, down to the bottom of the sea.

The magic salt grinder kept grinding at the bottom of the ocean!

Salt, salt, salt!

It never stopped!

Days passed. Weeks passed. Months passed.

More and more salt poured into the sea!

The sea became saltier and saltier!

And the magic grinder is still down there today.

Still grinding salt!

That's why the sea is salty!

Every time you taste ocean water, remember: it's from Grom's magic grinder that fell into the sea so long ago.

questions.question: What did the sea taste like long ago, before it became salty?
What magic item did the giant Grom find?
How did the magic salt grinder end up in the sea?
options: Grom threw it in on purpose
It floated away from the shore
It slipped from Grom's wet hands on a boat

questions.question: What is the magic salt grinder still doing at the bottom of the ocean today?

title: The Star Who Wanted to Sing
description: Follow the journey of female star in this story about the star who wanted to sing.
content:
High in the night sky lived a little star named Stella.

Stella loved to listen to the Moon sing her lullabies.

The Moon's voice was beautiful and soft.

"I wish I could sing too," said Stella.

But stars can't sing. Or can they?

Stella tried to sing like the Moon.

She opened her mouth (stars have mouths in the sky!).

But no sound came out.

"I can't sing," said Stella sadly.

The Moon heard her. "Come here, little star."

Stella floated over to the Moon.

"Stars can sing," said the Moon kindly. "But not with voices."

"How then?" asked Stella.

The Moon pointed down at Earth. "Look."

Stella looked down at the dark Earth below.

She saw a little girl looking up at the sky.

"I wish on a star," said the little girl. "I wish my grandma feels better."

Stella's light seemed to shine brighter!

"See?" said the Moon. "When you twinkle, you give people hope. That's your song!"

Stella thought about this.

"My light is my song?"

"Yes," said the Moon. "The most beautiful song of all."

From that night on, Stella twinkled her brightest.

Children looked up and made wishes.

Lost travelers found their way home by her light.

People felt hope when they saw her.

"I AM singing!" realized Stella happily.

Her light was her song—and the whole world could see it!

questions.question: What was the little star's name?
Who did Stella love to listen to sing lullabies?
According to the Moon, how do stars "sing"?
options: By twinkling and giving people hope
By shining very brightly without a purpose

questions.question: What did Stella's light help people do down on Earth?
options: Make wishes and find their way home

title: Kai and the Hidden Cave
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about kai and the hidden cave.
content:
Kai is exploring the woods near his house.

He follows a stream. The water bubbles and splashes.

Kai hops from rock to rock.

Then he sees something behind the waterfall.

A dark opening. A cave!

Kai steps carefully behind the waterfall.

Water sprays on his face. Cold and wet!

He ducks into the cave.

Inside, it's cool and quiet.

Kai's eyes adjust to the dark.

Then he sees them—glowing crystals on the walls!

The crystals shine blue and green.

They light up the whole cave!

Kai touches one gently. It's smooth and cool.

"Wow," Kai whispers.

He's never seen anything like this before.

Kai explores deeper into the cave.

More crystals everywhere! On the ceiling. On the floor.

Some are big. Some are tiny.

Kai picks up a small loose crystal. It fits in his hand perfectly.

"I'll keep this one," says Kai.

Kai hears a sound. Water dripping.

He looks up. A drop falls from the ceiling—PLIP!—and lands on his nose.

Kai giggles.

He decides it's time to go home.

He tucks the crystal in his pocket carefully.

Kai steps back through the waterfall.

The sun is bright outside. He blinks.

He runs home to show his family the crystal.

"I found a secret cave!" Kai says excitedly.

He can't wait to explore it again tomorrow.

questions.question: Where did Kai find the hidden cave?
What did Kai see glowing on the walls inside the cave?
What colors were the glowing crystals?
What did Kai take home from the cave?

title: Zara's Treasure Map
