description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about zara's treasure map.
content:
Zara is visiting her grandmother by the beach.

Grandma shows her an old piece of paper.

"I made this when I was little," says Grandma. "It's a treasure map!"

Zara looks at the map. There are drawings and an X.

"Can we find the treasure?" asks Zara.

Grandma smiles. "Let's try!"

They walk to the beach. Zara holds the map.

The first drawing is a palm tree.

Zara looks around. "There! A palm tree!"

They walk to the tree.

At the palm tree, Zara checks the map.

The next drawing is three rocks.

Zara looks around. She sees three big rocks by the water!

"This way, Grandma!"

They walk to the rocks.

At the rocks, Zara looks at the map again.

The next drawing is a wooden post.

"What's a wooden post?" asks Zara.

Grandma points. "That old dock post over there!"

They walk to the post.

Next to the post, the map shows an X.

"The treasure is here!" says Zara.

She kneels down and digs in the sand with her hands.

Dig, dig, dig.

Her fingers touch something hard!

Zara pulls out a small box.

She opens it carefully.

Inside are beautiful seashells! All different colors and shapes.

"I collected these when I was your age," says Grandma.

"They're perfect," says Zara.

She holds the shells gently. The best treasure ever.

questions.question: Who gave Zara the old treasure map?
What was the first landmark Zara looked for on the beach according to the map?
What was the final landmark that marked the spot of the treasure?
What kind of treasure did Zara find in the small box?

title: The Brave Little Boat
description: A story about the brave little boat.
content:
The little blue boat sits at the dock. Bobbing up and down!

The water is calm. The sun is just waking up!

But the little boat feels restless. It wants to explore!

The boat wiggles loose from the rope and—splash!—pushes away!

Adventure is waiting!

The little boat floats across the water.

A small duck paddles by. "Quack quack!"

The boat waves its bright flag. "Hello, friend!"

The duck swims alongside, then drifts away.

The little boat keeps going. So much to see!

The sun climbs higher! Big and yellow!

Warm sunlight sparkles on the water like tiny stars!

The little boat feels happy! It loves being out on the water!

Splash, splash go the gentle waves!

Everything feels just right!

Suddenly, the little boat sees something far away!

A big white yacht! Much bigger than the little boat!

But wait—the yacht is tilting! Leaning to one side!

Its flag waves wildly!

The yacht is in trouble!

The brave little boat turns and speeds toward the yacht as fast as it can!

The little boat reaches the yacht!

Water is coming in through a crack! It's sinking!

"Hold on!" the little boat calls bravely.

The little boat pushes and pushes! Hard work!

The yacht is so big! The little boat is so small!

But the little boat is very strong!

Slowly, the little boat guides the yacht toward the shore!

Push, push, push!

Finally, they reach the beach!

The yacht settles on the sand—safe and sound!

"Thank you, little boat!" says the yacht. "You saved me! You're so brave!"

The little boat's flag waves proudly!

Even though it's small, it did something very big today!

The sky changes. Rain starts to fall—pitter-patter!

The wind blows the little boat back across the water! Whee!

Soon it sees the dock! Home!

It glides back and ties itself up!

What a day! The little boat saved a yacht! It had a real adventure!

Other boats wave. They heard about the brave rescue!

The little boat waves back proudly!

It may be small, but today it was a hero!

questions.question: What did the little blue boat want to do at the beginning of the story?
What kind of boat did the little blue boat see that was in trouble?
What was wrong with the big yacht?
options: It was tilting and sinking due to a crack

questions.question: How did the little boat help the yacht?
options: It gave the yacht a new flag
It pushed the yacht toward the shore

title: Luna and Her Glowing Garden
description: A story about luna and her glowing garden.
content:
Luna is a tiny fairy with silver wings!

Every evening, she visits her garden with a small watering can.

The sky is getting dark. The flowers are sleeping.

They need Luna's help!

Luna walks between them. She tips her watering can and sprinkles soft dewdrops!

First the roses. Then the daisies. Then the big white flower!

"Wake up," Luna whispers.

As the sky turns darker, something special happens!

The roses begin to glow pink!

The daisies glow yellow!

The big white flower glows brightest of all! Soft and round! Like a tiny moon!

Luna claps her hands. It worked! Her garden is glowing!

A small bunny hops into the garden. Hop. Hop.

The bunny stops and looks around. So much light!

"Hello," says Luna.

The bunny wiggles its nose and hops closer. It sniffs a glowing rose!

Luna smiles. The bunny likes her garden!

An owl flies down. "Hoo! Pretty!" says the owl.

Fireflies drift in, dancing between the flowers!

Luna flies gently around the garden. She checks each flower.

Still glowing! Still warm!

Everyone wants to see the glowing flowers!

Luna lands on the big white flower in the middle.

This one is her favorite! It glows the brightest!

She sits on its soft petals and looks up.

The moon is there! Round and glowing!

Just like her flower!

Luna waves. "Hello, Moon!"

The air grows quiet.

The bunny hops back into the grass.

The owl glides away.

Fireflies blink slowly. One... then another.

The flowers keep glowing around Luna. Pink. Yellow. White.

Luna stands in the middle of her garden.

The light is calm. Everything is just right!

questions.question: What kind of creature is Luna?
What does Luna use to sprinkle dewdrops on her garden flowers?
What happens to Luna's garden flowers as the sky gets darker?
Which flower in Luna's garden glows the brightest, like a tiny moon?

title: The Sleepy Train
description: Follow the journey of inanimate train in this story about the sleepy train.
content:
Little Train chugs through the countryside.

Chugga-chugga-choo! Chugga-chugga-choo!

His wheels roll on the tracks. Clickety-clack! Clickety-clack!

All day long, Little Train has been working.

Now the sun is setting. The sky turns orange and pink.

Little Train delivers passengers to a small station.

"Thank you, Little Train!" say the passengers.

They wave goodbye.

Little Train is tired. His engine feels heavy.

"Time to go home," thinks Little Train.

Little Train starts the journey home.

Chugga-chugga... choo.

He's moving slower now. His wheels are tired.

Clickety... clack. Clickety... clack.

The moon rises in the sky. Stars begin to twinkle.

Little Train passes a field where cows are sleeping.

"Goodnight, cows," whispers Little Train softly.

He passes a barn where chickens are roosting.

"Goodnight, chickens," whispers Little Train.

Everything is getting ready for sleep.

Little Train's lights get dimmer. His engine sounds softer.

Chugga... choo. Chugga... choo.

Click... clack. Click... clack.

He's moving very slowly now.

Almost home.

Little Train reaches the train shed. His home!

He rolls inside and stops. His engine turns off.

"What a long day," thinks Little Train.

He closes his headlights like sleepy eyes.

All around, the world is quiet.

Goodnight, Little Train. Sleep well.

questions.question: What does Little Train do all day long?
What color does the sky turn when the sun is setting?
What animals does Little Train whisper goodnight to on his way home?
Where does Little Train go to sleep at the end of the day?

title: The Blanket Fort Dream
description: Follow the journey of male boy, inanimate blanket in this story about the blanket fort dream.
content:
Owen builds a fort in his room before bedtime.

He drapes blankets over chairs. He adds pillows inside.

"A blanket fort!" says Owen proudly.

His blue blanket makes the roof. Soft and cozy!

"Can I sleep in my fort?" asks Owen.

"Okay," says Mom. "Just for tonight."

Owen crawls inside his fort with his favorite stuffed bear.

Mom tucks them in. "Goodnight, Owen."

"Goodnight, Mom," says Owen.

The blanket walls glow softly from the nightlight outside.

Owen feels safe and cozy. Like he's in a little cave!

Owen closes his eyes.

As he falls asleep, something magical happens...

The blanket fort starts to change!

The walls grow taller. The pillows become soft clouds.

The fort is turning into a real castle!

Owen opens his eyes in his dream.

He's wearing a knight's cape! His bear is wearing one too!

The blanket fort is now a giant castle with towers and flags!

"We're in a castle!" says Owen.

He and Bear explore the castle rooms.

They climb the tower stairs. Higher and higher!

They look out the window. They can see a whole kingdom below!

Fields of flowers. Rivers that sparkle. Mountains in the distance.

"This is our kingdom!" says Owen.

Bear nods happily.

Owen and Bear play in the castle all night.

They slide down bannister rails. They peek in treasure rooms.

Then, slowly, the castle starts to fade...

Owen opens his eyes. Morning!

He's back in his blanket fort. But he remembers the dream.

"Best fort ever," whispers Owen.

questions.question: What does Owen build in his room before bedtime?
Who does Owen crawl into the fort with?
What magical thing happens to the blanket fort in Owen's dream?
options: It turns into a giant castle

questions.question: What do Owen and Bear see from the castle window in the dream?

title: The Quiet Nightlight
description: Follow the journey of inanimate nightlight, female girl in this story about the quiet nightlight.
content:
Mia has a small nightlight beside her bed.

It glows soft yellow. Not too bright. Not too dark.

Every night, the nightlight watches over Mia while she sleeps.

Tonight, Mia climbs into bed.

"Goodnight, Nightlight," says Mia.

The nightlight glows a little brighter, like it's saying hello.

Mia closes her eyes. But she's not sleepy yet.

"Nightlight?" whispers Mia. "Are you awake?"

The nightlight glows softly. It's always awake!

That's its job. To stay awake while Mia sleeps.

"Will you keep me company?" asks Mia.

The nightlight begins to hum. Very, very softly.

Hmmmmm. Hmmmmm.

It's a gentle sound. Like a lullaby with no words.

Mia listens. The humming is soothing.

Her eyes feel heavier.

The nightlight's glow seems to pulse gently.

Bright... dim. Bright... dim.

Like it's breathing.

Mia's breathing matches the nightlight's rhythm.

In... out. In... out.

So peaceful.

The nightlight hums a little longer.

Hmmmmm. Hmmmmm.

Mia yawns. Her eyes close.

The room feels safe and warm.

The nightlight's glow wraps around Mia like a hug.

Mia falls asleep.

The nightlight stops humming. Its job is done.

But it keeps glowing all night long.

Watching over Mia. Keeping the dark away.

"Goodnight, Mia," thinks the nightlight.

And it glows softly until morning.

questions.question: What color is Mia's nightlight?
What sound does the nightlight make to help Mia sleep?
How does Mia describe the nightlight's glow as it pulses?
What is the nightlight's job while Mia sleeps?
options: To stay awake and keep the dark away

title: Stars Going to Bed
description: Follow the journey of inanimate stars in this story about stars going to bed.
content:
High up in the night sky, the stars are shining.

Twinkle, twinkle, twinkle!

They've been shining all night long.

But now, the sun is starting to rise.

"Time for bed," says the oldest star.

The first star yawns. A big, sparkly yawn!

"I'm sleepy," says the first star.

She closes her twinkly eyes.

Her light fades. Just a little bit.

She's getting ready for bed.

The second star sees the first star yawning.

The second star yawns too! Yawns are contagious!

"Me too!" says the second star.

She closes her eyes. Her light fades too.

Now two stars are resting.

One by one, all the stars start yawning.

"So sleepy!"

"Time to rest!"

Each star's light gets dimmer and dimmer.

The sky is getting lighter. Morning is coming!

The last little star doesn't want to go to bed.

"But I'm not tired!" says the little star.

The oldest star smiles. "The sun needs the sky now. We'll shine again tonight."

The little star yawns. Maybe she IS a little tired.

The little star closes her eyes. Her light fades gently.

Now all the stars are sleeping.

The sky is bright blue. The sun is up!

But the stars are resting peacefully. Dreaming starry dreams.

Tonight, they'll wake up and twinkle again.

Goodnight, stars. Sweet dreams.

questions.question: When do the stars decide it's 'time for bed'?
options: When the sun starts to rise

questions.question: What do the stars do before their lights fade?
Why does the oldest star say the stars need to go to bed?
options: The sun needs the sky now

questions.question: What happens to the stars' lights as they get ready for bed?

title: The Pillow Cloud
description: Follow the journey of inanimate pillow, male boy in this story about the pillow cloud.
content:
Jack's pillow is white and fluffy.

It looks just like a soft cloud!

Tonight, as Jack climbs into bed, something magical happens.

His pillow begins to float! Up, up, up!

"Whoa!" says Jack.

Jack holds onto his pillow tight.

It lifts him off the bed! Floating in the air!

"My pillow is flying!" laughs Jack.

The pillow carries him gently around his room.

Past his toy shelf. Past his closet. Past his window.

The pillow floats near the window.

Jack looks outside. The real clouds are floating in the night sky!

"Let's join them!" thinks the pillow.

Gently, the pillow floats through the window. Outside!

Jack holds on tight. He's flying!

The pillow cloud carries Jack up into the sky.

Higher and higher!

Jack floats among the real clouds. They're so soft and misty!

"Hello, clouds!" calls Jack.

The clouds seem to wave back.

Jack and his pillow cloud float peacefully through the night sky.

Stars twinkle all around them. The moon glows big and bright.

It's so quiet up here. So calm.

Jack feels sleepy. Very, very sleepy.

The pillow cloud floats back to Jack's room.

Slowly, gently, it lowers Jack onto his bed.

Jack is fast asleep now. Dreaming of clouds and stars.

The pillow goes back to being a regular pillow.

But Jack smiles in his sleep. He remembers flying.

Goodnight, Jack. Dream of clouds.

questions.question: What does Jack's pillow look like?
What magical thing happens to Jack's pillow when he climbs into bed?
options: It begins to float and fly

questions.question: Where does the pillow cloud first carry Jack?
What does Jack see twinkling and glowing in the sky while flying?

title: The Lullaby Wind
description: Follow the journey of inanimate wind, female baby in this story about the lullaby wind.
content:
Baby Lily is in her crib.

Outside, the night wind starts to blow.

Whoooosh. Whoooosh.

The wind blows through the trees outside Lily's window.

The leaves rustle. Swish, swish, swish.

It sounds like a song.

The wind blows gently against the window.

Whoooosh. Whoooosh.

Lily hears the sound. It's soothing. Soft.

The curtains move slightly. Back and forth.

Like they're dancing to the wind's song.

The wind sings through the tree branches.

Whoooo. Whoooo.

It's not a loud sound. It's gentle. Peaceful.

Like the wind is humming a lullaby.

Just for Lily.

Lily's eyes start to feel heavy.

The wind keeps singing. Whoooo. Whoooosh.

The trees keep rustling. Swish, swish.

The curtains keep swaying. Back and forth.

Everything is working together to help Lily sleep.

Lily yawns. Her little fist opens and closes.

The wind's lullaby continues. Soft and steady.

Whoooosh. Whoooo.

Lily's eyes close. Her breathing slows.

She's falling asleep.

The wind keeps blowing gently all night long.

Singing its lullaby through the trees.

Watching over Lily while she sleeps.

Whoooosh. Whoooo.

"Sleep well, little one," whispers the wind.

And Lily dreams peaceful dreams.

questions.question: Where is Baby Lily at the beginning of the story?
What natural sound helps Lily fall asleep?
What happens to the curtains in Lily's room when the wind blows?
options: They move slightly, swaying back and forth

questions.question: What does the wind's sound feel like to Lily?

title: The Sleepy Bunny's Burrow
description: Follow the journey of female bunny in this story about the sleepy bunny's burrow.
content:
Bella is a small gray bunny.

She lives in a cozy burrow under a big oak tree.

All day, Bella has been hopping around the meadow.

Now the sun is setting. Time to go home!

Bella hops back to her burrow.

Inside the burrow, Bella's bed is waiting.

It's made of soft grass and downy feathers.

Bella fluffs it with her nose. Puff, puff!

"Perfect," thinks Bella.

She turns around three times. That's what bunnies do!

Bella curls up in her soft bed.

She tucks her nose under her paws.

Her fluffy tail covers her like a little blanket.

So cozy! So warm!

But Bella's not quite ready to sleep yet.

Bella thinks about her day.

She hopped through flowers. She munched on clover.

She played with her bunny friends.

It was a good day!

Now she's tired. Very, very tired.

Bella's eyes start to close.

Outside the burrow, night sounds begin.

Crickets chirp. Soft and rhythmic. Chirp, chirp, chirp.

The sound is like a lullaby.

Bella's ears droop. Her body relaxes.

Bella falls asleep in her cozy burrow.

She dreams of carrots and sunshine and soft grass.

Above ground, the moon shines down.

But below ground, Bella is safe and warm.

Sleeping peacefully in her little bed.

Goodnight, Bella Bunny.

questions.question: What kind of animal is Bella?
Where does Bella live?
options: In a cozy burrow under a big oak tree
In a nest in the grass

questions.question: What does Bella use to make her bed in the burrow?
What sound outside the burrow helps Bella fall asleep?

title: The Bedtime Bell
description: Follow the journey of inanimate bell, all animals in this story about the bedtime bell.
content:
In the forest, there's a special silver bell hanging from a tree.

Every night, the bell rings. Ding, dong. Ding, dong.

When the animals hear the bell, they know.

Time for bed!

Tonight, the sun is setting. The bell begins to ring.

The birds hear the bell. Ding, dong.

"Bedtime!" chirp the birds.

They fly to their nests. They tuck their heads under their wings.

The birds close their eyes.

Time to sleep.

The squirrels hear the bell. Ding, dong.

"Bedtime!" chatter the squirrels.

They scurry to their tree holes. They curl up with their bushy tails.

The squirrels close their eyes.

Time to sleep.

The rabbits hear the bell. Ding, dong.

"Bedtime!" say the rabbits.

They hop to their burrows. They nestle into their soft beds.

The rabbits close their eyes.

Time to sleep.

The deer hear the bell. Ding, dong.

"Bedtime!" say the deer.

They lie down in the soft grass. They fold their legs beneath them.

The deer close their eyes.

Time to sleep.

The forest gets quiet. Every animal is sleeping.

The bell rings one last time. Ding, dong.

Then it stops. Even the bell is resting now.

The moon shines down on the peaceful forest.

Everyone is dreaming.

Goodnight, forest animals. Sleep well.

questions.question: Where is the special silver bell located in the forest?
What sound does the bedtime bell make?
Which of these animals is NOT mentioned going to sleep when the bell rings?
What do the animals know when they hear the bell ring?

title: The Cozy Cave
description: Follow the journey of inanimate cave, male bear in this story about the cozy cave.
content:
Bear is looking for a place to sleep for winter.

He needs a cozy cave!

Bear walks through the forest. Looking. Searching.

He finds a small cave. He peeks inside.

Too small!

Bear finds another cave.

This one is big! Very big!

But it's cold inside. Wind blows through cracks in the walls.

Too cold!

Bear keeps looking.

Bear finds a third cave.

It's just the right size! Not too big. Not too small.

Bear walks inside. He looks around.

The walls are smooth. No cracks. No wind!

"This might be the one," thinks Bear.

Bear gathers soft things to make a bed.

Leaves. Grass. Moss. Pine needles.

He piles them in a corner of the cave.

Fluffy and soft!

Bear lies down to test it. Perfect!

Bear feels sleepy. Winter is here!

Time for his long sleep. Hibernation!

Bear curls up in his cozy bed. The cave is warm and dark.

Safe from snow and wind.

Bear yawns. A big bear yawn!

Bear closes his eyes.

The cave keeps him warm all winter long.

Outside, snow falls. The wind blows. The world is cold.

But inside the cozy cave, Bear sleeps peacefully.

Dreaming of springtime and honey.

Goodnight, Bear. Sleep through the winter.

questions.question: Why is Bear looking for a place to sleep?
options: He wants to hide his food

questions.question: What kind of places does Bear search for to sleep in?
What materials does Bear gather to make his bed inside the cave?
options: Leaves, grass, moss, and pine needles

questions.question: What happens outside the cave while Bear sleeps through the winter?
options: Snow falls and the wind blows

title: The Dream Catcher
description: Follow the journey of inanimate dream catcher, female girl in this story about the dream catcher.
content:
Above Emma's bed hangs a dream catcher.

It's round with a web inside. Feathers hang from it.

"What does it do?" Emma asks her grandma.

"It catches bad dreams," says Grandma. "Only good dreams can pass through."

Emma looks up at it. "Really?"

That night, Emma climbs into bed.

She looks at the dream catcher. It sways gently in the breeze.

"Keep the bad dreams away," whispers Emma.

The dream catcher seems to glow softly in the moonlight.

Emma closes her eyes.

As Emma sleeps, the dream catcher begins its work.

Bad dreams try to reach Emma. Dark and scary dreams!

But the dream catcher's web catches them.

They get stuck in the web. They can't reach Emma!

Good dreams float through the web's center.

Happy dreams! Sweet dreams!

Dreams of sunshine and flowers and laughter.

These dreams pass right through to Emma.

Emma dreams of playing in a field of flowers.

She dreams of flying with butterflies.

She dreams of eating ice cream with sprinkles.

All good dreams! Thanks to the dream catcher.

No bad dreams tonight!

In the morning, Emma wakes up smiling.

"I had the best dreams!" she tells Grandma.

Emma looks up at the dream catcher. It's still swaying gently.

"Thank you, dream catcher," whispers Emma.

The dream catcher will be there tonight too. And every night.

Catching bad dreams. Letting good dreams through.

Story 15

Age: 1–3 | Protagonist: Male boy

River and his dad are by the stream in the woods.

"Want to build something?" asks Dad.

"Yes!" says River.

They find sticks by the water. Strong sticks!

"Let's make a raft!" suggests Dad.

River claps. "A raft!"

Dad ties the sticks together with rope.

River helps. He holds the sticks steady.

"This stick! And this one!"

They add more sticks. Side by side.

Soon they have a flat raft!

"It looks like a boat!" says River.

Dad puts the raft in the stream.

It floats! The water carries it gently.

"Want to send it on an adventure?" asks Dad.

River nods excitedly.

They give the raft a push.

The raft floats away! Down the stream!

River and Dad follow the raft along the bank.

They watch it float. Spinning slowly.

The raft passes under tree branches.

It goes around rocks. Still floating!

"It's going so far!" says River.

The raft reaches a wider part of the stream.

There are fish swimming! They swim past the raft.

A frog jumps onto the raft! He rides for a minute.

Then he jumps off into the water. Splash!

"The frog liked our raft!" laughs River.

The raft reaches a shallow part. It stops on the sand.

River and Dad walk to it.

"What an adventure!" says Dad.

River picks up the raft. It's still in one piece!

"Can we build another one tomorrow?" asks River.

"Absolutely," says Dad.

Building and sailing! The best day!

questions.question: What hangs above Emma's bed?
What does Grandma say the dream catcher does?
options: It catches bad dreams and lets good dreams pass through

questions.question: What happens to the bad dreams when they try to reach Emma?
options: They get stuck in the dream catcher's web

questions.question: What kind of dreams does Emma have, thanks to the dream catcher?
options: Happy, sweet dreams of flowers, butterflies, and ice cream

title: The Runaway Kite
description: Follow the journey of inanimate kite, male boy in this story about the runaway kite.
content:
Ben has a new kite. It's red with a long yellow tail!

Today is perfect for flying kites. The wind is just right!

Ben and his dad go to the park.

Dad helps Ben get the kite into the air.

Up, up, up it goes!

The kite flies high in the sky.

Ben holds the string tight.

The wind pulls and pulls.

"Hold on!" says Dad.

But the wind pulls harder!

The string slips out of Ben's hands!

The kite flies away! Free!

"No! Come back!" calls Ben.

But the kite keeps flying. Over the trees!

Ben runs. Following the kite.

Dad runs too. "Don't lose sight of it!"

Where is the kite going?

The kite lands in a big field.

Ben and Dad run to the field.

They see the kite tangled in flowers!

But someone else is there too. A girl!

"Is this your kite?" asks the girl.

"Yes!" says Ben. "It flew away!"

The girl helps Ben untangle the kite.

"I'm Lily," says the girl. "Do you want to fly kites together?"

Lily has a blue kite!

Ben smiles. "Yes!"

Ben and Lily fly their kites together.

Red kite and blue kite! Side by side in the sky!

They make the kites swoop and dive.

Dad watches and smiles.

"Sometimes when things run away, they lead to new friends," says Dad.

Ben agrees. Best day ever!

questions.question: What color is Ben's new kite?
What happens when the wind pulls harder on Ben's kite?
options: The string slips from his hands

questions.question: Where does Ben's kite land after it flies away?
Who does Ben meet when he finds his kite?

title: Scout and the Secret Path
description: Follow the journey of male dog in this story about scout and the secret path.
content:
Scout is a golden dog with a curious nose.

He lives with his family at the edge of the woods.

Today, Scout is exploring. Sniff, sniff, sniff!

He smells something interesting!

Scout follows his nose into the forest.

Scout walks past big trees. Thick trees!

He walks past bushes. Green and leafy!

Then Scout sees something hidden behind the bushes.

A path! A small dirt path!

Scout has never seen this path before!

Scout walks down the secret path.

His tail wags. What will he find?

The path winds through the trees.

Left turn. Right turn.

Scout keeps walking. Sniff, sniff!

The path opens up into a clearing.

Scout stops. His mouth opens wide!

The most beautiful meadow he's ever seen!

Flowers everywhere! Yellow, purple, white!

Butterflies flutter around. Birds sing!

Scout runs through the meadow.

The flowers are so tall! They tickle his nose!

He chases a butterfly. It flies away.

He rolls in the soft grass. So happy!

This is the best secret place!

Scout runs back home to tell his family.

"Woof! Woof!" he barks.

His family follows him. Back through the secret path!

When they see the meadow, they gasp. "It's beautiful!"

"Good job, Scout!" they say.

Scout wags his tail proudly. He found the secret path!

questions.question: What kind of animal is Scout?
What does Scout discover hidden behind some bushes?
What does the secret path lead Scout to?
How does Scout feel when his family sees the meadow he found?

title: Mira's Mountain Climb
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about mira's mountain climb.
content:
Mira looks up at the big hill near her house.

It's the tallest hill around! Like a small mountain!

"I want to climb to the top," says Mira.

Her mom smiles. "Let's go together."

They start walking up the hill.

At first, the climb is easy.

Mira walks quickly. One step, two steps, three steps!

But soon the hill gets steeper.

"It's getting hard," says Mira.

"Take your time," says Mom. "Step by step."

Mira climbs higher. The path is narrow now.

Rocks stick out of the ground. Mira climbs over them!

She uses her hands to pull herself up.

"You're doing great!" says Mom.

Mira keeps climbing. One rock at a time.

Halfway up! Mira stops to rest.

She looks down. Wow! She can see her house!

Her house looks small from up here!

"We're so high!" says Mira.

"And we're only halfway," says Mom. "Want to keep going?"

"Yes!" says Mira.

Mira climbs the second half. It's the hardest part!

Her legs feel tired. But she doesn't give up!

Finally, Mira reaches the very top!

"I did it!" cheers Mira.

Mom hugs her. "You climbed the whole mountain!"

From the top, Mira can see everything!

Her town. The river. The forests. The farms!

Everything looks tiny from up here!

"The world looks different from the top," says Mira.

Mom nods. "That's what happens when you climb high."

Mira smiles proudly. She climbed a mountain today!

questions.question: What does Mira want to climb at the beginning of the story?
options: A big hill near her house

questions.question: Who goes with Mira on her climb?
What makes the climb harder as Mira goes higher up the hill?
What can Mira see from the very top of the hill?
options: Her house and the whole town

title: The Rolling Rock Adventure
description: Follow the journey of inanimate rock, animal friends in this story about the rolling rock adventure.
content:
At the top of a grassy hill sits a round, smooth rock.

Three animal friends are playing nearby.

Squirrel, Rabbit, and Mouse.

"Look at that big rock!" says Squirrel.

"I wonder what would happen if we pushed it," says Rabbit.

The three friends push the rock. Together!

Push! Push! Push!

The rock starts to move!

It rolls a little bit. Then a little more!

Then it starts rolling down the hill on its own!

"Whoa!" say the friends.

The rock rolls faster and faster!

"Let's ride it!" shouts Squirrel.

The three friends jump on top of the rolling rock!

They hold on tight!

The rock rolls down the hill. Faster! Faster!

"Wheee!" they all shout!

The wind blows through their fur!

The rock bounces over bumps! Bump, bump, bump!

They're all giggling and laughing!

This is so fun!

The rock rolls through a stream. Splash!

Water sprays everywhere!

"We're getting wet!" laughs Mouse.

The rock keeps rolling. Through the grass. Past the trees!

Finally, the rock slows down. It rolls to a stop at the bottom of the hill.

The three friends slide off. Dizzy but happy!

"That was the best ride ever!" says Rabbit.

"Let's push it back up and do it again!" says Squirrel.

They all agree. The rolling rock is the best adventure!

questions.question: Which three animal friends are playing near the big rock?
What do the friends do with the big, smooth rock?
options: They push it down a hill
They build a house on it

questions.question: What happens when the rock rolls through a stream?
What do the friends want to do after their first ride on the rolling rock?
options: Push it back up and do it again

title: Finn and the Deep Pool
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about finn and the deep pool.
content:
Finn is at the swimming pool with his family.

There are two pools. The shallow pool. And the deep pool.

Finn always swims in the shallow pool.

But today, he wants to see the deep pool!

"Can I swim there?" Finn asks Dad.

Dad holds Finn's hand. They walk to the deep pool.

Finn looks at the water. It's so blue! So deep!

"It's deep!" says Finn.

"Don't worry," says Dad. "I'll hold you."

Finn takes a deep breath. Time to try!

Finn and Dad go down the steps into the deep pool.

The water gets deeper. First Finn's knees. Then his waist. Then his chest!

Finn holds Dad's hand tight.

"I can still touch the bottom!" says Finn.

But barely!

They swim out a little farther.

Now Finn can't touch the bottom!

His legs kick. His arms paddle.

Dad holds him safe.

"Look down!" says Dad.

Finn looks. The bottom is far away!

Then Finn sees something amazing!

Colorful toys on the bottom! Diving rings! Sinkers!

"There are toys down there!" says Finn.

"Want to try diving for one?" asks Dad.

Finn nods. Nervous but excited!

Finn takes a big breath. He goes underwater!

He swims down. Down, down! His eyes are open!

He reaches a diving ring. He grabs it!

Finn swims back up. "I got one!"

Dad cheers. "You dove in the deep pool!"

Finn can't believe it. He swam in the deep pool!

questions.question: Which pool does Finn usually swim in, and which one does he want to try?
options: The deep pool, then the shallow pool
The kiddie pool, then the deep pool
The shallow pool, then the deep pool
The big pool, then the small pool

questions.question: Who holds Finn's hand and helps him in the deep pool?
What amazing thing does Finn see at the bottom of the deep pool?
What does Finn do for the first time in the deep pool?

title: Nova's Night Exploration
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about nova's night exploration.
content:
It's evening. The sun has set.

Nova looks out the window. The backyard is dark!

"Can we go outside?" asks Nova.

Mom gives her a flashlight. "Yes! Let's explore!"

Nova holds the flashlight. She's ready for adventure!

Nova steps into the backyard.

She turns on the flashlight. Click!

A beam of light shines in the dark!

She points it at the grass. She can see everything now!

"The flashlight makes the dark go away!" says Nova.

Nova walks around the yard with Mom.

She points the flashlight at different things.

The tree! The light shows its branches.

The flowers! The light shows their petals.

Everything looks different at night!

Nova points the flashlight at the fence.

Wait! Something is moving!

Nova looks closer. It's a tiny frog!

The frog hops. Hop, hop!

"A nighttime frog!" whispers Nova.

Then Nova sees something glowing! Without the flashlight!

Little lights floating in the air! Tiny and yellow!

"Fireflies!" says Mom.

Nova turns off her flashlight. She watches the fireflies.

Blink, blink, blink! They glow and float!

Nova and Mom sit on the grass. Watching the fireflies dance.

"Nighttime is magical," says Nova.

Mom agrees. "Different things come out at night."

Nova can't wait to explore at night again!

The dark isn't scary. It's full of surprises!

questions.question: What does Mom give Nova to explore the dark backyard?
What tiny animal does Nova find near the fence with her flashlight?
What glowing things does Nova see floating in the air without her flashlight?
How does Nova feel about nighttime at the end of the story?
options: Scared and wanting to go inside
Happy and knowing it's full of surprises

title: The Great Toy Car Race
description: Follow the journey of inanimate toy cars in this story about the great toy car race.
content:
In a playroom, five toy cars line up at the top of a ramp.

A red car. A blue car. A yellow car. A green car. And a tiny purple car.

"Ready to race?" asks the red car.

"Ready!" say the others.

They wait at the starting line.

"3... 2... 1... GO!"

All five cars roll down the ramp at once!

Zoom! Zoom! Zoom!

They race side by side! Who will win?

The red car is in front! Going fast!

"I'm the fastest!" shouts the red car.

But then the ramp gets bumpy!

The red car bounces. It slows down!

The blue car passes the red car!

Now the blue car is winning!

But there's a turn in the track!

The blue car is going too fast! It rolls off the track!

"Oops!" says the blue car.

Now the yellow car is in the lead!

The yellow car, green car, and tiny purple car race neck and neck!

They're all going the same speed!

The finish line is close!

Who will win? It's so close!

The three cars cross the finish line at almost the same time!

But the tiny purple car crosses first! By just a tiny bit!

"I won! I won!" cheers the tiny purple car.

"The smallest car won!" says the green car.

"Size doesn't matter in racing!" says the purple car proudly.

Everyone cheers for the tiny purple car!

questions.question: Where do the five toy cars line up for their race?
options: At the top of a ramp

questions.question: Which car is in the lead first, before the blue car passes it?
Why does the blue car roll off the track?
options: It was going too fast for the turn

questions.question: Which car wins The Great Toy Car Race?

title: The Treasure Map
description: Follow the journey of inanimate map, female pirate girl in this story about Pirate Story.
content:
Captain Cara is a pirate! Well, a pretend pirate.

She wears a pirate hat and carries a wooden sword.

Today, she finds an old paper in her grandma's attic.

It's a map! With an X on it!

"Treasure!" says Captain Cara.

The map shows Grandma's backyard!

There's a drawing of a tree. That's Grandma's oak tree!

There's a drawing of a shed. That's Grandma's garden shed!

And at the end... an X!

"The treasure is in the backyard!" says Cara.

Captain Cara goes outside with the map.

She walks to the oak tree first.

The map says: "3 steps to the left!"

Captain Cara takes three big steps left.

Then she looks at the map again.

The map says: "Walk to the shed!"

Captain Cara walks to the garden shed.

The map says: "5 steps behind the shed!"

Cara walks behind the shed. One, two, three, four, five!

She's standing right on the X now!

"Time to dig!" says Captain Cara.

She uses a small shovel. Dig, dig, dig!

Her shovel hits something hard. Clunk!

Cara digs around it. It's a box! A small wooden box!

"The treasure!" shouts Cara.

Cara opens the box carefully.

Inside: shiny gold coins! (Really chocolate coins in gold paper!)

And a note from Grandma: "For my favorite pirate! Love, Grandma."

Cara grins. "I found real pirate treasure!"

She runs to show Grandma.

Best treasure hunt ever!

questions.question: What does Captain Cara pretend to be?
What does Captain Cara find in her grandma's attic?
What is the first landmark Captain Cara goes to on the map?
What kind of treasure does Cara find in the wooden box?

title: Polly the Parrot
description: Follow the journey of female parrot in this story about Pirate Story.
content:
Polly is a bright green parrot with a red tail.

She lives on a pirate ship with Captain Jack.

Polly sits on Captain Jack's shoulder all day.

Her favorite thing to do? Repeat what people say!

She's very good at it!

Captain Jack looks through his telescope.

"Ahoy!" shouts Captain Jack.

"Ahoy!" repeats Polly.

The crew laughs!

Polly ruffles her feathers proudly.

Captain Jack talks to his crew.

"Hoist the sails!" shouts Captain Jack.

"Hoist the sails!" repeats Polly.

The crew hoists the sails.

Polly flaps her wings. She's helping!

The ship sails across the ocean.

Captain Jack sings a sea song. "Yo ho ho!"

"Yo ho ho!" sings Polly.

She's singing with the captain!

Everyone smiles. Polly is the best pirate parrot!

A sailor drops a rope. "Oops!" says the sailor.

"Oops!" says Polly.

Everyone laughs again!

Polly repeats everything! She can't help it!

It's what parrots do!

At sunset, the ship reaches the shore.

"Time to rest!" says Captain Jack.

"Time to rest!" says Polly.

Captain Jack scratches Polly's head. She closes her eyes.

"Goodnight, Polly," says Captain Jack.

"Goodnight, Polly," repeats Polly sleepily.

The best parrot on the seven seas!

questions.question: What color is Polly the parrot?
Who does Polly live with on the pirate ship?
What is Polly's favorite thing to do?
What does Polly say sleepily at the very end of the story?

title: The Pirate's Spyglass
description: Follow the journey of inanimate spyglass, male boy in this story about the pirate's spyglass.
content:
Jake finds a toy spyglass in the toy chest.

It's gold with black stripes! Just like a real pirate spyglass!

Jake holds it up to his eye.

He can see things far away! Well, a little bit!

"I'm a pirate!" announces Jake.

Jake walks around the house with his spyglass.

He looks through it at everything!

He looks at the couch. "A ship!"

He looks at the pillows. "Treasure!"

Everything looks more exciting through the spyglass!

Jake goes to the backyard.

He climbs on the sandbox. "This is my ship!"

He holds up his spyglass. "Land ho!"

He's looking for treasure island!

There! He sees it!

"Treasure island!" shouts Jake.

The "island" is really just the garden!

But in Jake's imagination, it's an island full of treasure!

Jake jumps off his "ship." Time to explore!

Jake runs to the garden with his spyglass.

He looks through it at the flowers. So colorful!

He looks at the rocks. Maybe treasure is under them!

He looks up at the sky. Birds flying like seagulls!

Jake's mom calls him. "Jake! Snack time!"

Jake looks through his spyglass at Mom.

"Permission to come aboard!" shouts Jake.

Mom laughs. "Permission granted, Captain Jake!"

Jake runs inside. He keeps his spyglass!

Every day can be a pirate adventure with a spyglass!

questions.question: What does Jake find in the toy chest?
What does Jake pretend the couch is when he looks through his spyglass?
Where does Jake go to play 'pirate' with his spyglass after looking around the house?
What does Jake shout to his Mom when she calls him for snack time?

title: The Friendly Pirate Ship
description: Follow the journey of inanimate ship in this story about the friendly pirate ship.
content:
The Little Ship is a small pirate ship.

She has a big white sail and a friendly face painted on her bow!

Unlike scary pirate ships, Little Ship is kind and helpful.

Today, she's sailing across the ocean. Looking for friends!

Little Ship sees a dolphin swimming.

"Hello, Dolphin!" calls Little Ship.

The dolphin leaps out of the water! Splash!

"Hello, Little Ship!" says the dolphin.

They swim together for a while. Friends!

Little Ship sails to a small island.

She sees children playing on the beach!

"Can we come aboard?" ask the children.

"Of course!" says Little Ship.

The children climb on. They pretend to sail!

Little Ship takes the children on a ride around the island.

Not too far! Just around in a circle.

The children pretend to be pirates! "Ahoy!"

Little Ship rocks gently. She's careful with her passengers!

Little Ship takes the children back to shore.

"Thank you, Little Ship!" say the children.

"Come back anytime!" says Little Ship.

She loves making friends happy!

Little Ship sails back out to sea.

The sun is setting. The sky is pink and orange.

"Today was a good day," thinks Little Ship.

She made new friends! That's what she loves most.

Being a friendly pirate ship is the best!

questions.question: What kind of ship is Little Ship?
Who is the first friend Little Ship meets on the ocean?
What do the children pretend to be when they are on Little Ship?
What does Little Ship love most about her day?

title: The Wishing Stone
description: Follow the journey of inanimate stone, female girl in this story about the wishing stone.
content:
Mira finds a smooth round stone by the river.

It's white with sparkles inside.

When she picks it up, it feels warm.

The stone whispers, "I am a wishing stone."

Mira gasps. "You can talk?"

"Yes," says the stone. "I can grant one small wish each day."

Mira thinks carefully.

"I wish for a flower," she says.

The stone glows softly.

A daisy appears in Mira's other hand!

"It worked!" says Mira.

The next day, Mira holds the stone again.

"I wish for a cookie," she says.

The stone glows.

A chocolate chip cookie appears!

Mira takes a bite. Delicious!

"Thank you, wishing stone!"

On the third day, Mira sees her friend looking sad.

"What's wrong?" asks Mira.

"I lost my toy car," says her friend.

Mira holds the wishing stone.

"I wish my friend could find his toy car."

The stone glows brighter than before!

Mira's friend looks under a bush.

"There it is!" he shouts. He picks up his toy car.

"I found it! Thank you, Mira!"

Mira smiles. The wishing stone feels extra warm.

That night, the wishing stone whispers to Mira.

"You used your wish to help someone else. That's the best kind of wish."

Mira hugs the stone gently.

"I'll keep wishing for good things," she says.

The stone sparkles happily.

questions.question: What does Mira find by the river?
What was Mira's very first wish with the stone?
What did Mira wish for on the third day?
options: Her friend could find his toy car

questions.question: What did the wishing stone whisper to Mira was the best kind of wish?
options: A wish to help someone else

title: Ember's Magic Paintbrush
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about ember's magic paintbrush.
content:
Ember loves to paint.

One day, she finds a paintbrush in her grandmother's attic.

It has a silver handle and soft bristles.

"This brush is special," says Grandma. "Whatever you paint comes to life for one minute."

Ember's eyes go wide. "Really?"

Ember dips the brush in blue paint.

She paints a butterfly on paper.

The butterfly flutters off the page! It flies around the room!

Ember laughs. "It's alive!"

After one minute, the butterfly floats back onto the paper.

Ember paints a yellow sun.

The sun floats up and glows warmly.

The room feels sunny and bright!

After one minute, the sun returns to the paper.

"This is amazing!" says Ember.

Ember paints a little bird.

The bird chirps and hops around.

It lands on Ember's finger.

"Hello, bird!" says Ember.

The bird sings a tiny song. Then it flies back to the paper.

Ember thinks carefully about what to paint next.

She paints a rainbow.

The rainbow arches across the room! All seven colors glow.

Ember stands under it. So beautiful!

After one minute, the rainbow fades back onto the paper.

Ember paints one more thing.

A heart.

The heart glows red and floats to Grandma.

It wraps around her in a warm hug.

"I love you, Grandma," says Ember.

Grandma smiles. "The magic brush knows when love is painted."

questions.question: Where did Ember find the special paintbrush?
What special ability does the magic paintbrush have?
options: Whatever you paint comes to life for one minute

questions.question: What was the first thing Ember painted that came to life?
What was the last thing Ember painted, and who was it for?

title: Princess Lily's Crown
description: Follow the journey of female princess in this story about princess lily's crown.
content:
Princess Lily has a golden crown.

But it's too big! It slides down over her eyes.

"I can't wear this crown," says Lily sadly.

The Queen looks at her. "You'll grow into it someday."

But Lily wants a crown NOW.

Lily goes to the castle garden.

She sees daisies growing. White petals, yellow centers.

Beautiful!

"I have an idea!" says Lily.

She starts picking daisies. One, two, three, four, five!

Lily sits on the grass.

She weaves the daisies together. Stem through stem.

Round and round. Making a circle.

It's hard! But Lily keeps trying.

Finally, Lily finishes!

A crown made of daisies!

She places it on her head carefully.

It fits perfectly!

The daisies smell sweet. They're soft and pretty.

Lily runs back inside. "Look at my crown!"

The Queen smiles. "A flower crown! How lovely!"

The King nods. "That's a crown fit for a princess."

Lily spins around. The daisy crown stays on!

Lily wears her daisy crown all day.

It doesn't fall off. It doesn't slide down.

"I like this crown better than the gold one," says Lily.

The Queen kisses her head. "Sometimes the best things are the ones we make ourselves."

questions.question: What was the problem with Princess Lily's golden crown?
What did Princess Lily use to make her new crown?
How did Lily's new daisy crown fit her?
options: It was a little too small

questions.question: What did the Queen tell Lily about the best things?
options: They are the ones we make ourselves

title: The Dancing Ball
description: Follow the journey of female princess, male prince in this story about the dancing ball.
content:
Tonight is the royal ball at the castle!

Princess Ava wears a beautiful blue dress.

Prince Leo wears a fancy suit.

Music plays in the grand ballroom.

"Would you like to dance?" asks Leo.

Ava has never danced before.

She's a little nervous.

"I don't know how," says Ava.

Leo smiles. "I'll show you! It's easy!"

He holds out his hand.

Ava takes Leo's hand.

They step onto the dance floor.

"Just follow my steps," says Leo.

Step to the left. Step to the right.

Ava watches Leo's feet and copies.

The music plays. Soft and pretty.

Leo and Ava dance together.

Step, step, spin!

Ava giggles when they spin. The room goes round and round!

"This is fun!" says Ava.

Other princes and princesses join the dance.

Everyone is spinning and stepping.

The ballroom is full of swirling dresses and happy faces.

Ava and Leo keep dancing.

They're getting better!

The music ends. Everyone claps!

Ava and Leo bow to each other.

"That was my first dance!" says Ava happily.

"You did great!" says Leo.

Ava smiles. Dancing at a ball is magical!

questions.question: Why was Princess Ava nervous about the royal ball?
Who taught Princess Ava how to dance?
What did Prince Leo tell Ava to do to learn dancing?
How did Princess Ava feel after her first dance?

title: Captain Finn's First Voyage
description: Follow the journey of male pirate boy in this story about captain finn's first voyage.
content:
Finn puts on his pirate hat.

He gets his toy boat. A wooden ship with a sail!

"I'm Captain Finn!" he announces.

Bath time is here. But today, bath time is a pirate adventure!

Finn climbs into the bathtub.

The water is warm and bubbly.

He puts his ship in the water. It floats!

"Setting sail!" says Captain Finn.

He pushes the boat. It glides across the tub.

"Land ho!" shouts Finn.

He spots an island! (His rubber duck.)

The ship sails closer.

"Drop the anchor!" says Finn.

He stops the boat next to the duck.

"What's that?" Finn looks down into the water.

He sees something shiny at the bottom of the tub!

A coin! (Really a bottle cap, but it looks like treasure!)

"Pirate treasure!" shouts Finn.

Finn reaches into the water.

He grabs the "treasure"!

Shiny and round. Perfect pirate treasure!

"I found it!" says Captain Finn proudly.

He puts the treasure in his boat.

Captain Finn sails back across the tub.

What an adventure! He found treasure!

Mom comes in. "Time to get out, Captain Finn."

Finn climbs out, dripping water.

"I'm a real pirate now!" says Finn.

Tomorrow, he'll sail again!

questions.question: What did Finn put on to become Captain Finn?
Where did Captain Finn's pirate adventure take place?
What did Captain Finn use as his 'island'?
What 'treasure' did Captain Finn find at the bottom of the tub?

title: The Buried Treasure
description: Follow the journey of inanimate treasure chest, female girl in this story about the buried treasure.
content:
Nora is at the beach with her family.

She has a toy shovel and bucket.

"I'm going to find buried treasure!" says Nora.

She starts digging in the sand.

Dig, dig, dig!

Nora digs a big hole.

Sand flies everywhere!

No treasure yet.

She moves to a different spot and digs again.

Dig, dig, dig!

Nora's shovel hits something hard.

Clunk!

"What's that?" Nora digs faster.

She brushes sand away with her hands.

Something wooden! Buried in the sand!

Nora pulls it out.

A small wooden box!

It's not a real treasure. Dad buried it there for her to find!

But Nora doesn't know that. To her, it's real!

"Treasure!" shouts Nora.

Nora opens the box carefully.

Inside: Beautiful shells! All different colors and shapes.

Pink shells. White shells. Spiral shells.

"Real treasure!" says Nora.

She holds them gently.

Nora runs to show Mom and Dad.

"I found buried treasure!"

Dad winks at Mom. "What lucky treasure hunter!"

Nora clutches her shells. The best treasure ever!

She'll keep them forever.

questions.question: Where was Nora looking for buried treasure?
What did Nora's shovel hit while digging?
What did Nora find inside the wooden box?
Who had actually buried the treasure for Nora?

title: The Friendly Dragon
description: Follow the journey of male dragon in this story about the friendly dragon.
content:
Spark is a baby dragon.

He's small and green with tiny wings.

Spark can breathe fire, but only little puffs!

Puff! A small flame comes out.

Spark is still learning.

Spark lives in a cave in the mountains.

He's lonely. No other dragons live nearby.

One day, Spark hears voices.

He peeks out of his cave.

A boy is hiking with his dad!

Spark wants to say hello.

But he's shy. What if they're scared of him?

The boy sits down to rest. He's close to the cave!

Spark takes a deep breath.

He steps out. "H-hello?"

The boy sees Spark. His eyes go wide!

"A dragon!" says the boy.

Spark freezes. Will the boy run?

But the boy smiles! "A baby dragon! You're so small!"

Spark relaxes. The boy isn't scared!

"I'm Spark," says the dragon shyly.

"I'm Oliver," says the boy. "Want to be friends?"

Spark's eyes light up! "Really?"

"Really!" says Oliver.

He sits down next to Spark. They talk and talk.

Now Spark isn't lonely anymore!

Oliver visits every week.

They play together. Spark shows Oliver how he breathes fire. Puff!

Oliver shows Spark how to skip rocks.

Spark is so happy. He has a friend!

Not all dragons are scary. Some are friendly!

questions.question: What is the baby dragon's name?
Why was Spark feeling lonely in his cave?
Who was the first person Spark met and befriended?
How did Oliver react when he first saw Spark?
options: He smiled and wanted to be friends

title: Knight Lily's Quest
description: Follow the journey of female knight in this story about knight lily's quest.
content:
Lily is a young knight.

She wears silver armor and carries a wooden sword.

Today, she has a quest!

"Find the missing dragon egg," says the King.

Lily nods. "I'll find it!"

Lily walks through the forest.

She looks behind trees. Under bushes. In hollow logs.

No dragon egg yet.

But Lily doesn't give up!

Knights are brave and determined!

Lily hears a sound. Chirping!

She follows the sound to a big nest in a tree.

Inside the nest—a blue egg!

But it's not the dragon egg. It's a bird's egg!

"Wrong egg," says Lily. She keeps searching.

Lily crosses a stream.

The water is cold on her feet!

On the other side, she sees a cave.

"Maybe the egg is in there!" says Lily.

She walks into the cave carefully.

At the back of the cave, Lily sees it!

A big egg with sparkly scales!

The dragon egg!

"I found it!" says Lily.

She picks it up carefully. It's warm!

Lily brings the egg back to the castle.

A mother dragon is waiting!

"My egg!" says the dragon happily.

She nuzzles the egg gently.

"Thank you, brave knight," says the dragon.

Lily bows. "You're welcome!"

The King gives Lily a medal. "Quest complete!"

questions.question: What was Knight Lily's quest assigned by the King?
options: To find the missing dragon egg

questions.question: What did Lily mistakenly find in a tree nest before finding the real egg?
Where did Knight Lily finally find the dragon egg?
What did the King give Knight Lily for completing her quest?

title: The Singing Flowers
description: A story about the singing flowers.
content:
Oliver is walking through his grandma's garden.

Roses! Tulips! Daisies! Sunflowers!

So many beautiful flowers!

Oliver stops to smell a red rose.

He hears something. A tiny sound!

Ding!

The rose made a sound! Like a small bell!

"Did you hear that, Grandma?" asks Oliver.

Grandma smiles. "Touch it gently and see."

Oliver touches the rose petal softly. Ding! There it is again!

Oliver touches a yellow tulip. Chime! A different sound!

He touches an orange daisy. Bong! Lower and deeper!

"Grandma! The flowers are singing!" says Oliver.

Oliver runs around the garden touching flowers!

Each flower makes its own special sound!

Purple flower: Trill!

White flower: Hum!

Pink flower: Ting!

Music fills the garden!

Oliver touches three flowers in a row.

Ding, chime, bong!

It sounds like a little song!

He tries again. Ding, chime, bong!

"I'm making music!" says Oliver.

Grandma sits on the bench and watches.

Oliver creates songs with the flowers!

Fast: ding-chime-bong-trill-hum!

Slow: ding... chime... bong...

Each pattern makes different music!

A butterfly lands on a flower.

The flower hums softly.

"Even the butterfly likes the singing flowers!" says Oliver.

The butterfly's wings flutter to the music!

Oliver sits next to Grandma.

"Why do your flowers sing?" asks Oliver.

Grandma winks. "They sing for people who take time to really notice them."

Oliver smiles. He'll visit the singing garden every day!

And he'll always listen carefully!

questions.question: What kind of garden was Oliver exploring when he heard a sound?
What did Oliver discover when he touched the red rose gently?
What happened when Oliver touched different flowers in the garden?
options: They all made the same sound
Each flower made its own special sound

questions.question: What did Grandma say was the reason the flowers sang?
options: They sang for people who really notice them

title: The Invisible Hat
description: A story about the invisible hat.
content:
Max finds an old hat in his attic.

It's dusty and blue with a wide brim.

He puts it on his head.

His little sister walks right past him!

"Lucy! I'm right here!" calls Max.

But Lucy doesn't stop!

Max walks downstairs. His mom is in the kitchen.

"Mom! Can I have a cookie?"

Mom looks around. "Max? Where are you?"

She's looking RIGHT at him! But she can't see him!

Max takes off the hat. "I'm right here!"

Mom jumps! "Max! Where did you come from?"

Max looks at the hat. Could it make him invisible?

Max puts the hat back on.

"Max? You disappeared again!" says Mom.

Max takes it off. "Here I am!"

"That's a magic hat!" says Mom.

"Can I keep it?" asks Max.

Mom nods. "But use it wisely."

Max tests the invisible hat!

He puts it on and walks to the living room.

Dad is reading the newspaper.

Max walks right in front of Dad. Dad doesn't look up!

"This is amazing!" thinks Max.

Max goes to find Lucy. She's playing with blocks.

Max puts on the invisible hat to surprise her.

But something strange happens!

He appears! The hat stops working!

Max is confused. Then he realizes: he was going to scare Lucy. That wasn't kind!

Maybe the hat only works when you're being kind?

Max tests his idea.

He puts on the hat and thinks about helping Lucy.

He stays invisible!

He quietly picks up Lucy's toy from under the couch.

He places it next to her and takes off the hat.

"Max! You found my toy!" Lucy hugs him.

Max smiles. The invisible hat only works when you're being kind and helpful!

questions.question: How did Max first realize the hat was magical?
options: His mom told him it was magic.
His little sister Lucy walked right past him without seeing him.
He read a label inside the hat.

questions.question: Why did the invisible hat stop working when Max tried to surprise Lucy?
options: The hat ran out of magic.
Max was going to scare Lucy, which wasn't kind.
Max took the hat off by accident.

questions.question: What did Max learn about the invisible hat's magic?
options: It only works in the attic.
It only works for one hour a day.
It only works when he's being kind and helpful.
It only works when no one else is home.

title: Cloud Shapes Come Alive
description: A story about cloud shapes come alive.
content:
Emma loves to draw.

Today she's lying in the grass, looking at clouds.

"That cloud looks like a bunny!" says Emma.

She draws a fluffy white bunny.

As soon as Emma finishes, something magical happens!

The cloud bunny in the sky starts to move! It hops!

"Whoa!" says Emma.

The cloud bunny bounces across the sky!

Emma draws another cloud. This one looks like a bird!

She draws it carefully.

The cloud bird flaps its wings! It flies in circles!

Emma can't believe her eyes!

"The clouds come alive when I draw them!" says Emma.

She looks for more cloud shapes.

A cloud fish! Emma draws it. The cloud fish swims through the sky!

Emma draws more!

Cloud turtle—moves slowly!

Cloud butterfly—flutters its wings!

Cloud dog—wags its tail!

The sky is full of moving cloud animals!

Emma's mom comes outside.

"Look, Mama! I made the clouds come alive!"

Mama sees all the clouds moving!

"That's beautiful, Emma!"

Emma draws one more cloud. A heart!

She colors it carefully.

The cloud heart glows pink in the sky!

It floats down toward Emma.

The cloud heart touches Emma's hand gently. Soft and cool like mist!

Then it floats back up.

All the cloud shapes wave goodbye and drift away.

"Come back tomorrow!" calls Emma.

Magic happens when you use your imagination!

questions.question: What did Emma do that made the cloud shapes come alive?
options: She sang a song to them.
She drew them in her sketchbook.

questions.question: What was special about the cloud heart Emma drew?
options: It glowed pink and floated down to touch her hand.

questions.question: What is the main message of 'Cloud Shapes Come Alive'?
options: It's important to spend time outside.
Magic happens when you use your imagination.

questions.question: What happened to all the cloud animals at the end of the story?
options: They stayed in the sky forever.
They waved goodbye and drifted away.
They flew down to play with Emma.

title: The Talking Teddy
description: A story about the talking teddy.
content:
Leo has many stuffed animals. But his favorite is Mr. Snuggles, a brown teddy bear!

Leo hugs Mr. Snuggles every night.

Tonight feels different.

Leo is feeling sad. His best friend moved away.

Leo hugs Mr. Snuggles tight. "I miss my friend," whispers Leo.

Suddenly, a soft voice says, "I know you do."

Leo looks around. Who said that?

"It's me. Mr. Snuggles," says the voice.

Leo stares. "You can TALK?"

"Only to children who really need a friend," says Mr. Snuggles gently.

"You're really talking!" says Leo.

"I am. Want to tell me about your friend?" asks Mr. Snuggles.

Leo tells him everything. About the games they played. The fun they had.

Mr. Snuggles listens to every word.

"Your friend had to move far away," says Mr. Snuggles. "But you can still remember all the good times."

"I miss him," says Leo.

"That's okay. Missing someone means you care about them," says Mr. Snuggles.

Leo feels a little better.

"Will you always be able to talk?" asks Leo.

"Whenever you really need me, I'll be here," says Mr. Snuggles.

Leo hugs him tight. "Thank you."

The next morning, Leo tries to talk to Mr. Snuggles.

"Good morning, Mr. Snuggles!"

But Mr. Snuggles doesn't answer. He's just a regular teddy now.

Leo understands. Mr. Snuggles talks only when Leo really needs him.

Leo keeps Mr. Snuggles on his bed.

Sometimes, when Leo feels sad or lonely, he hugs Mr. Snuggles.

And sometimes—just sometimes—Mr. Snuggles whispers, "You're not alone. I'm here."

Leo smiles. He has a very special teddy bear!

questions.question: Why did Mr. Snuggles start talking to Leo?
options: Leo was feeling sad because his best friend moved away.
Mr. Snuggles was an old, antique teddy bear.
Leo gave him a special toy.

questions.question: What did Mr. Snuggles tell Leo about missing his friend?
options: He told Leo to forget his friend.
He said missing someone means you care about them.
He suggested Leo find a new best friend immediately.
He told Leo to stop being sad.

questions.question: When does Mr. Snuggles talk to Leo?
options: Only when Leo is playing with other toys.
Only when Leo really needs a friend.
Whenever Leo asks him a question.

title: The Growing Garden
description: A story about the growing garden.
content:
Lily has a packet of flower seeds.

Her grandma gave them to her.

"These are magic seeds," says Grandma with a wink.

"Magic?" asks Lily.

"Plant them and you'll see!"

Lily digs small holes in the garden.

She drops one seed in each hole.

She covers them with dirt. Pat, pat, pat.

"Now you sing to them," says Grandma.

Lily giggles. "Sing to seeds?"

Lily tries. She sings: "La la la, grow flowers, la la la!"

Suddenly, the dirt moves!

A tiny green sprout pops up!

"Grandma! Look!" shouts Lily.

The sprout grows taller as Lily sings!

Up, up, up! Leaves appear! A bud forms!

The bud opens into a beautiful red flower!

All in just seconds!

"They ARE magic seeds!" says Lily.

Lily sings to the other seeds.

More sprouts pop up! They grow into flowers!

Yellow! Pink! Purple! Orange!

The garden fills with color!

Lily experiments!

Loud song—flowers grow BIG!

Quiet song—flowers grow small and delicate!

Fast song—flowers bloom quickly!

Slow song—flowers open slowly, petal by petal!

Lily's friends come over.

"Can I try?" asks one friend.

She sings to a seed. A blue flower grows!

All the children take turns singing!

The garden becomes a rainbow!

Grandma watches from the porch.

"The magic isn't just in the seeds," says Grandma. "It's in your voice. When you share joy, beautiful things grow."

Lily smiles. She'll sing to her garden every day!

questions.question: What special instruction did Grandma give Lily about the seeds?
options: She told Lily to water them twice a day.
She said Lily needed to plant them at night.
She told Lily to sing to them.
She said Lily should keep them in a dark place.

questions.question: How did the speed of Lily's singing affect the flowers' growth?
options: A fast song made flowers bloom quickly.
A slow song made flowers grow bigger.
Loud songs made flowers grow slowly.
Quiet songs made flowers change color.

questions.question: What did Grandma say the magic truly was?
options: It was only in the special seeds.
It was in Lily's singing voice and when she shares joy.
It was in the type of soil they used.

title: The Time-Traveling Door
description: A story about the time-traveling door.
content:
Ben's closet door is old and wooden.

Usually it opens to his closet. Clothes and toys.

But today, something is different!

When Ben opens the door, he sees... snow!

"What?" says Ben.

Ben steps through carefully.

Crunch! His feet land in cold snow!

He's outside! In winter!

But it was summer a second ago!

The door is still there, standing in the snow.

Ben touches the snow. Cold and wet! He makes a snowball.

Then he hears his mom calling. "Ben! Lunch time!"

Ben steps back through the door.

He's in his room again! Summer! Warm!

The snowball melts immediately.

"This door goes to winter!" says Ben excitedly.

The next day, Ben opens it again.

This time: flowers! Lots of flowers! Spring!

Ben steps through. Birds sing! Everything is green!

Ben picks a yellow flower.

He steps back through.

He's in summer again! The flower is still in his hand!

"The door goes to different seasons!" realizes Ben.

The next morning: Fall! Orange and red leaves everywhere!

Ben jumps into crunchy leaves! So fun!

He collects colorful leaves and brings them back.

Ben tells his mom about the magic door.

"Show me!" says Mom.

They open it together.

But now it just shows Ben's regular closet!

Mom looks confused.

When Mom leaves, Ben tries again.

Winter appears!

"The door only shows magic to me," thinks Ben.

Every day, Ben visits a different season!

The time-traveling door is his special secret!

questions.question: When Ben first opened his closet door, what did he see instead of his clothes and toys?
What did Ben realize about the magic door after opening it multiple times?
options: It always leads to the same place.
It travels to different times of day.
It can take him to outer space.

questions.question: Why couldn't Ben's mom see the magic when they opened the door together?
options: The magic only works for children.
Ben had closed it too quickly.
The door was tired of doing magic.

questions.question: What did Ben bring back from his visits through the door?
options: Nothing, it was just a dream.
A snowball, a yellow flower, and colorful leaves.

title: The Pocket Full of Stars
description: A story about the pocket full of stars.
content:
Maya is stargazing with her dad.

The night sky is full of twinkling stars!

"I wish I could touch a star," says Maya.

"Look! A shooting star!" says Dad.

A streak of light falls!

The shooting star lands in the grass!

Maya runs over. A tiny glowing star!

"It's still glowing!" says Maya.

She picks it up. Warm and shiny!

She puts it in her pocket.

That night, Maya looks at the star.

Beautiful! Glowing softly!

"I wonder if there are more," thinks Maya.

She looks out at the sky. Another shooting star! And another!

Maya runs outside. She catches falling stars!

One, two, three, four, five!

She puts them all in her pockets!

Her pockets glow! Full of stars!

Maya brings them inside. She pours them on her bed.

They twinkle and shine like tiny nightlights!

"These are beautiful!" says Maya.

She counts them. Ten stars!

But the stars start to look sad. They flicker.

"What's wrong?" asks Maya.

One star whispers, "We miss the sky."

Maya understands. The stars belong up high!

Maya takes them outside.

"How do I get you back?" asks Maya.

"Just throw us up high. We'll find our way home," says the smallest star.

Maya tosses them up one by one. Up, up, up!

The stars zoom back into the sky!

They twinkle extra bright, saying thank you!

Maya waves. "Come visit anytime!"

Every night, a few stars come down to visit Maya.

They play in her pocket, then fly back home.

Maya and the stars are friends forever!

questions.question: How did Maya get the first tiny glowing star?
options: Her dad bought it for her.
She found it in her room.
A shooting star landed in the grass.
She wished on a star and it flew down.

questions.question: What made the stars in Maya's pocket look sad and flicker?
options: They missed the sky and their home.

questions.question: How did Maya help the stars return to the sky?
options: She waited for them to fly up on their own.
She threw them up high, and they zoomed back.
She asked her dad for help.
She built a ramp for them to climb.

questions.question: What is the relationship between Maya and the stars at the end of the story?
options: They never see each other again.
The stars are scared of Maya.
They are friends, and some stars come to visit Maya every night.
Maya only looks at them from afar.

title: The Sleepy Moon's Lullaby
description: A story about the sleepy moon's lullaby.
content:
The Moon rises in the evening sky.

She's tired. She's been shining for many nights.

"I'm so sleepy," yawns the Moon.

But she has an important job! She has to watch over the world!

How can she stay awake?

The Moon decides to sing a lullaby.

She hums softly. "Hmmmm, hmmmm."

Her gentle song drifts down to Earth.

It floats through windows and doorways.

In a house below, a little girl named Emma hears it.

"What's that pretty sound?" asks Emma.

She lies in bed listening.

The Moon's song is soft and sweet.

Emma's eyes start to feel heavy.

In another house, a boy named Jack hears it too.

"Mama, what's that singing?" asks Jack.

"Shh, listen," says Mama.

The Moon's lullaby fills the room.

Jack yawns. So sleepy...

All over the world, children hear the Moon's lullaby.

They stop playing. They lie down and listen.

The Moon's song is like a warm blanket.

"Hmmmm, hmmmm," sings the Moon.

One by one, children fall asleep.

Emma closes her eyes! Jack snuggles his teddy!

Babies stop crying and drift off!

The Moon's lullaby works!

But now the Moon has a problem!

Her own lullaby is making HER sleepy too!

"Oh no! I can't fall asleep!" yawns the Moon.

She tries to stay awake. But her song is so peaceful...

The Moon's eyes close. Just for a moment.

She's still in the sky, but resting.

The stars watch over her.

When morning comes, the Sun wakes her gently.

"Time to rest properly," says the Sun.

Tonight, she'll sing her lullaby again!

questions.question: Why did the Moon decide to sing a lullaby?
options: She wanted to wake everyone up.
She was bored and wanted something to do.
She was tired and needed to stay awake to watch the world.

questions.question: What effect did the Moon's lullaby have on the children on Earth?
options: It made them want to play more.
It made them fall asleep peacefully.

questions.question: What problem did the Moon face because of her own lullaby?
options: It made her sing too loudly.
It made her feel even more wide awake.
It made her sleepy too, and her eyes closed.

title: The Dragon's Treasure
description: A story about the dragon's treasure.
content:
Drake is a young dragon. Green with golden eyes!

He lives in a cave on the mountain.

Today, Drake finds sparkly rocks!

Red rocks! Blue rocks! Rocks that sparkle!

"Treasure!" says Drake excitedly.

Drake collects the shiny rocks. He makes a big pile!

"My treasure!" says Drake proudly.

He guards it carefully.

A bird flies into the cave.

"What beautiful rocks!" says the bird.

"They're MINE! You can't have any!" says Drake.

The bird flies away sadly.

Drake sits on his rocks. All alone.

The next day, a squirrel comes.

"Those rocks are so pretty!" says the squirrel.

"Mine! Go away!" growls Drake.

The squirrel leaves. Drake sits alone again.

Drake looks at his pile of rocks.

He has so many! Too many for one dragon!

But he has no friends.

"What good is treasure if I'm all by myself?" thinks Drake.

Drake has an idea!

He picks up his favorite rocks.

He flies down to find the bird.

"Here. I want you to have these," says Drake.

The bird is surprised! "Really?"

"Really," says Drake.

Drake finds the squirrel too.

He gives the squirrel shiny rocks.

"Thank you!" says the squirrel happily.

Drake feels warm inside. Sharing feels good!

Drake flies back to his cave.

Now he has less treasure. But he has more friends!

The bird and squirrel visit every day! They play together!

"This is better than rocks!" says Drake happily.

Sharing treasure brings you something better—friends!

questions.question: What did Drake first do with the sparkly rocks he found?
options: He shared them with the bird and squirrel.
He made a big pile and guarded them carefully.
He used them to decorate his cave.
He ate them for a snack.

questions.question: Why did Drake decide to share his treasure with the bird and the squirrel?
options: He had too many rocks and didn't want them anymore.
He realized having treasure was not good if he was all by himself.
His mom told him to share.
The bird and squirrel stole some of his rocks.

questions.question: What was the 'better' treasure Drake found by sharing?

title: The Brave Squire
description: A story about the brave squire.
content:
Tom is a squire at the castle!

A squire helps knights get ready!

Tom's job is to help Sir William, the bravest knight!

Every morning, Tom brings armor. Heavy and shiny!

Today there's a tournament! Knights will compete!

"I'm nervous," says Sir William.

"You're the bravest knight!" says Tom.

"Even brave knights get nervous," says Sir William.

Tom helps Sir William put on armor.

Chest plate—click!

Arm guards—click, click!

Leg guards—click, click!

Helmet! Sir William looks ready!

But as Sir William walks to his horse, armor falls off! Clang!

"Oh no! The buckle broke!" says Sir William.

The tournament starts in five minutes! What can they do?

Tom thinks fast! He takes off his own belt!

"Use this!" says Tom.

He ties the armor with his belt.

"Perfect! You saved the day!" says Sir William.

Sir William rides to the tournament field.

Tom watches from the side.

Sir William competes! He wins!

Everyone cheers!

The King calls Tom forward.

"This squire showed quick thinking and bravery! He helped when it mattered most!"

The King gives Tom a medal!

Tom holds his medal proudly.

"You're not just a squire, Tom. You're a brave squire!" says Sir William.

Someday, Tom will be a knight too!

But for now, he's the best squire he can be!

Being brave is about helping when it matters most!

questions.question: What was Tom's job as a squire?
options: To cook meals for the knights.

questions.question: What problem did Sir William have just before the tournament?
options: A buckle on his armor broke.
He forgot the rules of the tournament.

questions.question: How did Tom solve Sir William's armor problem?
options: He ran to get a new piece of armor.
He used his own belt to tie the armor.
He told Sir William to skip the tournament.

questions.question: What did the King give Tom for his quick thinking and bravery?
options: A bigger room in the castle.

title: The Dragon Who Loved Stories
description: A story about the dragon who loved stories.
content:
Ruby is a dragon who lives in the mountains.

She's big and red with golden horns!

Ruby has a secret. She doesn't like treasure or fighting.

Ruby loves stories! But she can't read!

One day, a boy named Sam gets lost hiking.

He wanders into Ruby's cave.

"A dragon!" gasps Sam.

"A boy!" gasps Ruby.

They stare at each other nervously.

"Please don't eat me!" says Sam.

Ruby laughs. A big, warm laugh.

"I don't eat people! I eat berries!"

Sam relaxes. "Why are you in my cave?"

"I'm lost," says Sam.

Sam sits down, tired.

He pulls a book from his backpack.

Ruby's eyes light up! "What's that?"

"A book of adventure stories," says Sam.

"Stories! Will you read to me?" asks Ruby.

Sam is surprised. A dragon who wants stories?

"Sure," says Sam.

He opens the book and reads.

Ruby listens with big eyes. She loves every word!

Sam reads three stories.

Ruby loves them all!

"That was wonderful! Will you come back and read more?" asks Ruby.

"Really?"

"Really! And I'll help you get home safely!"

Ruby flies Sam down the mountain.

"Come back tomorrow?" asks Ruby hopefully.

"I will!" promises Sam.

From that day on, Sam visits Ruby every week!

He brings new books!

They sit together. Sam reads. Ruby listens!

Sometimes Ruby acts out the stories! She pretends to be knight!

Sam laughs!

"I have the best friend ever," says Sam.

"Me too," says Ruby happily.

A dragon who loves stories and a boy who loves to read!

questions.question: What was Ruby the dragon's secret love?
How did Ruby and Sam first meet?
options: Sam found Ruby's cave while lost hiking.
Sam saw Ruby at a dragon convention.

questions.question: What did Sam do for Ruby when they became friends?
options: He taught her how to fly.
He read adventure stories to her.

questions.question: What does this story teach us about friendship?
options: Friends always have to be the same.
You can find friends in unexpected places, even if they are very different from you.
Dragons and humans can never be friends.
Sharing books is only for humans.

title: The Shining Sword
description: A story about the shining sword.
content:
Knight Aria finds an old sword in the castle.

It's dusty and dull. But it feels special!

"Can I take this sword?" Aria asks the King.

"That old thing? I suppose so," says the King.

Aria cleans the sword.

As Aria polishes, it starts to glow!

Soft golden light!

A voice whispers: "I am the Sword of Kindness."

"You can talk?" asks Aria.

"I glow when my knight does kind things," says the sword.

"I'm going to be a kind knight!" says Aria.

She straps the sword to her belt.

But it doesn't glow yet.

"I have to show kindness first," thinks Aria.

Aria walks through the village.

She sees an old woman carrying heavy bags.

"Let me help!" says Aria.

She carries the bags.

"Thank you!" says the woman.

Aria feels warmth at her side.

The sword is glowing! Just a little!

"I did something kind!" says Aria happily.

Aria helps more people!

She helps a child find their puppy—sword glows brighter!

She shares her lunch—sword glows even more!

She fixes a fence—sword shines bright gold!

Soon, everyone knows Knight Aria!
