Not because she's strongest or fastest.

But because she's the kindest!

Her glowing sword lights up the village!

"Your sword is amazing!" says a little girl.

Aria kneels. "The sword glows because of kindness."

"Can anyone make it glow?"

"Anyone who does kind things," says Aria.

The sword shines proudly.

Being kind is the most powerful thing a knight can do!

questions.question: What kind of sword did Knight Aria find in the castle?
What made the Sword of Kindness glow brighter?
options: Aria polishing it with special oils
Aria doing kind things for people

questions.question: Which of these was NOT something Aria did to make her sword glow?
options: Helped an old woman with bags
Helped a child find their puppy

questions.question: By the end of the story, what was Knight Aria known for in the village?

title: The Castle Defense
description: A story about the castle defense.
content:
Sir Leo is guarding the castle.

He's a young knight. This is his first real job!

"Keep watch for danger," said the King.

Leo stands at the wall. Watching. Waiting.

Dark clouds gather! A storm is coming!

Wind blows hard! Thunder crashes! BOOM!

"This is a big storm!" says Leo.

The wind gets stronger! Things fly through the air!

A tree branch breaks! It flies toward the castle window!

"Oh no!" shouts Leo.

If it breaks the window, rain will flood inside!

Leo tries to block it. Too small!

Suddenly, a dragon swoops down!

A big green dragon!

Leo raises his sword. "A dragon!"

But the dragon catches the branch!

"You... saved the window?" says Leo, confused.

"I'm Ember. I live in the mountain. This is my home too!" says the dragon.

"You want to help?" asks Leo.

"Of course!" says Ember.

Leo and Ember work together!

When roof tiles blow loose, Ember catches them!

When rain floods the gate, Leo opens drainage!

When lightning strikes, Ember blocks it with her scales!

Together, they keep the castle safe!

When the storm ends, the King comes out.

"Sir Leo! You protected the castle!"

"It wasn't just me. Ember helped!" says Leo.

The King smiles at the dragon.

"Then Ember is a friend of the castle. Thank you!"

Ember bows. "Happy to help!"

From that day on, Leo and Ember guard together!

A knight and a dragon—the best defenders!

Working together is stronger than working alone!

questions.question: What was Sir Leo's first real job as a young knight?
Who unexpectedly helped Sir Leo protect the castle during the storm?
What did the dragon Ember do to help protect the castle?
options: She used her fire breath to melt ice
She caught a tree branch and roof tiles
She dug a trench around the castle

questions.question: What did the King say about Ember after the storm ended?
options: She was a danger to the castle
She was a friend of the castle
She was a regular storm cloud

title: The Baby Dragon's First Flight
description: A story about the baby dragon's first flight.
content:
Spark is a baby dragon.

He's small and purple with tiny wings!

All the other dragons can fly! But Spark has never flown.

Today, Mama says it's time to try!

Spark stands at the edge of a small cliff.

Not too high. Just high enough.

"Flap your wings!" says Mama.

Spark flaps. Flutter, flutter! But his feet stay down.

"Jump! Jump and flap!" says Mama.

Spark is scared. What if he falls?

"I'll catch you if you need me," says Mama.

Spark takes a deep breath. He jumps!

Spark is falling! He flaps fast! Flutter, flutter, flutter!

Wait—he's not falling anymore! He's floating!

"I'm flying!" shouts Spark!

Spark wobbles in the air. Left, right, up, down!

Flying is tricky! He tilts too far and starts to fall.

Mama swoops under him. "Keep flapping! You can do it!"

Spark flaps harder! His wings get stronger!

He floats higher! He's really flying now!

Spark flies in a circle around Mama!

"Look at me!" shouts Spark.

"You're a natural!" says Mama.

Spark practices all day!

He learns to go higher! To turn! To do a little loop!

Well, almost. He gets dizzy!

By evening, Spark is tired. But happy!

He lands gently next to Mama.

"I can fly!" says Spark proudly.

"I'm so proud of you!" says Mama.

Tomorrow, he'll fly even better!

Sometimes you just have to jump and try!

questions.question: What color was Spark the baby dragon?
Why was Spark scared to try flying for the first time?
options: He was worried he might fall

questions.question: Who promised to catch Spark if he needed help while flying?
How did Spark feel after he finally learned to fly?

title: The Knight's Shield
description: A story about the knight's shield.
content:
Young Knight Ben gets his first shield!

Wood and metal! Strong and sturdy!

A lion is painted on the front.

"This shield will protect you," says the weapon master.

Ben straps it to his arm. Heavy!

Ben's training begins!

Another knight throws soft practice balls.

"Block them with your shield!"

Bonk! The first ball hits Ben's shoulder. He missed!

Ben tries again.

Bonk! Another ball gets through.

Ben feels frustrated. This is hard!

"Watch the ball carefully. Move your shield!" says the instructor.

Ben focuses. Here comes another ball!

Ben moves his shield. Thwack! The ball hits the shield!

"I blocked it!" shouts Ben.

"Good! Again!"

More balls come. Ben blocks most of them now!

His shield protects him!

The next day, Ben practices more.

Running with the shield—harder than he thought!

Climbing with the shield—even harder!

But Ben keeps practicing! Every day, he gets better!

One day, a real emergency!

A barrel rolls down the hill toward chickens!

It's going to crush them!

Ben runs over with his shield!

Ben holds his shield in front of the chickens.

THUD! The barrel crashes into it!

Ben's arm shakes. But he holds steady!

The barrel bounces away! The chickens are safe!

"You did it, Ben!" cheers the instructor.

Ben looks at his shield. The lion seems to smile.

"We did it together," says Ben.

From that day on, Ben knows his shield isn't just for training.

It's for protecting others!

Ben carries his shield proudly!

A knight's shield protects those who can't protect themselves!

questions.question: What animal was painted on Young Knight Ben's first shield?
What did Ben first practice blocking with his new shield?
What real emergency did Ben use his shield to help with?
options: Blocking a barrel rolling towards chickens

questions.question: What important lesson did Ben learn about his shield by the end of the story?
options: It was too heavy to carry
It was only good for training

title: The Backwards Day
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the backwards day.
content:
Leo wakes up one morning feeling silly.

"Today is Backwards Day!" he announces.

His mom laughs. "What does that mean?"

"Everything backwards!" says Leo.

He puts his shirt on backwards. The tag is in front!

Leo walks backwards to the kitchen.

Bump! He walks into a chair.

"Oops!" Leo giggles.

He tries again. Backwards, backwards, backwards.

He makes it to the table!

For breakfast, Leo eats dessert first.

A cookie! Chocolate chips for breakfast!

Then he eats his cereal.

"This is a funny breakfast," says Mom.

Leo grins with cookie crumbs on his face.

Leo tries to talk backwards.

"Olleh!" he says. (That's "hello" backwards!)

"Eybdoog!" (That's "goodbye!")

Mom tries too. "Oel!"

They both laugh. Backwards talking is hard!

Leo puts his shoes on the wrong feet.

Left shoe on right foot. Right shoe on left foot.

He tries to walk. Wobble, wobble!

"This feels weird!" Leo laughs.

He switches them back. Much better!

By bedtime, Leo is tired.

"Backwards Day is fun," says Leo. "But I'm dizzy!"

He gets into bed. The right way.

"Goodnight, Leo," says Mom.

"Thgindoog!" says Leo.

Mom laughs. Even bedtime is backwards!

questions.question: What special day did Leo announce it was?
What did Leo eat first for breakfast on Backwards Day?
What did Leo try to do with his shoes on Backwards Day?
options: Put them on the wrong feet

questions.question: How did Leo say 'goodnight' to his mom at the end of Backwards Day?

title: The Hiccupping Dragon
description: Follow the journey of male dragon in this story about the hiccupping dragon.
content:
Drake is a young dragon.

Most dragons breathe fire.

But Drake has a problem.

Every time he tries to breathe fire, he hiccups instead!

HIC! Out comes a bubble.

Drake tries again.

He takes a deep breath. He opens his mouth.

HIC!

Another bubble! It floats away.

"Why can't I breathe fire?" Drake asks his mom.

"You're still learning," says Mom Dragon.

Drake practices all day.

HIC! Bubble.

HIC! Bubble.

HIC! Bubble.

Soon there are bubbles everywhere!

The other dragons laugh. "Look at Drake's bubbles!"

Drake feels embarrassed.

He goes to the cave to hide.

A little girl walks by. She sees all the bubbles.

"Wow! Beautiful bubbles!" she says.

She starts popping them. Pop, pop, pop!

The girl giggles. "Can you make more bubbles?"

Drake hiccups. HIC! A big bubble appears!

The girl chases it and pops it.

"This is the best!" she says.

Drake smiles. Maybe bubbles aren't so bad.

Drake keeps hiccupping bubbles.

All the village children come to play!

They pop bubbles and laugh.

Drake doesn't feel embarrassed anymore.

"Bubbles are fun!" says Drake.

HIC! The biggest bubble yet!

questions.question: What problem did Drake the young dragon have instead of breathing fire?
What came out of Drake's mouth every time he hiccupped?
Who first showed Drake that his bubbles were fun and beautiful?
How did Drake feel about his bubbles by the end of the story?
options: He thought they were very silly

title: Socks on the Wrong Feet
description: Follow the journey of inanimate socks, female girl in this story about socks on the wrong feet.
content:
Mia opens her sock drawer. She has lots of socks! Stripes, dots, plain colors. Today, Mia picks a purple sock and an orange sock. Different socks! She sits on the floor to put them on.

Mia pulls the purple sock onto her right foot. But the sock wiggles! It doesn't want to stay! The purple sock pulls itself off and hops to the left foot. "Hey!" says Mia. "Wrong foot!" The purple sock doesn't listen.

Mia tries to put the orange sock on her left foot. But that sock wiggles too! The orange sock jumps to the right foot! Now both socks are on the wrong feet! Mia looks down at her feet. This is silly!

Mia tries to switch them. She pulls off the purple sock. She puts it on the left foot. But as soon as she lets go—WHOOSH! The purple sock jumps back to the right foot! "You silly socks!" giggles Mia.

Mia tries again. And again. And again! Every time, the socks switch themselves. Purple on the right. Orange on the left. That's where they want to be! Mia can't stop giggling.

Finally, Mia gives up. "Okay, socks! You win!" She stands up. The socks stay put this time. Purple on the right. Orange on the left. Wrong feet! But Mia doesn't mind. Her silly socks make her smile. Sometimes, wrong is just funny!

questions.question: What two colors of socks did Mia choose from her drawer?
What did the socks do when Mia tried to put them on her feet?
options: They jumped onto the wrong feet

questions.question: What happened every time Mia tried to switch the socks to the correct feet?
How did Mia feel about her socks being on the 'wrong' feet in the end?
options: She was angry and took them off
She didn't mind and thought it was funny
She cried because they wouldn't listen

title: The Upside-Down Cake
description: Follow the journey of inanimate cake in this story about the upside-down cake.
content:
Today is Leo's birthday! Mama made a chocolate cake. Round and tall. It sits on the table. Frosting on top. Candles waiting. The cake looks perfect! But this cake has a secret. It's a magic cake!

Mama brings the knife to cut the cake. But just as the knife touches the frosting—FLIP! The cake turns upside down! Now the frosting is on the bottom! The plain part is on top! "What?" says Mama, surprised.

Mama flips the cake right-side up again. Frosting back on top. There! She tries to cut again. The knife gets close and—FLIP! Upside down again! Leo laughs. "The cake is playing tricks!"

Mama tries one more time. She's very fast this time! She cuts quickly! But the cake is faster! FLIP! Upside down before the knife can slice! Everyone laughs. Even Mama! "This is a very silly cake!" says Mama.

Leo has an idea. "Maybe the cake wants to be upside down!" Mama thinks. "Let's try it!" She leaves the cake upside down. Frosting on the bottom. She cuts the cake. Slowly. Carefully. The cake doesn't flip!

The upside-down cake lets Mama cut it! Everyone gets a piece. Delicious! "We ate upside-down cake!" says Leo, giggling. The cake seems happy. It got to be upside down all along! Sometimes, things like to be different. And that's okay!

questions.question: What kind of cake did Mama make for Leo's birthday?
What happened every time Mama tried to cut the magic birthday cake?
Whose idea was it to try cutting the cake while it was upside down?
How did the cake react when Mama tried to cut it while it was upside down?
options: It let Mama cut it easily

title: Giggle the Tickle Monster
description: Follow the journey of male monster in this story about giggle the tickle monster.
content:
In a cave on a hill lives a small monster named Giggle. Giggle is fuzzy and purple. He has tiny horns and big feet. But Giggle isn't scary. He's too busy giggling! Because Giggle is a tickle monster. And tickle monsters can't stop tickling!

Every morning, Giggle wakes up and tickles himself. He tickles his own feet. His toes wiggle! "Hee hee hee!" giggles Giggle. He tickles his own belly. His tummy jiggles! "Ha ha ha!" laughs Giggle. He can't stop giggling!

Giggle goes outside. He sees a butterfly. "Want to be tickled?" asks Giggle. The butterfly lands on Giggle's nose. Giggle tickles the butterfly's wings gently. Flutter, flutter! The butterfly flies away, fluttering happily.

Giggle sees a rabbit hopping by. "Want to be tickled?" asks Giggle. The rabbit's nose twitches. "Okay!" Giggle tickles the rabbit's fuzzy ears. The rabbit hops up and down, giggling! "That tickles!"

Giggle sees children playing in the meadow. "Want to be tickled?" asks Giggle. The children run over. "Yes!" Giggle tickles everyone! Gentle tickles on arms and tummies. Everyone laughs and giggles together!

By bedtime, Giggle is tired from all the tickling. He curls up in his cave. But before he falls asleep, he tickles his own feet one more time. "Hee hee hee!" giggles Giggle softly. Even monsters need to giggle before bed!

questions.question: What color was Giggle the tickle monster?
What does Giggle do first thing every morning?
Which of these animals did Giggle tickle?
How did the children feel after Giggle tickled them?

title: The Dancing Broccoli
description: Follow the journey of inanimate broccoli, male boy in this story about the dancing broccoli.
content:
Ethan sits at the dinner table. Mama puts a plate in front of him. Chicken. Rice. And... broccoli! Ethan looks at the broccoli. Green and bumpy. "I don't like broccoli," says Ethan.

Ethan picks up his fork. He reaches for the broccoli. But the broccoli moves! It slides away! Ethan blinks. Did the broccoli just move? He tries again. The broccoli slides to the other side of the plate!

The broccoli stands up! It balances on its stem like a tiny tree. Then it starts to dance! Left, right, left, right! The broccoli wiggles and jiggles on the plate!

Ethan laughs. "The broccoli is dancing!" Mama looks over. The broccoli freezes. Totally still. "What's so funny?" asks Mama. "Nothing," says Ethan, trying not to giggle. As soon as Mama looks away, the broccoli dances again!

The broccoli spins around. It does a little hop! Ethan giggles so hard his tummy hurts. "You're a silly broccoli!" says Ethan. The broccoli bows. Like it's saying "thank you!" Ethan claps.

"Okay, okay," says Ethan. "If you stop dancing, I'll eat you!" The broccoli stops. It lies down on the plate. Ethan takes a bite. Crunchy! Not too bad! "You're funny, broccoli," says Ethan, chewing. From now on, broccoli isn't so bad. Especially dancing broccoli!

questions.question: What vegetable did Ethan say he didn't like at dinner?
What special trick did the broccoli do on Ethan's plate?
What happened to the broccoli when Mama looked over at Ethan's plate?
What did Ethan promise to do if the broccoli stopped dancing?
options: He would play a game with it
He would put it back in the kitchen
He would draw a picture of it

title: The Sneezing Scarecrow
description: Follow the journey of inanimate scarecrow in this story about the sneezing scarecrow.
content:
In the middle of a cornfield stands a scarecrow. He wears a floppy hat and a checkered shirt. Straw sticks out everywhere! His job is to scare away birds. But this scarecrow has a problem. He sneezes!

A crow flies over the field. The crow sees yummy corn. It swoops down! The scarecrow tries to look scary. He stands very still. But then—"Ah... ah... ACHOO!" The scarecrow sneezes! Straw flies out of his sleeves!

The sneeze is SO LOUD that the scarecrow scares himself! He jumps! His hat falls off! "ACHOO! ACHOO!" More sneezes! The scarecrow wobbles on his stick! The crow flies away, but not because the scarecrow is scary. Because the sneezing is so loud!

A sparrow lands on the scarecrow's shoulder. "Are you okay?" asks the sparrow. "I can't stop sneezing!" says the scarecrow. "Achoo!" "Maybe it's all the straw," says the sparrow. "Straw is dusty!" The scarecrow sneezes again. "ACHOO!"

The farmer hears the sneezing. He comes to check on the scarecrow. "Why are you sneezing?" asks the farmer. "Too much straw!" says the scarecrow between sneezes. The farmer takes out some of the dusty straw. He puts in fresh, clean straw instead. "How's that?" asks the farmer.

The scarecrow takes a deep breath. No sneeze! "Much better!" says the scarecrow. "Thank you!" The birds stay away now. Not because the scarecrow is scary. Because the scarecrow is happy and not sneezing! A happy scarecrow is the best scarecrow!

questions.question: What was the scarecrow's main problem in the cornfield?
options: He was too short to scare birds.

questions.question: Why did the scarecrow keep sneezing?
options: The straw inside him was dusty.

questions.question: Who helped the scarecrow with his sneezes?
After the scarecrow stopped sneezing, why did the birds stay away?
options: He was happy and not sneezing.

title: The Burping Teapot
description: Follow the journey of inanimate teapot, female grandma in this story about the burping teapot.
content:
Grandma has a very old teapot. It's white with pink flowers painted on it. Every afternoon, Grandma makes tea in her teapot. But this teapot is a little bit silly!

Grandma fills the teapot with hot water. She adds tea leaves. The teapot sits on the stove. The water starts to boil. Most teapots whistle when they're ready. But this teapot doesn't whistle. It burps!

BURRRP! A loud burp comes out of the teapot's spout! Grandma laughs. "Oh my! Excuse you, teapot!" BURRRP! The teapot burps again! Grandma's granddaughter, Lily, giggles. "The teapot burped!"

Grandma pours the tea into cups. Carefully. BURRRP! One more burp as the tea pours out! Lily laughs so hard she has to hold her tummy. "That's the funniest teapot ever!" says Lily. Grandma nods. "It's been burping for years!"

Lily and Grandma sit down for tea. They sip their tea. Warm and sweet. The teapot sits on the table, steaming gently. BURRRP! One tiny burp. "Excuse you!" says Lily to the teapot, giggling.

"Why does it burp?" asks Lily. Grandma smiles. "I think it's just happy to make tea!" Lily pats the teapot gently. "You're a good teapot. Even if you burp!" BURRRP! The teapot seems to agree. Every teatime is funny with a burping teapot!

questions.question: What special sound did Grandma's teapot make when the tea was ready?
options: It made a loud burping sound.

questions.question: Who found the teapot's burps to be very funny?
options: No one, they thought it was strange.

questions.question: What did Grandma think was the reason the teapot burped?
options: It was happy to make tea.
It had too many tea leaves.

questions.question: How did Lily feel about the burping teapot?
options: She said it was the funniest teapot ever.
She was scared of its burps.

title: The Mirror That Made Faces
description: Follow the journey of inanimate mirror, female girl in this story about the mirror that made faces.
content:
Ava finds an old mirror in the attic. It's round with a gold frame. A little dusty. Ava wipes it clean. She looks at her reflection. But something is strange about this mirror!

Ava smiles at the mirror. Her reflection smiles back. But the reflection has a HUGE smile! Much bigger than Ava's! "Whoa!" says Ava. "That's a big smile!" She smiles again. The mirror makes it even bigger!

Ava makes a surprised face. Eyes wide! Mouth open! The mirror shows her surprised face. But the eyes are EXTRA wide! The mouth is SUPER open! Ava laughs. "You make my faces bigger!" The mirror seems to agree!

Ava tries different faces. Silly face! The mirror makes it extra silly—tongue out super far! Sleepy face! The mirror makes it extra sleepy—eyes barely open! Grumpy face! The mirror makes it extra grumpy—eyebrows down low!

Ava's brother walks by. "What are you doing?" "Look at this mirror!" says Ava. "It makes funny faces!" Her brother looks in the mirror. He sticks his tongue out. The mirror shows his tongue SUPER long! Like a giraffe! They both laugh!

Ava and her brother play with the mirror all afternoon. They make faces. The mirror makes them funnier! "This is the best mirror ever!" says Ava. The mirror seems to sparkle. It loves making people laugh!

questions.question: What special thing did the old mirror Ava found do?
options: It showed her a different person.
It made her faces look bigger and funnier.

questions.question: Who did Ava show the funny mirror to?
How did the mirror make Ava's brother's tongue look when he stuck it out?
What did Ava say about the mirror at the end of the story?
options: It was the best mirror ever.

title: The Silly Hat Parade
description: Follow the journey of inanimate hats, kids in this story about the silly hat parade.
content:
Today is the town parade! Five children line up to march. They all wear special hats! Sam wears a tall top hat. Mia wears a sun hat. Ollie wears a baseball cap. Zoe wears a beret. And Finn wears a cowboy hat. "Let's march!" says Sam.

The parade music starts! The children march down the street. But something strange happens. The hats start to move! Sam's top hat wiggles. Then it hops off his head! PLOP! The top hat lands on Mia's head! Now Mia has two hats!

Mia's sun hat doesn't like sharing! It jumps off Mia's head! PLOP! The sun hat lands on Ollie's head! Now Ollie has a sun hat AND a baseball cap! "What's happening?" laughs Ollie.

The hats keep switching! Ollie's baseball cap jumps to Zoe's head! Zoe's beret jumps to Finn's head! Finn's cowboy hat jumps to Sam's head! Now everyone has a different hat! The children giggle and march with silly hats!

The hats switch again! And again! By the end of the parade, the hats have switched five times! Everyone is wearing someone else's hat! The crowd watching the parade laughs and claps!

At the end of the parade, the children stop marching. The hats finally stay still. "That was the silliest parade ever!" says Mia. Everyone agrees. Switching hats made it extra fun! The children bow. The crowd cheers!

questions.question: What special event was happening in the town?
What strange thing happened with the children's hats during the parade?
How many children were marching in the parade?
How did the crowd watching the parade react to the silly hats?

title: The Confused Refrigerator
description: Follow the journey of inanimate fridge, male boy in this story about the confused refrigerator.
content:
Max opens the refrigerator to get milk. But when he opens the door—BRRR! Cold air blasts out! Max looks inside. Ice cream! Frozen peas! Popsicles! "This is the freezer!" says Max. "Not the fridge!" He closes the door. Confused.

Max tries the other door. The freezer door. He opens it. Inside is milk! Cheese! Apples! "Now the fridge is in the freezer!" says Max. The refrigerator is very confused! It switched sides!

Mama comes to see. "What's wrong, Max?" "The fridge mixed up!" says Max. Mama opens the fridge door. The freezer stuff is inside! She opens the freezer door. The fridge stuff is inside! "Oh my!" says Mama, laughing.

The refrigerator hums loudly. Like it's thinking. Then—CLICK! The doors switch back! Fridge on the left! Freezer on the right! "Good job, fridge!" says Mama. Max claps.

Max opens the fridge door again. Milk, cheese, apples. Perfect! He gets the milk out. He pours a glass. The refrigerator hums happily. It figured it out! "You're a smart fridge," says Max.

From that day on, the refrigerator never gets confused again. Fridge on the left. Freezer on the right. But sometimes, late at night, the refrigerator hums a little louder. Maybe it's remembering the day it got mixed up!

questions.question: What was wrong with the refrigerator at first?
options: It was making too much ice.
The freezer stuff was in the fridge, and vice versa.

questions.question: Who was the first person to notice the refrigerator's mix-up?
What did the refrigerator do to fix its problem?
options: It hummed loudly, then clicked and switched back.

questions.question: What happened to the refrigerator after it fixed itself?
options: It made everything taste like ice cream.

title: The Ticklish Tree
description: Follow the journey of inanimate tree, kids in this story about the ticklish tree.
content:
In the park stands a very old oak tree. Big and strong! Branches reaching high! The children love to climb this tree. But this tree has a secret. It's ticklish!

Lily climbs onto the lowest branch. She wraps her arms around the trunk. The tree starts to shake! Just a little. A soft giggle seems to come from the tree. "Did you hear that?" asks Lily.

Ben climbs up too. He touches the bark gently. The tree shakes more! The branches wiggle! A louder giggle! Like the tree is laughing! "The tree is ticklish!" says Ben. Lily and Ben look at each other. This is amazing!

More children climb the tree. They tickle the trunk gently. The tree wiggles and shakes! The leaves rustle! Giggle, giggle, giggle! The whole tree is laughing! The children laugh too!

The children tickle the tree softly. They don't want to hurt it. Just gentle tickles. The tree sways happily. The branches lift up and down. Like the tree is dancing! "The tree likes being tickled!" says Lily.

The children stop tickling. They sit on the branches. The tree is still now. Calm and happy. "Thank you for letting us climb you," says Ben. The tree's leaves rustle gently. Like it's saying "you're welcome." The ticklish tree is the best tree in the park!

questions.question: What secret did the old oak tree in the park have?
How did the tree react when the children tickled its trunk?
What did Lily and Ben say the tree was doing when it wiggled and shook?
How did the children treat the ticklish tree?
options: They tried to climb to the very top.
They carved their names into it.

title: Two Swings, One Friend
description: Follow the journey of male and female kids in this story about two swings, one friend.
content:
Sam and Maya are at the playground.

They both run to the swings.

But there's a problem.

Only one swing is available! The other one is broken.

Sam gets there first. He sits down.

Maya stops. She wanted to swing too.

Maya looks sad.

Sam sees her face.

"Do you want to swing?" asks Sam.

"Yes," says Maya quietly. "But you got here first."

Sam thinks. He doesn't want his friend to be sad.

"You can go first," says Sam. He gets off the swing.

Maya's face brightens. "Really?"

"Really," says Sam. "I can wait."

Maya sits on the swing. Sam pushes her gently.

"Higher!" laughs Maya.

Sam pushes Maya on the swing.

She goes higher and higher!

"Wheee!" Maya shouts happily.

Sam smiles. Making his friend happy feels good.

After a few minutes, Maya drags her feet to stop.

"Your turn, Sam!" says Maya.

She gets off the swing.

Sam sits down. Now Maya pushes him!

"Higher!" laughs Sam.

Maya pushes as hard as she can.

Sam swings up, up, up!

Sam and Maya take turns.

Push, swing, push, swing.

Both friends get to play.

"Taking turns is fair," says Maya.

"And more fun!" says Sam.

They swing until it's time to go home.

questions.question: What problem did Sam and Maya find at the playground?
options: There were no balls to play with.
The sandbox was full of water.

questions.question: Who got to the only working swing first?
What did Sam do when he saw Maya looked sad because she couldn't swing?
options: He told her to find another swing.
He got off and let her go first.
He swung really fast by himself.
He told her to wait a very long time.

questions.question: What lesson did Sam and Maya learn by the end of the story?
options: It's always better to be first.
Taking turns is fair and more fun.

title: Leo's Sad Day
description: Follow the journey of male boy, friend in this story about leo's sad day.
content:
Leo sits on the steps outside.

His head is down. His shoulders are droopy.

He feels sad today. He doesn't know why.

Sometimes feelings just come.

Leo's friend Mia walks by.

She sees Leo looking sad.

"Hi, Leo," says Mia.

Leo looks up. "Hi."

"Why do you look sad?" asks Mia.

Leo shrugs. "I just feel sad."

Mia nods. "That happens sometimes."

Mia doesn't say, "Don't be sad."

She doesn't say, "Cheer up!"

Instead, Mia sits down next to Leo.

She doesn't say anything. She just sits.

They sit together on the steps.

After a while, Leo takes a deep breath.

"Thanks for sitting with me," says Leo.

"You're welcome," says Mia. "Do you want to talk about it?"

Leo thinks. "Not really. I just didn't want to be alone."

Mia nods. "I can stay."

They sit quietly together.

Mia picks up a stick and draws in the dirt.

Leo watches. He picks up a stick too.

They draw squiggly lines and shapes.

Not talking. Just being together.

After a while, Leo feels a little better.

Not all the way better. But a little bit.

"I'm glad you're here," says Leo.

"Me too," says Mia.

Sometimes, friends don't have to fix things.

They just have to stay.

questions.question: How was Leo feeling at the beginning of the story?
What did Mia do when she saw Leo was sad?
options: She told him to cheer up.
She sat down quietly beside him.

questions.question: What did Leo say he needed from Mia?
options: He wanted her to make him laugh.
He just didn't want to be alone.
He needed her to solve his problem.
He wanted her to get him a snack.

questions.question: What did Leo and Mia do together after a while?
options: They drew squiggly lines and shapes with sticks.
They talked about their favorite movies.

title: The Honest Finder
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the honest finder.
content:
Oliver is playing in the park.

He sees something shiny under the slide.

Oliver crawls under and picks it up.

It's a toy truck! Red with yellow wheels.

"Cool!" says Oliver.

Oliver plays with the truck.

Vroom, vroom! He rolls it in the dirt.

But then Oliver hears crying.

A little boy is looking around, sniffling.

"What's wrong?" asks Oliver.

"I lost my truck," says the little boy. "My red truck."

Oliver looks at the truck in his hand.

Red. With yellow wheels.

This is the boy's truck.

Oliver feels his tummy twist.

Oliver really likes this truck.

He could keep it. The boy doesn't know Oliver found it.

But that wouldn't be right.

Oliver takes a deep breath.

"Is this your truck?" Oliver asks. He holds it out.

The little boy's face lights up!

"Yes! You found it!"

He takes the truck and hugs it.

"Thank you, thank you!" says the boy.

Oliver feels warm inside. Different from before. Better.

The little boy's mom walks over.

"Thank you for being honest," she says to Oliver.

Oliver smiles. "I wanted to keep it. But it wasn't mine."

Mom nods. "That was the right choice."

Oliver feels proud. Being honest feels good.

questions.question: What did Oliver find under the slide in the park?
How did Oliver feel when he heard the little boy crying about his lost truck?
options: Excited to have a new toy.
His tummy twisted with a dilemma.
Happy that someone else was sad.

questions.question: What choice did Oliver make about the truck?
options: He gave the truck back to its owner.

questions.question: How did Oliver feel after returning the truck to the little boy?
options: He felt angry that he lost a toy.
He felt warm inside and proud.
He felt confused why he did it.

title: The Shared Blanket
description: Follow the journey of inanimate blanket, two kids in this story about the shared blanket.
content:
Ben and Sara are playing outside.

The sun goes down. It gets cold.

Ben shivers. "Brrr!"

Sara shivers too. "I'm cold!"

They run to the porch where a blanket sits on the chair.

Ben grabs the blanket first.

He wraps it around himself.

"Ahh, warm!" says Ben.

Sara looks cold. She hugs herself.

"Can I have some blanket?" asks Sara.

Ben holds the blanket tight. "But then I'll be cold."

Ben looks at Sara. She's shivering.

Then Ben looks at the big blanket. It's pretty big.

"Maybe we can share," says Ben.

"How?" asks Sara.

Ben opens one side of the blanket. "Come here."

Sara steps closer.

Ben wraps half the blanket around Sara.

Now they're both under the same blanket!

Standing close together.

"Better?" asks Ben.

"Much better!" says Sara.

Ben and Sara stand together under the blanket.

They're both warm now!

"Sharing the blanket works," says Sara.

"And we're both cozy," says Ben.

They smile at each other.

Mom calls from inside. "Time to come in!"

Ben and Sara walk to the door together.

Still under the shared blanket.

They learned something important today:

Sharing means everyone gets what they need.

questions.question: Why did Ben and Sara run to the porch?
options: To get out of the rain.
Because they were cold as the sun went down.

questions.question: Who grabbed the blanket first?
options: No one, it fell on them.

questions.question: How did Ben and Sara solve the problem of being cold with only one blanket?
options: They fought over who would keep it.
They decided to go inside and get warmer.
They shared the blanket and stood close together.
They found another blanket in the house.

questions.question: What important lesson did Ben and Sara learn by the end of the story?
options: It's better to keep things for yourself.
Sharing means everyone gets what they need.
Only one person can be warm at a time.

title: Tying My Shoes
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about tying my shoes.
content:
Jake has new shoes.

They have laces! Not velcro. Real laces.

"Can you teach me to tie them?" Jake asks his dad.

Dad sits down. "Let's try!"

Jake sits next to him.

Dad shows Jake step by step.

"First, make an X with the laces."

Jake tries. The laces cross. X!

"Good!" says Dad. "Now pull one lace through."

Jake pulls. It makes a knot!

"I did it!" says Jake.

"Now comes the tricky part," says Dad. "Make two loops. Like bunny ears."

Jake tries to make loops.

One loop. Then another loop.

They look floppy. But they're there!

"Bunny ears!" says Jake.

"Now tie the bunny ears together," says Dad.

Jake tries. The loops twist and fall apart.

"Oops," says Jake.

"That's okay," says Dad. "Try again."

Jake tries again. The laces get messy.

Jake keeps trying.

Again. And again. And again.

Sometimes the loops fall apart.

Sometimes the knot gets too tight.

But Jake doesn't give up.

"One more time," says Jake.

Jake makes the X. Makes the knot. Makes the bunny ears.

He twists them together and pulls.

The bow stays!

"I did it!" Jake shouts. "I tied my shoe!"

Dad gives him a high-five.

Jake looks at his tied shoe. He feels so big.

"I can tie my own shoes now!"

questions.question: What kind of shoes did Jake get?
What was the 'tricky part' of tying shoes for Jake, according to his dad?
options: Making an X with the laces
Pulling one lace through to make a knot
Making two loops like bunny ears
Putting the shoes on his feet

questions.question: What did Jake do when his laces got messy or the loops fell apart?
options: He gave up and asked his dad to do it
He kept trying again and again
He decided he didn't want to tie his shoes

questions.question: How did Jake feel when he finally tied his shoe?

title: Ava's Big Bed
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about ava's big bed.
content:
Ava has slept in a crib her whole life.

But today is special.

Mama and Papa bring in a new bed. A BIG bed!

"This is your big girl bed," says Mama.

Ava's eyes go wide. It's huge!

The bed has pink sheets and a soft pillow.

Ava climbs up. She has to use a step stool!

She sits on the bed. It feels different from her crib.

"It's so big!" says Ava.

She bounces a little. Boing, boing!

That night, bedtime comes.

Mama tucks Ava into the big bed.

"Goodnight, big girl," says Mama.

She turns off the light and leaves.

Ava lies in the dark. The bed feels very big.

And very empty.

Ava looks around. The room looks different from her bed.

She can see more things. The door. The window. The toy shelf.

It's a little scary.

"Mama?" calls Ava quietly.

Mama comes back. "What's wrong?"

"The bed is too big," whispers Ava.

Mama sits on the edge of the bed.

"Big beds take getting used to," says Mama. "Want your stuffed bunny?"

Ava nods.

Mama hands her the soft bunny.

Ava hugs it close. That's better.

"You're a big girl now," says Mama. "And big girls sleep in big beds."

Ava takes a deep breath.

She can do this. She's a big girl now.

"Goodnight, Mama," says Ava.

"Goodnight, sweetie," says Mama.

Ava closes her eyes. Bunny is warm in her arms.

The bed doesn't feel too big anymore.

Ava falls asleep. In her big girl bed.

questions.question: What did Ava sleep in before she got her new big bed?
Why did Ava call for Mama after being tucked into her new bed?
options: She was hungry for a snack
She was scared because the bed felt too big and empty
She wanted to play a game
She needed to go to the potty

questions.question: What did Mama give Ava to help her feel better in the big bed?
How did Ava feel about her big bed at the very end of the story?
options: She still thought it was too big and scary
She decided she wanted her crib back
She felt cozy and fell asleep in it
She wanted to bounce on it all night

title: The Red Ball Rolls
description: Follow the journey of inanimate ball in this story about the red ball rolls.
content:
A red ball sits on the grass.

Shiny. Round. Still.

A small hand reaches out.

Tiny fingers touch the ball.

Push!

The ball rolls.

Slowly at first. Over the flat grass.

Roll, roll, roll.

The ball feels the sunshine. Warm!

Roll, roll, roll.

The grass ends. The ground slopes down.

The ball rolls faster!

Down the small hill. Bouncing a little.

Bounce, roll, bounce!

The ball is having an adventure!

The ball reaches the bottom of the hill.

It rolls into a garden.

Past flowers. Past a butterfly.

Roll, roll, roll.

Then—BUMP!

The ball hits a rock. Gently.

The ball stops rolling.

It sits next to the rock.

Still again.

The butterfly lands on top of the ball.

Little feet run down the hill.

The toddler finds the ball!

"Ball!" says the happy voice.

Tiny hands pick up the red ball.

The ball is hugged tight.

Tomorrow, the ball will roll again.

questions.question: Who or what first made the red ball roll?
After rolling over flat grass, what did the ball do next?
options: It rolled up a tall tree
It rolled down a small hill

questions.question: Where did the ball roll into after the hill?
What caused the red ball to finally stop rolling?
options: It got stuck in a puddle
The toddler picked it up while it was still rolling

title: Clap, Clap, Clap
description: Follow the journey of male baby in this story about clap, clap, clap.
content:
Baby Noah sits on his blanket.

He looks at his hands.

Two hands. He has fingers!

Noah brings his hands together.

CLAP!

Noah's eyes go wide.

What was that sound?

He claps again. CLAP!

He made the sound! With his hands!

Noah smiles big.

CLAP! CLAP! CLAP!

Noah keeps clapping.

His hands make noise!

Mama hears. She comes over.

"Are you clapping?" Mama asks.

She claps too. CLAP!

Noah watches Mama clap.

Then he claps again. CLAP!

Mama claps. CLAP!

Noah claps. CLAP!

They're clapping together!

Noah giggles.

Papa hears the clapping.

He comes over and claps too!

CLAP, CLAP, CLAP!

Now everyone is clapping!

Noah claps faster. His hands move up and down.

CLAP, CLAP, CLAP, CLAP!

Noah's hands get tired.

He stops clapping.

He looks at his hands. Amazing!

Tomorrow, Noah will clap again.

But right now, he waves bye-bye with his hands instead.

Bye-bye!

questions.question: What new sound did Baby Noah discover he could make?
How did Noah react the first time he made the sound?
options: His eyes went wide with surprise
He ignored it and looked away
He immediately tried to do it again

questions.question: Who joined Noah in making the new sound?
What did Noah do after his hands got tired from making the sound?

title: Grandpa's Garden
description: Follow the journey of male grandpa, boy in this story about grandpa's garden.
content:
Ethan visits Grandpa's house.

Grandpa is in the garden, wearing his big sun hat.

"Want to help me?" asks Grandpa.

"Yes!" says Ethan.

Grandpa gives Ethan a small watering can.

First, they water the tomato plants.

Ethan pours water on the roots. Carefully.

"Not too much," says Grandpa. "Just enough."

The water soaks into the soil.

The tomato plants look happy!

Next, they pull weeds.

"Weeds take food from our good plants," explains Grandpa.

Ethan pulls a weed. It comes out with a POP!

"Good job!" says Grandpa.

They pull weeds together. The garden looks neater.

Grandpa picks a ripe red tomato.

He hands it to Ethan. "You helped grow this!"

Ethan holds the tomato. Warm from the sun.

"Really?" asks Ethan.

"Really," says Grandpa. "Your watering helped it grow."

They sit on the bench under the tree.

Grandpa slices the tomato.

Ethan takes a bite. Sweet and juicy!

"This is the best tomato ever!" says Ethan.

Grandpa smiles. "Everything tastes better when you grow it yourself."

Ethan helps Grandpa in the garden every week.

They water. They weed. They pick vegetables.

And they always share what they grow.

Ethan loves garden days with Grandpa.

Working together makes everything better.

questions.question: What kind of hat does Grandpa wear in the garden?
What two chores did Ethan help Grandpa with in the garden?
Why did Grandpa say they needed to pull weeds?
options: Because weeds take food from good plants
Because weeds are prickly to touch
Because weeds make the garden smell bad

questions.question: How did Ethan describe the tomato he ate after helping to grow it?
options: It was the best tomato ever

title: Mama's Lullaby
description: Follow the journey of female mama, baby in this story about mama's lullaby.
content:
Every night, baby Elena gets ready for bed.

Bath time. Pajamas. Bottle.

Then Mama carries Elena to her room.

The lights are dim. The room is quiet.

Time for the lullaby.

Mama sits in the rocking chair.

She holds Elena close. Warm and safe.

The chair rocks back and forth. Creak, creak.

Mama starts to sing softly.

"Hush, little baby, don't you cry..."

Elena knows this song. Mama sings it every night.

The same words. The same melody.

Elena listens. Her eyes start to feel heavy.

Mama's voice is soft and gentle.

Rock, rock, rock.

"Stars are shining in the sky..."

Mama keeps singing. The lullaby is long and slow.

Elena yawns. A big baby yawn.

She snuggles closer to Mama.

So cozy. So safe.

"Mama's here, you're not alone..."

Elena's eyes close. Just for a moment.

Then they close again. Heavier this time.

Mama keeps singing. Keeps rocking.

"Sleep now, little one, sleep..."

Elena is asleep now. Breathing softly.

Mama finishes the lullaby quietly.

She stands up carefully. She places Elena in the crib.

Tucked in with her blanket. So peaceful.

Mama kisses Elena's forehead.

"Goodnight, my love," Mama whispers.

questions.question: What is one thing Baby Elena does as part of her bedtime routine?
Where does Mama sing the lullaby to Elena?
What is the name of the lullaby Mama sings to Elena?
options: Hush, Little Baby, Don't You Cry

questions.question: What happens to Elena while Mama sings the lullaby?
options: Her eyes feel heavy and she falls asleep

title: The Grumpy Cloud and the Happy Sun
description: A story about the grumpy cloud and the happy sun.
content:
Cloud wakes up grumpy.

Gray and heavy. Dark and stormy!

"I don't want to be here," grumbles Cloud.

Up above, Sun shines bright!

"Good morning, Cloud!" calls Sun.

Cloud doesn't answer. Too grumpy!

"Why are you grumpy?" asks Sun.

"Because! I'm always gray. You're always bright!" says Cloud.

"Being gray isn't bad," says Sun gently.

"Yes it is! Everyone likes you better!" Cloud rumbles. Thunder!

Sun thinks. "Cloud, you do important things! You bring rain!"

"Rain makes everything wet," grumbles Cloud.

"Rain helps flowers grow! Rain fills rivers! Rain gives animals water!" says Sun.

Cloud hadn't thought about that.

"Really?" asks Cloud.

"Really! Watch!" Sun shines on the dry ground below.

Plants are drooping. Thirsty!

"They need you, Cloud!"

Cloud looks at the thirsty plants.

Maybe Sun is right.

Cloud lets rain fall. Gentle drops!

The plants drink! They perk up!

"They look happier!" says Cloud, surprised.

"See? You're important!" says Sun.

Cloud feels less grumpy.

"And when we work TOGETHER, we make rainbows!" says Sun.

Sun shines through Cloud's rain.

Colors appear! Red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple!

A beautiful rainbow!

"We made that together!" says Cloud.

Cloud isn't grumpy anymore.

"Being gray is okay. Because I help things grow!" says Cloud.

"And we make the best team," says Sun warmly.

Cloud feels lighter and happier!

Sun and Cloud float together.

Different, but both important. Both friends!

questions.question: How did Cloud feel when he woke up at the beginning of the story?
What did Sun tell Cloud was an important thing he did?
options: Bring rain to help things grow

questions.question: What beautiful thing did Sun and Cloud make together when Sun shone through the rain?
How did Cloud feel at the end of the story?
options: Sad that he couldn't be bright

title: The Lonely Balloon
description: A story about the lonely balloon.
content:
Ruby has a red balloon from the fair!

Tied to a string. Ruby holds it tight.

"Don't let go!" says Mama.

But when Ruby waves—the string slips!

"My balloon!" cries Ruby.

The balloon floats up, up, up! Higher and higher!

The balloon looks down. Ruby is getting smaller.

The balloon feels scared. Alone.

The balloon floats above the trees.

A bird flies past. "Hello!" chirps the bird.

"I'm lost," says the balloon sadly.

The balloon floats higher. Above the clouds!

So quiet. So lonely.

Then the balloon sees other balloons! Lots of them!

"Hi!" calls a blue balloon. "Are you new?"

"I got away from my friend," says the red balloon.

"We all did! But now we have each other!" says a yellow balloon.

"Really?" asks the red balloon.

The balloons float together!

They play games! Float in circles! Race with the wind!

The red balloon laughs! This is fun!

"You're not alone anymore!" says the blue balloon.

Far below, Ruby looks up.

She's sad about her balloon.

Mama points. "Look! Your balloon found friends!"

Ruby sees all the balloons playing together!

Ruby smiles. "My balloon is happy!"

She waves up at the sky.

The red balloon sees her! It bobs—balloon language for "hello!"

Ruby blows a kiss.

The red balloon is sad to be away from Ruby. But not lonely!

And Ruby knows her balloon made friends.

Sometimes things work out differently than we planned.

But they can still work out okay!

questions.question: What color was Ruby's balloon?
What happened to Ruby's balloon when she waved?
options: The string slipped and it floated away
She gave it to a friend

questions.question: How did the red balloon feel when it first floated away from Ruby?
What did the red balloon find when it floated high above the clouds?

title: Sharing the Sandbox
description: A story about sharing the sandbox.
content:
Jake is playing in the sandbox.

He has a blue bucket and red shovel!

He's building a tall sandcastle!

Then Mia arrives. "Can I play?"

Jake looks at his bucket and shovel.

He only has one of each.

"I'm using these," says Jake.

"Oh," says Mia. She sits at the edge. Sad.

Jake keeps building. But it doesn't feel fun anymore.

Jake looks at Mia. She looks really sad.

"Do you want to help?" asks Jake.

Mia's face lights up! "Really?"

"You can use the bucket. I'll use the shovel," says Jake.

"Thank you!" says Mia.

They work together!

Mia fills the bucket. Jake smooths the sides!

"What if we make a BIGGER castle?" asks Mia.

"How?" asks Jake.

"Two towers!" says Mia.

"Yes! You make one. I'll make another!" says Jake.

Jake and Mia take turns!

Mia uses the bucket. Then Jake!

Jake uses the shovel. Then Mia!

Taking turns works great!

Soon they have two towers! Connected by a sand wall!

"This is the best castle ever!" says Jake.

"Better than doing it alone!" says Mia.

They high-five!

They add a moat around the castle!

"Time to go, Jake!" calls his mom.

They look at their castle.

"We built this together," says Jake.

"Want to build another tomorrow?" asks Mia.

"Yes!" says Jake.

Sharing and working together makes things better AND more fun!

questions.question: What was Jake building in the sandbox?
Why did Jake initially not want Mia to play with his toys?
options: He only had one bucket and one shovel
He wanted to finish his castle alone

questions.question: How did Jake and Mia make their sandcastle 'bigger' and better?
options: They built two towers and connected them
They moved to a different part of the sandbox

questions.question: What did Jake and Mia learn about sharing and working together?
options: It made things better and more fun
It made them want to play separately

title: The Shy Turtle
description: A story about the shy turtle.
content:
Tully the turtle is very shy.

He lives by the pond.

When anyone comes near, Tully hides in his shell!

Pull in his head, legs, tail. Safe inside. Dark. Quiet. Alone.

Fern the frog lives at the pond too.

She's friendly and cheerful!

"Hi, Tully!" calls Fern.

Tully pulls into his shell immediately.

"Oh," says Fern. "Okay."

Every day it's the same.

Fern says hello. Tully hides.

Fern tries to play. Tully hides.

Fern feels sad. She wants to be friends!

One day, Fern has a different idea.

Instead of hopping up to Tully, Fern sits quietly nearby.

She doesn't say hello. She just sits.

Tully peeks out a tiny bit. Fern is just sitting. Not trying to talk!

Slowly, Tully sticks his head out more.

Fern sees him but doesn't jump up.

She stays calm and quiet.

"Hi, Tully," Fern says softly.

Tully doesn't hide! His head is still out!

"Do you like being by yourself?" asks Fern gently.

Tully thinks. "Sometimes."

"Do you ever want a friend?" asks Fern.

"Sometimes," says Tully.

"Can I be your sometimes friend?" asks Fern.

Tully comes out more. "What's a sometimes friend?"

"A friend who's here when you want company. And gives you space when you don't," says Fern.

Tully likes that. "Okay," says Tully quietly.

Now they're sometimes friends!

When Tully wants to be alone, Fern gives him space.

When Tully wants company, Fern sits with him.

Tully still goes in his shell sometimes. That's okay!

Being a good friend means understanding how your friend feels!

questions.question: What does Tully the turtle do when anyone comes near him?
options: He greets them with a smile
He sings a song to them

questions.question: How did Fern the frog usually try to say hello to Tully at first?
options: She would quietly sit far away
She would hop up to him and call his name
She would bring him a flower

questions.question: What did Fern do differently to try and befriend Tully?
options: She tried to get other animals to play with him
She sat quietly nearby without trying to talk

questions.question: What kind of friend did Fern offer to be for Tully?

title: The Lost Mitten
description: A story about the lost mitten.
content:
Oliver has warm red mittens! Grandma knitted them!

Left mitten. Right mitten. A perfect pair!

Today he's playing in the snow.

Oliver makes snowballs! Makes snow angels! Makes a snow fort!

When he comes inside, he takes off his mittens.

Wait. Only ONE mitten?

"My mitten is gone!" cries Oliver.

Oliver looks at his one red mitten. Lonely without its pair!

"Let's go look!" says his friend Emma.

They check the snow angel spot. No mitten.

They check near the tree. No mitten.

They check the snow fort. No mitten!

"Where could it be?" says Oliver sadly.

"Where else did you play?" asks Emma.

Oliver thinks. "I slid down the hill!"

They run to the hill.

Emma looks carefully. "There! In the snow!"

A little bit of red showing!

Oliver digs. His mitten! He found it!

"Thank you, Emma!" says Oliver.

"You're welcome! I know you love these mittens!" says Emma.

Oliver hugs Emma. The best friend!

Back inside, Oliver puts the mittens together.

Left and right. Together again!

They drink hot cocoa. Warm and cozy!

That night, Oliver puts his mittens in a safe place. Together. Always together!

"Thank you, Emma, for helping me look," says Oliver.

"That's what friends do!" says Emma.

Friends help you find things. And help you feel better!

questions.question: Who knitted Oliver's warm red mittens?
What did Oliver NOT make in the snow?
Where did Oliver eventually find his lost mitten?
What did Oliver and Emma drink after finding the mitten?

title: The Angry Storm Cloud
description: A story about the angry storm cloud.
content:
Storm is an angry cloud! Dark gray!

Rumbling with thunder! "I'm SO MAD!" shouts Storm.

Storm can't even remember why! Just feels angry!

Storm stomps across the sky!

BOOM! Thunder! FLASH!

Lightning! Rain pours down hard! "Everything makes me MAD!" shouts Storm.

Other clouds stay away. "Storm is too angry!"

Storm hears them. That makes Storm MORE angry! BOOM!

Then Rainbow calls out. "Storm?" "GO AWAY! I'm angry!" shouts Storm.

But Rainbow doesn't leave. "I know you're angry. But you're my friend. Even when you're angry."

"Do you want to talk?" asks Rainbow.

Storm thinks. "I don't know why I'm angry anymore." "That happens.

Feelings can be confusing," says Rainbow. Storm lets out all the rain. Whoooosh! Storm feels lighter.

"Better?" asks Rainbow gently. "A little," says Storm.

Rainbow wraps colorful bands around Storm. A rainbow hug! Storm feels the warmth. The colors.

Storm's gray color gets lighter. Softer. Not so dark! "Thank you, Rainbow," says Storm quietly. "That's what friends do. They stay, even when you're stormy," says Rainbow.

It's okay to feel angry! And okay to let it out! But having a friend who stays helps!

questions.question: What color was Storm, the angry cloud?
What did Storm do when it was angry?
options: Rumbled with thunder and poured rain

questions.question: Who approached Storm to help, even when Storm was angry?
What did Rainbow give Storm that made Storm feel lighter?

title: Bear Hugs
description: A story about bear hugs.
content:
Bruno and Bella are bear cubs! Brother and sister! They play together every day! Chasing butterflies! Climbing trees! They're best friends!

One day, Bruno trips over a log. Thump! "Ow!" His paw hurts! Bella runs over. "Are you okay?"

Bruno's paw is scraped. Not badly. But it stings! His eyes fill with tears. Bella remembers what Mama does when they're hurt.

Bella wraps her arms around Bruno. A big bear hug! Warm. Soft. Safe. Bruno leans into the hug. The paw still hurts. But the hug helps!

"Hugs help," says Bella. "They do," sniffles Bruno. They sit together. Bella keeps hugging.

Later, Bella feels sad. She wanted to catch a fish, but it swam away! "I'll never catch a fish!" Bella sits down. Grumpy.

Bruno remembers what Bella did. He wraps his arms around Bella. A big bear hug! "Thanks, Bruno," says Bella. "Hugs help," says Bruno.

From that day on, they give hugs ALL the time! Happy hugs! Sad hugs! Just-because hugs! Hugs make everything better!

questions.question: What are the names of the two bear cubs in the story?
What happened to Bruno while playing?
options: He fell out of a tree
He tripped over a log and hurt his paw
He got lost in the forest

questions.question: What did Bella do to help Bruno when he was hurt?
options: She gave him a big bear hug

questions.question: Why did Bella feel sad later in the story?
options: She wanted to catch a fish but it swam away

title: The Thank You Tree
description: A story about the thank you tree.
content:
In the meadow stands an old oak tree. Very old. Very big! Animals visit every day. But the tree feels lonely. Nobody talks to the tree.

Squirrel builds a nest. "This is a good tree." But doesn't say it TO the tree. Bird rests in the shade. "Nice shade." But doesn't say it TO the tree. Rabbit hops under it. "Cool here." But doesn't say it TO the tree. The tree feels invisible.

One day, a little deer comes. She looks up. "Hello, Tree!" says the deer. The tree is so surprised! "You talked to me!"

"Of course! Thank you for being here! Your shade feels wonderful!" The tree's leaves rustle happily! "You're welcome!" Nobody has said thank you before!

The other animals hear them talking. "The tree can talk?" "You never said hello," says the tree sadly.

"I'm sorry! Thank you for my nest!" says Squirrel. "Thank you for the shade!" says Bird. "Thank you for the cool spot!" says Rabbit.

All the animals say thank you! The tree's leaves shake with joy! "I've been here all along. I just wanted someone to notice."

From that day on, animals always say hello and thank you! The tree never feels lonely again! Everyone needs to hear "thank you"!

questions.question: How did the old oak tree feel at the beginning of the story?
Which animal was the first to speak directly to the tree?
What did the little deer say to the tree?
What made the tree's leaves rustle happily?
options: A bird built a new nest

title: Big Sister's Help
description: A story about big sister's help.
content:
Lily has a baby brother named Max. He's very little! He can't walk or talk yet. But Lily loves being a big sister!

Today, Max is crying. "Waaah!" Mama is cooking. "Can you help Max?" asks Mama. "I can try!" says Lily.

Lily goes to Max. Why is he crying? Diaper? Not wet. Bottle? Not empty. Then Lily notices. Max's pacifier fell on the floor!

Lily picks it up. Washes it off. Gives it back to Max. Max stops crying! He's happy! "I helped Max!" calls Lily. "Good job!" says Mama proudly.

Later, Max can't reach his toy. He fusses. Lily sees the problem. She moves the toy closer. Max grabs it! He smiles! Helping feels good!

At dinner, Max drops his spoon! Lily picks it up. "Thank you, Lily!" says Mama.

At bedtime, Mama rocks Max. Lily sits next to them. "You were such a helper today!" "I love being Max's big sister," says Lily. She gives Max a gentle kiss.

Being a big sister means helping! And helping your family feels wonderful!

questions.question: What is the name of Lily's baby brother?
Why was Max crying the first time Lily helped him?
options: His pacifier fell on the floor

questions.question: How did Lily help Max when he couldn't reach his toy?
options: She played with the toy for him
She told him to try harder
She moved the toy closer to him
She gave him a different toy

questions.question: What did Lily say she loved about being a big sister?
options: Being able to stay up late

title: Dad's Piggyback Ride
description: A story about dad's piggyback ride.
content:
Zoe and Dad are walking home from the park. They played for a long time! Swings! Slide! Lots of running! Now Zoe's legs are tired. Very tired.

"My legs hurt," says Zoe. She sits on the sidewalk. "I can't walk anymore!" Dad kneels. "Want a piggyback ride?" Zoe's eyes light up! "Yes!"

Dad turns around. "Climb on!" Zoe climbs on Dad's back. Arms around his neck. Legs around his waist. Dad stands up. "Ready?" "Ready!" says Zoe.

Dad starts walking. Zoe rides on his back! "I'm so tall!" says Zoe. She can see over the fence! Into windows! Touch tree branches!

"This is fun!" says Zoe. Dad bounces. Boing, boing! Zoe giggles! "Faster!" Dad walks faster! Zoe holds tight!

They pass a neighbor. "Hi, Mr. Johnson!" calls Zoe from up high. "You're up high today, Zoe!" "Dad's giving me a piggyback ride!" says Zoe proudly.

At home, Dad kneels. Zoe slides off. "Thanks, Dad!" "Anytime, kiddo." He ruffles her hair. Zoe hugs him tight. "You're the best dad."

That night, Zoe thinks about the piggyback ride. Being up high. Seeing everything. Feeling safe on Dad's back. "Can we do piggyback rides tomorrow?" "Every time you need one," promises Dad. Dads are the best!

questions.question: Why were Zoe's legs tired after playing at the park?
options: They played for a long time with lots of running

questions.question: What did Dad offer Zoe on their way home?
What did Zoe enjoy about being on Dad's back?
options: Being up high and seeing everything

questions.question: What did Zoe call her dad at the end of the story?

title: Grandma's Quilt
description: A story about grandma's quilt.
content:
Emma is visiting Grandma's house. It's cold! Winter time! Inside is warm and cozy. "Come sit with me," says Grandma.

Grandma pulls out a big quilt! Many colors! Squares stitched together! Red, blue, yellow, green, purple, orange! "I made this quilt," says Grandma.

Grandma wraps it around Emma. So soft! So warm! Emma snuggles in. "This quilt is special," says Grandma.

"See this blue square? From your mommy's baby blanket." "Really?" Emma touches it. "This red square was from your uncle's favorite shirt." "This yellow square was from my wedding dress."

Every square tells a story! Emma looks at all the squares. So many stories!

"Why did you make it into a quilt?" asks Emma. "So I could keep all the memories together. And share warmth with people I love." Emma hugs the quilt tighter.

"Can I sleep with it tonight?" asks Emma. "Of course! That's what it's for!"

That night, Emma snuggles under Grandma's quilt. She looks at the different squares. Each one is a memory. Each one is love. Emma falls asleep. Warm. Safe. Loved.

"Can you teach me to make a quilt someday?" asks Emma next morning. "I'd love to," says Grandma. Love is like a quilt—made of many pieces, stitched together with care!

questions.question: What was Emma visiting Grandma's house during?
What special item did Grandma show Emma?
Where did the blue square in the quilt come from?
According to Grandma, why did she make the quilt?
options: To sell it at a market
To keep memories and share warmth

title: The Family Dinner
description: A story about the family dinner.
content:
It's dinnertime at Noah's house! The whole family gathers. Mama, Papa, Noah, and big sister Mia. Everyone sits together. "Let's eat!" says Mama.

Papa made spaghetti! Mama made salad! Mia helped make garlic bread! Noah set the table. He put out all the forks!

They pass the food around. "Here, Noah," says Papa, putting spaghetti on his plate. "Thank you, Papa!" Mama gives him salad. Mia hands him bread. "I made this!"

Everyone starts eating. "Mmm! Yummy!" says Noah. Mia makes a funny face with her salad! Eyes made of tomatoes! Everyone laughs!

"How was your day?" asks Mama. "I built a big tower!" says Noah. "I helped!" says Mia. "How was your day, Papa?" asks Noah. Papa tells them about work.

Everyone shares stories. Talking. Laughing. Eating together. Noah tells a joke. Everyone giggles! Mama and Papa tell stories about when they were little.

After dinner, everyone helps clean up! Mia clears plates. Noah wipes the table. Mama washes dishes. Papa dries. Working together!

When the kitchen is clean, Papa says, "Good teamwork, family!" They all high-five! Noah hugs Mama. "I love family dinner." "Me too. This is my favorite time of day." Being together, sharing food, sharing stories—that's family!

questions.question: Besides Noah, Mama, and Papa, who else was at the family dinner?
Who was responsible for making the spaghetti for dinner?
What did Noah do to help set the table?
options: He put out all the forks

questions.question: What activity did the family NOT do together after dinner?

title: Baby's First Steps
description: A story about baby's first steps.
content:
Baby Leo is ten months old. He can crawl fast! He can pull himself up! But he hasn't walked yet. Today feels different.

Leo pulls himself up using the couch. Standing! Mama and Papa watch. "Look at Leo!" Leo wobbles. But he doesn't sit down.

Papa sits a few feet away. "Leo! Come to Papa!" He holds out his arms. Leo looks at the space. Can he do it?

Leo lets go of the couch with one hand. Wobble! Then... he lets go completely! Standing! No hands! All by himself!

Leo takes one step! Wobble, wobble! Mama gasps! "He's doing it!" Leo takes another step! Almost there!

One more step! Leo reaches Papa! Papa catches him in a big hug! "You did it, Leo! You walked!" Mama claps! "Three steps!" Leo giggles. He did it!

"Try again!" says Mama. She sits near the couch. "Come to Mama!" Leo tries again! This time FOUR steps! Mama catches him! More hugs!

Leo practices all day! Walking to Mama! Walking to Papa! Sometimes he falls. That's okay! He gets up and tries again!

By bedtime, Leo is tired. But happy! "You're walking now!" says Mama, tucking him in. Leo smiles. He grew up today!

questions.question: How old was Baby Leo when the story took place?
What did Leo use to pull himself up before taking his first steps?
Who did Leo take his very first steps towards?
How many steps did Leo take in his first successful attempt?

title: Brother's Band-Aid
description: A story about brother's band-aid.
content:
Sophie is playing outside. Running fast! Chasing butterflies! Then—oof! Sophie trips! She scrapes her knee! "Ow!" cries Sophie.

Sophie's knee is bleeding a little. Just a scrape. But it stings! Sophie starts to cry. Her big brother Jack hears her.

Jack runs over. "Are you okay, Sophie?" Sophie shows him her knee. "It hurts!" "Let's go inside. I'll help you," says Jack. He takes Sophie's hand gently.

Inside, Jack gets the first aid box. "First, we clean it," says Jack. He uses a wet cloth. Gentle, gentle. Sophie winces. "It stings!" "I know. But we have to clean it so it heals."

When it's clean, Jack gets a band-aid. Sophie's favorite kind! With animals on it! "Which animal?" asks Jack. "The bunny!" says Sophie. Jack puts the bunny band-aid on carefully.

"There! All better!" says Jack. "It still hurts a little," says Sophie. Jack gives her a hug. "Big brother hugs help too." Sophie hugs back. "Thank you, Jack."

The next day, Sophie's knee is better! "You're a good big brother," says Sophie. "That's what brothers do. We take care of our sisters." Taking care of someone when they're hurt is love!

questions.question: What happened to Sophie while she was playing outside?
options: She scraped her knee when she tripped
She got mud on her clothes

questions.question: Who helped Sophie when she got hurt?
What kind of band-aid did Jack use for Sophie's knee?
What did Jack say brothers do for their sisters?
options: Take care of them when they're hurt

title: The Bedtime Story
description: A story about the bedtime story.
content:
Every night, the same routine. Bath. Pajamas. Brush teeth. Then—the best part! Bedtime story with Mama! Aiden climbs into bed. "Story time!"

Mama sits on the edge of the bed. She picks up the book. "The Little Red Caboose!" "My favorite!" says Aiden. It's the same book every night! Aiden knows every word!

Mama opens the book. "Once upon a time, there was a little red caboose," reads Mama. Aiden snuggles in. He knows what comes next! "The little red caboose was at the end of the train."

Aiden says the next part with Mama! "He wanted to be first!" They read together. Mama does different voices! Aiden giggles at the funny voices!

Halfway through, Aiden yawns. Mama keeps reading. Soft and gentle. Aiden's eyes feel heavy. But he tries to stay awake!

Mama reaches the last page. "And the little red caboose learned he was important, right where he was." Aiden smiles. He loves that part.

"One more time?" asks Aiden sleepily. "Not tonight. You're very sleepy," says Mama. "Okay," yawns Aiden. Mama kisses his forehead. "Good night, my love." "Good night, Mama."

Bedtime stories aren't just about the book. They're about being together. About ending the day with love!

questions.question: What is Aiden's favorite bedtime story book?
What does Aiden do halfway through the story?
options: He starts to sing a song.

questions.question: What does Mama do that makes Aiden giggle?
What is the main message at the end of 'The Bedtime Story'?
options: Bedtime stories help you learn new words.
Bedtime stories are just about finishing a book.
Bedtime stories are about being together and ending the day with love.
Bedtime stories are only for sleepy children.

title: The Goodbye Hug
description: A story about the goodbye hug.
content:
It's Monday morning. Mama has to go to work. Finn doesn't want her to leave. "Don't go, Mama," says Finn. He holds her leg.

Mama kneels down. "I have to go to work, sweetheart." "But I'll miss you!" says Finn. "I'll miss you too. But I'll be back!" Finn's eyes fill with tears.

"How about our special goodbye?" asks Mama. Finn knows the special goodbye! He nods. Mama opens her arms wide. Finn runs into them!

Mama gives Finn the biggest hug! She squeezes tight. Safe and warm. Finn squeezes back. They count together. "One, two, three, four, five!" A five-second hug!

Then Mama holds Finn's hands. "While I'm at work, I'll be thinking about you." "Really?" asks Finn. "Really! And I'll be back before bedtime!"

"Can we read my favorite book when you come back?" asks Finn. "Absolutely! It's a promise!" says Mama. Finn feels better. "Okay."

Daddy picks up Finn. "We're going to have fun! Right?" "Right!" says Finn. Mama blows a kiss. Finn catches it! He blows one back!

Mama leaves. Finn feels sad for a minute. But Daddy says, "Want to make a picture for Mama?" "Yes!" They make a rainbow!

Later, when Mama comes home, Finn gives her the rainbow. "I thought about you too!" says Finn. Mama hugs him tight. "The best welcome home!"

Goodbyes are hard. But love brings us back together!

questions.question: What is the special goodbye that Finn and Mama share?
What does Mama promise Finn she will do when she comes back?
What does Finn make for Mama while she is at work?
What is the main idea of 'The Goodbye Hug'?
options: It's important to never leave home.
Love helps people feel connected even when they are apart.
You should always cry when someone leaves.

title: The Seed That Grew
description: Follow the journey of inanimate seed, male boy in this story about the seed that grew.
content:
Ethan has a tiny seed in his hand.

It's brown and hard. Smaller than his fingernail.

"What is it?" asks Ethan.

"A sunflower seed," says Mama. "Want to plant it?"

Ethan nods. "Yes!"

Mama gives Ethan a small pot. She fills it with dirt.

Ethan pokes a hole in the dirt with his finger.

He drops the seed into the hole.

Then he covers it with dirt. Pat, pat, pat.

"Now what?" asks Ethan.

"Now we water it," says Mama.

Ethan pours water into the pot.

The dirt gets dark and wet.

"What happens next?" asks Ethan.

"We wait," says Mama. "And we keep watering it."

Ethan looks at the dirt. Nothing is there yet.

Just dirt.

Every day, Ethan waters the seed.

He pours water carefully into the pot.

Every day, he checks.

Is anything growing?

On day three—nothing.

On day four—still nothing.

On day five—SOMETHING!

A tiny green shoot pokes out of the dirt!

"Mama! Look!" shouts Ethan.

The seed is growing!

Every day, the shoot gets taller.

Green leaves appear.

The plant reaches toward the sun.

Weeks pass. The plant gets bigger and bigger!

Finally, a bud appears at the top.

The bud opens. Yellow petals!

It's a sunflower! Bright and beautiful!

Ethan can't believe it. "I grew this! From a tiny seed!"

Mama hugs him. "You gave it water and sunshine. And it grew."

questions.question: What kind of seed does Ethan plant?
What does Ethan do every day to help the seed grow?
On which day does Ethan first see a tiny green shoot?
What appears at the top of the plant after many weeks?

title: The Raindrop's Journey
description: Follow the journey of inanimate raindrop in this story about the raindrop's journey.
content:
High in the sky, a raindrop forms inside a cloud.

She is small and round.

All around her, other raindrops are forming too.

"Where are we going?" asks the raindrop.

"Down to Earth!" say the others.

The cloud gets too heavy. The raindrops start to fall!

Down, down, down!

The raindrop falls through the air.

She sees birds flying. She sees treetops.

The ground is getting closer!

PLIP!

The raindrop lands on a big green leaf.

She sits there for a moment. The leaf is smooth and cool.

Then the raindrop slides down the leaf.

Slide, slide, slide!

The raindrop falls off the leaf.

Down she goes again!

PLOP!

She lands on the ground. Soft dirt.

The dirt is thirsty. It soaks up the raindrop.

Down, down into the earth.

Underground, the raindrop touches plant roots.

The roots drink the water. So thirsty!

The raindrop helps the plants grow.

Flowers. Grass. Trees.

The raindrop feels happy. She's helping!

Later, the sun comes out. Warm and bright.

The raindrop feels the warmth.

She begins to rise up into the air again. Evaporating!

Up, up, up!

Back to the clouds.

Soon, the raindrop will fall again. And again.

That's the journey of a raindrop.

questions.question: Where does the raindrop form?
options: In a puddle on the ground.
Inside a cloud high in the sky.

questions.question: What happens when the raindrop lands on the ground?
options: It floats on top of the soil.

questions.question: What does the raindrop help the plants do?
What happens to the raindrop when the sun comes out?
options: It sinks deeper into the earth.
It rises back up into the air (evaporates).

title: The Little Wave
description: Follow the journey of inanimate wave in this story about the little wave.
content:
Far out in the ocean, a little wave forms.

She is small. Just a ripple.

She moves up. Then down. Up. Then down.

All around her, bigger waves roll by.

"Where are you going?" asks the little wave.

"To the shore!" say the big waves.

The little wave wants to see the shore too!

She starts moving. Following the big waves.

Roll, roll, roll.

The little wave travels across the blue ocean.

She sees fish swimming below. She sees seagulls flying above.

The little wave rolls and rolls.

She's getting closer to the shore!

She can see it now. Sand! Beaches! People!

The big waves crash onto the shore. CRASH! CRASH!

They splash high and spread out.

Now it's the little wave's turn.

She rolls closer. Closer.

The water gets shallow.

The little wave rises up. Higher than she's ever been!

She's going to reach the shore!

SPLASH!

The little wave crashes onto the sand!

The water spreads out. Tickling the sand.

Children laugh and jump over the little wave.

"The water is nice!" they say.

The little wave feels happy.

The little wave spreads out on the sand.

Then slowly, she slides back into the ocean.

Back where she came from.

But now the little wave knows what the shore looks like!

Tomorrow, she'll roll to the shore again.

And the next day. And the next day.

That's what waves do.

questions.question: How does the little wave describe herself at the beginning?
What does the little wave see as she travels across the ocean?
options: Other little waves just like her.

questions.question: What happens when the little wave reaches the shore?
options: She crashes onto the sand and spreads out.
She gets scared and goes back to the deep ocean.

title: Marina and the Singing Shells
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about marina and the singing shells.
content:
Marina walks on the beach with her grandma.

The sand is warm between her toes.

"Look!" says Marina. She picks up a shell.

It's pink and white, smooth and curved.

"That's a pretty one," says Grandma.

Marina holds the shell.

Grandma shows her something special.

"Hold it up to your ear," says Grandma.

Marina lifts the shell to her ear.

She hears something! A soft whooshing sound.

"What is that?" asks Marina.

"That's the ocean singing," says Grandma.

"The ocean is inside the shell?" asks Marina.

Grandma smiles. "The shell remembers the ocean's song."

Marina listens again. Whoooosh. Whoooosh.

It sounds like gentle waves!

Marina finds another shell. A white one.

She holds it to her ear.

This one sounds different! A higher whoosh.

"This shell sings differently!" says Marina.

"Every shell has its own song," says Grandma.

Marina collects more shells.

A brown shell. A gray shell. A shell with stripes.

She listens to each one.

Each shell has a different ocean song!

Some are loud. Some are quiet. Some are deep.

"It's like a shell concert!" says Marina.

Marina takes her favorite shells home.

She puts them in a special box by her bed.

At night, when Marina misses the beach, she holds a shell to her ear.

Whoooosh. Whoooosh.

The ocean sings her to sleep.

questions.question: What does Marina find on the beach with her grandma?
What does Grandma tell Marina to do with the shell?
options: Throw it back into the ocean.
Hold it up to her ear.

questions.question: What sound does Marina hear when she holds a shell to her ear?
options: A soft whooshing sound like the ocean.

questions.question: What does Marina learn about different shells?
options: They all make the exact same sound.
Each shell has its own unique song.
Shells don't actually make any sound.

title: The Recycling Bin
description: Follow the journey of inanimate bin, female girl in this story about the recycling bin.
content:
Emma's house has two bins. A gray bin and a blue bin. The gray bin is for trash. The blue bin is for recycling! Today, Emma is helping Mama sort things. "Let's find what goes in the recycling bin!" says Mama.

Emma holds a plastic bottle. Empty juice bottle. "Does this go in recycling?" asks Emma. Mama nods. "Yes! Plastic bottles can be recycled!" Emma drops the bottle into the blue bin. PLUNK! The blue bin seems to smile. (In Emma's imagination.)

Next, Emma holds a banana peel. "Does this go in recycling?" asks Emma. Mama shakes her head. "No, banana peels go in the compost or trash." Emma puts the banana peel in the gray bin. The blue bin only wants things that can be recycled!

Emma finds a cardboard box. Flat and empty. "Does this go in recycling?" asks Emma. "Yes!" says Mama. "Cardboard can be recycled!" Emma puts the cardboard in the blue bin. THUMP! The blue bin is getting full!

Emma finds a paper bag. A tin can. A glass jar. Mama helps her check. Paper, metal, glass—all can be recycled! Emma puts them all in the blue bin. The blue bin is very happy! So many things to recycle!
