Ruby yawns a third time.

"Time for bed?" asks Daddy.

Ruby nods. Very sleepy now!

Daddy helps her get ready for bed.

Pajamas. Brush teeth. Into bed!

Ruby's head hits the pillow.

Ruby yawns one more time.

Then her eyes close.

Fast asleep!

Her body is resting now.

Yawns are helpful! They tell us when we need sleep!

questions.question: What does Ruby do that tells her she is tired?
What does Daddy say sleep helps Ruby's body do?
options: Eat more snacks and play all day

questions.question: What does Ruby do after her third yawn?
options: She plays with her toys again

title: Strong Muscles
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about strong muscles.
content:
Max is playing in his room.

He picks up his toy box. Heavy!

"I'm strong!" says Max.

He carries it across the room!

"How am I strong?" asks Max.

"Muscles!" says Mama.

"What are muscles?" asks Max.

"Parts of your body that help you move!" explains Mama.

"Feel your arm," says Mama.

Max touches his arm. Soft!

"Now make a muscle! Flex your arm!"

Max bends his arm. Tightens it!

A bump appears! Hard!

"That's your muscle!" says Mama.

"Muscles get stronger when you use them!"

Max flexes again. "My muscle is big!"

"It will get bigger as you grow!" says Mama.

Max runs around the room. Fast!

"My leg muscles help me run!"

He lifts his teddy bear. "My arm muscles help me lift!"

He jumps! "My muscles help me jump!"

"Muscles are everywhere in your body!" says Mama.

Max flexes his arms. Strong!

"I'm going to use my muscles every day!" says Max.

"That's how they get strong!" says Mama.

Bodies are amazing!

questions.question: What part of Max's body helps him lift his heavy toy box?
How does Mama tell Max to make his arm muscle appear?
How do muscles get stronger?

title: Five Senses Walk
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about five senses walk.
content:
Noah and Daddy are going on a walk.

Not just any walk. A five senses walk!

"We'll use all five senses!" says Daddy.

Eyes, ears, nose, tongue, hands!

First sense: EYES!

"What do you see?" asks Daddy.

"I see a red bird! I see green grass! I see blue sky!" says Noah.

Seeing with eyes!

Second sense: EARS!

"What do you hear?" asks Daddy.

Noah listens carefully. "I hear birds chirping! I hear wind in the trees! I hear a dog barking!"

Hearing with ears!

Third sense: NOSE!

"What do you smell?" asks Daddy.

Noah sniffs. "I smell flowers! I smell grass! I smell something yummy from that house!"

Smelling with nose!

Fourth sense: TOUCH!

"What do you feel?" asks Daddy.

Noah touches a tree. "Rough bark!"

He touches a leaf. "Smooth and soft!"

He touches the grass. "Tickly!"

Feeling with hands!

Fifth sense: TONGUE!

"What do you taste?" asks Daddy.

They sit and have a snack. Apple slices!

"Sweet and crunchy!" says Noah.

"We used all five senses!" says Daddy.

Our bodies help us explore the world!

questions.question: How many senses do Noah and Daddy use on their special walk?
Which sense helps Noah hear birds chirping and wind in the trees?
What did Noah taste at the end of the walk?
What did Noah feel when he touched the tree bark?

title: The Band-Aid Helper
description: Follow the journey of inanimate band-aid, female girl in this story about the band-aid helper.
content:
Lily is playing outside.

She scrapes her elbow on the sidewalk. Ow!

"I got a boo-boo!" says Lily.

Mama comes over. "Let's get a band-aid!"

Inside, Mama washes the scrape.

Gentle with warm water.

It stings a little! But not too bad.

"Now for the band-aid," says Mama.

Mama opens the band-aid package.

It's pink with stars on it!

"Band-aids are special," says Mama.

"They protect your boo-boo while it heals!"

Mama puts the band-aid on Lily's elbow.

Carefully! Right over the scrape!

It sticks on! Covering the owie!

"There!" says Mama.

Lily looks at the band-aid.

"How does it help?" asks Lily.

"It keeps dirt out," explains Mama. "And it keeps your scrape clean so it can heal!"

Lily touches the band-aid gently.

The next day, the scrape feels better!

A few days later, it's almost all healed!

Lily takes off the band-aid. The scrape is just a tiny mark now!

"The band-aid helped me heal!" says Lily.

Bodies are good at healing themselves!

questions.question: What did Lily do to her elbow while playing outside?
What color was the band-aid Mama used for Lily's boo-boo?
How does a band-aid help a scrape?
options: It keeps dirt out and helps it heal

title: Eating the Rainbow
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about eating the rainbow.
content:
Kai is having lunch.

Mama put lots of colorful food on his plate!

"You're eating the rainbow today!" says Mama.

"The rainbow?" asks Kai.

"Red food!" says Mama, pointing to strawberries.

Kai eats a strawberry. Sweet!

"Red is yummy!" says Kai.

"Red foods are healthy!" says Mama.

"Orange food!" says Mama, pointing to carrot sticks.

Kai eats a carrot. Crunchy!

"Orange is good!" says Kai.

"Orange foods help your eyes!" says Mama.

"Yellow food!" says Mama, pointing to a banana.

Kai eats some banana. Soft and sweet!

"I like yellow!" says Kai.

"Yellow foods give you energy!" says Mama.

"Green food!" says Mama, pointing to broccoli.

Kai makes a face. He's not sure about broccoli!

He tries one tiny piece. Not bad!

"Green foods make you strong!" says Mama.

"Blue and purple food!" says Mama, pointing to blueberries.

Kai eats the blueberries. Yum!

"I ate the whole rainbow!" says Kai.

"Different colors mean different healthy things!" says Mama.

"Eating colorful food is good for you!"

Healthy eating can be fun!

questions.question: What did Mama call Kai's colorful lunch?
Which food did Kai eat that was orange and crunchy?
What type of food did Mama say helps your eyes?
What was the blue and purple food Kai ate?

title: The Friendly Ghost
description: Follow the journey of male ghost in this story about the friendly ghost.
content:
In an old house at the edge of town lives a small ghost named Boo.

Boo is white and see-through. He floats instead of walks.

But Boo isn't scary. He's lonely.

He wants to play with children.

But every time children see him, they run away!

One day, a little girl named Lucy moves into the house.

Lucy is brave and curious.

Boo watches her unpack her toys.

He really wants to say hello.

But he's scared she'll run away like everyone else.

Lucy is playing hide-and-seek with her teddy bear.

"One, two, three..." Lucy counts. "Ready or not, here I come!"

Boo floats behind the curtain to watch.

His ghostly tail sticks out just a little.

Lucy sees the white tail. "Found you!"

Lucy pulls back the curtain.

She sees Boo floating there!

Boo freezes. Will she scream?

But Lucy smiles. "Hi! Are you hiding too?"

Boo is so surprised, he nods.

"Want to play with me?" asks Lucy.

Boo and Lucy play hide-and-seek together!

Boo floats through walls to hide in tricky spots.

Lucy giggles. "That's not fair! You can go through walls!"

Boo giggles too. A soft, echoey giggle.

Lucy isn't scared at all. She thinks Boo is fun!

Now Boo has a friend!

Every day, Lucy and Boo play together.

Hide-and-seek. Tag. Building blocks.

Boo isn't lonely anymore.

And Lucy tells her friends, "I have a ghost friend. He's nice!"

Not all ghosts are scary. Some just want to play.

questions.question: What is the name of the small ghost in the old house?
Why was Boo lonely?
options: Children ran away when they saw him
He was too shy to talk

questions.question: What game do Lucy and Boo play together first?
What special ability does Boo have that helps him hide?

title: Who Took the Cookies?
description: Follow the journey of female girl detective in this story about who took the cookies?.
content:
Zoe's mom made chocolate chip cookies.

She put them in a jar on the counter.

"Don't eat any until after dinner," said Mom.

Zoe said okay.

But when Zoe came back later, the cookies were gone!

Someone took them!

Zoe puts on her detective hat.

She will solve this mystery!

First, she looks for clues.

On the floor—cookie crumbs!

They make a trail. Leading from the kitchen to the living room.

"Aha!" says Zoe. "A clue!"

Zoe follows the crumb trail.

Through the living room. Past the couch.

The crumbs lead to the back door.

Outside on the porch—more crumbs!

"The cookie thief went outside!" says Zoe.

Zoe looks around the yard.

She sees her dog, Max, lying under the tree.

Max looks very happy. His tail wags.

"Max!" says Zoe. "Did you take the cookies?"

Max's tail wags faster.

Zoe looks closer. Max has chocolate on his nose!

"You DID take the cookies!" says Zoe.

Max licks his lips. He doesn't look sorry.

Zoe giggles. "You're a sneaky dog!"

She pets Max's head.

Zoe goes inside and tells Mom.

"Max took the cookies!"

Mom laughs. "Good detective work, Zoe!"

Mom makes more cookies. This time, she puts them up high.

Where Max can't reach!

Mystery solved!

questions.question: What did Zoe's mom tell her not to do before dinner?
What clue did Zoe follow to find the cookie thief?
Who did Zoe discover took the cookies?
What was on Max's nose that was a big clue?

title: The Glowing Eyes
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the glowing eyes.
content:
Oliver is in his backyard at dusk. The sun is setting. The sky is turning purple and orange. Oliver is looking for his toy truck in the bushes. Then he sees something. Two glowing eyes in the dark!

The eyes are small. Green and glowing! They stare at Oliver from under a bush. Oliver freezes. "What is that?" The eyes blink. Slowly. Oliver's heart beats fast.

Oliver steps closer. Carefully. Quietly. The eyes stay still. Watching. "Hello?" says Oliver nervously. The eyes don't answer. They just glow. Oliver takes another step.

Suddenly, the eyes move! They fly up into the air! Then more glowing eyes appear! Lots of them! All around Oliver! Glowing green eyes everywhere! Oliver gasps!

Then Oliver hears a sound. Buzz, buzz, buzz! Wait. He knows that sound! "Fireflies!" says Oliver. The glowing eyes are fireflies! Their lights blink on and off! Not scary at all!

Oliver laughs. "I thought you were something scary!" The fireflies fly around him. Blinking their lights. Oliver watches them dance in the evening air. The glowing eyes were just friendly bugs! Not scary. Beautiful!

questions.question: What color were the glowing eyes Oliver saw in the dark?
What sound did Oliver hear that helped him figure out what the eyes were?
What were the glowing eyes actually?

title: The Creaky Door
description: Follow the journey of inanimate door, female girl in this story about the creaky door.
content:
Every night, Zoe hears a creaky sound. CREEEAK! It comes from the hallway. From the closet door! Zoe pulls her blanket up. "What's that sound?" CREEEAK! There it is again!

Zoe's dad comes in. "What's wrong?" "The door is making scary sounds!" says Zoe. Dad listens. CREEEAK! "Ah," says Dad. "The closet door. It's just creaky. Let's fix it!"

Dad opens the closet door. CREEEAK! The hinges squeak! That's the sound! "The door hinges are old," explains Dad. "They need oil!" Dad gets a little bottle of oil.

Dad puts oil on the hinges. Drip, drip! He opens and closes the door. Smooth and quiet! No more creaking! "Try it!" says Dad. Zoe pushes the door. Open, close. Quiet!

"The door isn't creaky anymore!" says Zoe happily. "It just needed a little help," says Dad. Zoe feels silly. The door wasn't scary. It was just old! "Can we fix it during the day next time?" asks Zoe. Dad laughs. "Deal!"

That night, Zoe goes to bed. She listens. No creaking! The door is quiet now! Zoe smiles and falls asleep. Sometimes scary sounds just need fixing!

questions.question: What scary sound did Zoe hear every night?
Where was the creaky sound coming from?
What did Dad use to fix the creaky door hinges?
How did Zoe feel after her dad fixed the door?

title: The Missing Teddy Mystery
description: Follow the journey of inanimate teddy, male boy in this story about the missing teddy mystery.
content:
Every morning, Kai wakes up. His teddy bear, Mr. Snuggles, is gone! Kai looks around. "Where's Mr. Snuggles?" He checks under the pillow. Not there! He checks under the bed. Not there! Mr. Snuggles is missing again!

Kai finds Mr. Snuggles in different places every morning. One morning, Mr. Snuggles is in the toy box. One morning, Mr. Snuggles is on the bookshelf. One morning, Mr. Snuggles is in the hallway! "How does he move?" wonders Kai.

Kai decides to solve the mystery! That night, Kai goes to bed with Mr. Snuggles. He hugs the teddy tight. "I'm watching you," whispers Kai to Mr. Snuggles. Kai tries to stay awake. But he's so sleepy...

In the middle of the night, Kai hears something. Soft footsteps. Pitter-patter! Kai opens one eye just a little. He peeks! His puppy, Biscuit, is sneaking into the room!

Biscuit walks over to Kai's bed. Very gently, Biscuit picks up Mr. Snuggles with his mouth! Biscuit carries Mr. Snuggles to his own dog bed! Biscuit curls up with Mr. Snuggles and goes to sleep! "Aha!" thinks Kai. "Biscuit is taking my teddy!"

The next morning, Kai tells Mom. "Biscuit wants to cuddle with Mr. Snuggles!" says Kai. Mom smiles. "Biscuit must love Mr. Snuggles too!" Kai thinks. "Can we get Biscuit his own stuffed toy?" Mom nods. "Good idea!" They get Biscuit a stuffed bone. Now everyone has a cuddle toy! Mystery solved!

questions.question: What is the name of Kai's teddy bear?
Where did Kai find Mr. Snuggles in the end?
Who was taking Mr. Snuggles every night?
What did Kai and Mom get for Biscuit?

title: The Shadow Puppet
description: Follow the journey of inanimate shadow, female girl in this story about the shadow puppet.
content:
Luna is getting ready for bed. The lamp is on! Luna sees her shadow on the wall. Tall and dark! Luna moves her hand. The shadow moves too! "My shadow copies me!" says Luna.

Luna makes a funny face. The shadow makes a funny face! Luna waves her arms. The shadow waves its arms! Luna jumps! The shadow jumps! Luna giggles. "You're silly, shadow!"

Then Luna has an idea! She puts her hands together. Thumbs touching! She makes a shape with her fingers. On the wall, the shadow looks like... a butterfly!

Luna flaps her hands. The butterfly shadow flies on the wall! "Look!" Luna calls to her dad. "A butterfly!" Dad comes in. "Wow! Shadow puppets!" Dad shows Luna how to make a dog shadow with his hands!

Luna and Dad make more shadow puppets! A bird! A rabbit! A duck! Each shadow looks like a different animal! Luna laughs. Her shadow isn't scary. It's fun!

"Time for bed," says Dad. He turns off the lamp. The shadow disappears! "Goodnight, shadow!" says Luna. Tomorrow, Luna will make more shadow puppets! Shadows are great for playing!

questions.question: What does Luna see on the wall when the lamp is on?
What was the first shadow puppet Luna made with her hands?
Who helped Luna make more shadow puppets?
What happens to the shadow when Dad turns off the lamp?

title: The Hooting Owl
description: Follow the journey of male owl in this story about the hooting owl.
content:
Every night, Ben hears a sound outside his window. "Hoo! Hoo!" A deep, loud sound! "What is that?" wonders Ben nervously. "Hoo! Hoo!" There it is again!

Ben looks out his window. It's dark outside! He can't see what's making the sound. "Hoo! Hoo!" Ben's dad comes in. "What's wrong?" "Something is making scary sounds!" says Ben.

Dad listens. "Hoo! Hoo!" Dad smiles. "That's an owl!" "An owl?" asks Ben. "Let's see if we can spot him," says Dad. They turn off the light in Ben's room.

Dad and Ben look out the window carefully. They look at the big tree in the yard. Then they see it! A big brown owl sitting on a branch! The owl's eyes glow in the moonlight! "There he is!" whispers Dad.

The owl turns his head. He looks right at Ben and Dad! "Hoo! Hoo!" says the owl. Ben isn't scared anymore. The owl looks friendly! "He's saying hello," says Dad. Ben waves. "Hi, owl!"

Now Ben knows what the sound is! Every night, the owl hoots in the tree. Ben listens and smiles. "Goodnight, owl!" "Hoo! Hoo!" The owl hoots back. The hooting isn't scary. It's just the owl saying goodnight!

questions.question: What sound does Ben hear outside his window every night?
What animal was making the sound Ben heard?
Where did Ben and his dad find the animal?
How did Ben feel about the animal by the end of the story?

title: The Mysterious Footprints
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the mysterious footprints.
content:
Ethan wakes up one morning. He goes to the kitchen. On the floor are muddy footprints! Little footprints! Leading from the back door to the living room! "Who made these?" wonders Ethan.

Ethan follows the footprints. Across the kitchen. Through the hallway. The footprints lead to the living room! Then they stop at the couch. But there's no one there!

"Mom! There are mysterious footprints!" says Ethan. Mom comes to look. She sees the muddy prints. "Hmm," says Mom. "Let's follow them backwards!" They walk backwards along the footprints. Back to the back door!

Mom opens the back door. They look outside. Ethan's boots are sitting on the porch! Muddy boots! "These are YOUR boots!" says Mom. Ethan looks at his feet. He's wearing socks! "I walked inside with muddy boots yesterday!" says Ethan.

Ethan laughs. "I made the mysterious footprints!" Mom smiles. "Mystery solved!" Ethan gets a wet cloth. He cleans up the muddy footprints. Wipe, wipe, wipe! The floor is clean again!

"Next time, take off muddy boots outside!" says Mom. Ethan nods. "I will!" The mysterious footprints weren't so mysterious after all! Ethan made them himself!

questions.question: What did Ethan find on the kitchen floor one morning?
Where did the mysterious footprints lead?
How did Ethan and his Mom figure out who made the footprints?
options: They waited to see who walked by

questions.question: Who made the mysterious muddy footprints?

title: The Whispering Wind
description: Follow the journey of inanimate wind, female girl in this story about the whispering wind.
content:
Ava is playing outside. The wind is blowing! Whoooosh! The wind moves through the trees! Ava hears something. A soft sound. Like whispering! "What's that?" wonders Ava.

Ava listens carefully. The wind blows through the leaves. Whisper, whisper, whisper! "The wind is whispering!" says Ava. She moves closer to a tree. She listens.

The wind blows harder! Whooooosh! The whisper gets louder! Ava closes her eyes. She listens to the wind's whispers. What is the wind saying?

Ava imagines the wind is telling her secrets! Secrets about the sky! Secrets about the clouds! Secrets about where the wind goes! "Tell me more!" says Ava to the wind.

The wind blows gently through Ava's hair. Soft and cool! Whisper, whisper, whisper! "Thank you for the secrets, wind!" says Ava. The wind seems to blow a little softer. Like it's saying "you're welcome!"

Ava goes inside. But she'll always remember the whispering wind! The wind isn't scary. It's friendly! It whispers secrets to anyone who listens! Ava will listen to the wind again tomorrow!

questions.question: What does Ava hear the wind doing outside?
What does Ava imagine the wind is telling her?
options: Secrets about the sky and clouds

questions.question: How does the wind feel when it blows through Ava's hair?
What does Ava think about the wind at the end of the story?

title: The Haunted Music Box
description: Follow the journey of inanimate music box, male boy in this story about the haunted music box.
content:
Liam finds an old music box in the attic. It's small and wooden with a ballerina inside! Liam opens it. The ballerina spins! Music plays! Tinkle, tinkle, tinkle! Beautiful music!

Liam closes the music box. He brings it to his room. That night, Liam is reading in bed. Suddenly, he hears music! Tinkle, tinkle, tinkle! The music box is playing! But Liam didn't open it! "How is it playing?" wonders Liam.

Liam looks at the music box. It's closed! But the music keeps playing! Tinkle, tinkle! The ballerina inside is spinning! "Is it haunted?" thinks Liam nervously. He pulls his blanket up.

Liam's dad hears the music. He comes in. "What's that sound?" asks Dad. "The music box is playing by itself!" says Liam. Dad picks up the music box. He looks at it carefully.

"Ah," says Dad. "Look at this!" He shows Liam the wind-up key on the back. The key is slowly turning! "You wound it up earlier, remember?" says Dad. "It's still playing because the key is still turning!"

Liam understands now! The music box wasn't haunted! It was just finishing playing after being wound up! The key finally stops turning. The music stops. "Not haunted," says Liam, relieved. "Just music!" Liam smiles. He winds up the music box on purpose this time. Tinkle, tinkle, tinkle! Beautiful music to fall asleep to!

questions.question: What does Liam find in the attic?
Why does Liam think the music box is haunted?
options: It plays music when it's closed

questions.question: What did Liam's dad show him about the music box?
options: The wind-up key on the back

questions.question: Why was the music box playing by itself?
options: Liam had wound it up earlier and it was still playing

title: The Vanishing Snack
description: Follow the journey of inanimate cookie, female girl in this story about the vanishing snack.
content:
Sophie puts a chocolate chip cookie on her plate. She goes to get a glass of milk. When she comes back—the cookie is GONE! "What?" says Sophie. "Where did my cookie go?"

Sophie looks around. No cookie on the table! Not on the floor! Not on the chair! The cookie vanished! "That's weird," says Sophie. She gets another cookie. She puts it on the plate.

This time, Sophie watches the cookie carefully. She stares at it. Not blinking! The cookie sits still. Not moving. Sophie reaches for her milk. Just for one second— When she looks back, the cookie is GONE AGAIN!

"What's going on?" Sophie is confused! She hears a sound. Crunch, crunch! Sophie looks under the table. Her little brother, Max, is sitting there! Eating a cookie! "Max!" says Sophie.

"Did you take my cookies?" asks Sophie. Max grins. Cookie crumbs on his face! "Cookies are yummy!" says Max. Sophie laughs. "You're the cookie thief!"

Sophie gets two cookies. One for her. One for Max. "If you want a cookie, just ask!" says Sophie. "Okay!" says Max. They eat their cookies together. No more vanishing snacks! The mystery is solved!

questions.question: What snack did Sophie put on her plate?
How many times did Sophie's snack vanish before she solved the mystery?
What sound did Sophie hear that helped her solve the mystery?
Who was taking Sophie's cookies?

title: The Mysterious Glow
description: Follow the journey of inanimate jar, male boy in this story about the mysterious glow.
content:
Noah is camping in the backyard with his dad. They set up a tent! They have sleeping bags! A flashlight! It's getting dark. Time for bed! But Noah sees something glowing near the tent!

A soft green glow! Coming from a glass jar on the ground! "Dad! That jar is glowing!" says Noah. Dad looks over. "Hmm. Let's check it out!" They crawl over to the jar.

Inside the jar are tiny glowing bugs! Little lights turning on and off! "Glowworms!" says Dad. "They glow in the dark!" Noah's eyes go wide. "Wow!"

Dad opens the jar carefully. The glowworms crawl around inside! Their little bodies light up! On, off, on, off! "They're like tiny flashlights!" says Noah. Dad nods. "Nature's flashlights!"

Noah watches the glowworms for a long time. So fascinating! The glow is soft and green! "Can we keep them?" asks Noah. "Just for tonight," says Dad. "Then we'll let them go back to nature."

That night, Noah falls asleep in the tent. The jar of glowworms glows softly next to him. Like a nightlight! In the morning, Noah and Dad let the glowworms go. "Thank you for the light!" says Noah. The glowworms crawl away. The mysterious glow was just nature's magic!

questions.question: Where was Noah camping with his dad?
What color was the mysterious glow Noah saw?
What were the tiny glowing bugs called?
What did Noah and his dad do with the glowworms in the morning?
options: They put them in a box
They let them go back to nature
They gave them to a friend

title: The Little Drummer
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the little drummer.
content:
Long ago, in a small village, lived a boy named Thomas.

Thomas had an important job.

He was the village drummer!

Every morning and every evening, Thomas played his drum.

That's how the village knew when to wake up and when to go to sleep.

Every morning, when the sun rose, Thomas climbed to the top of the hill.

He held his drum tight.

BOOM, BOOM, BOOM!

The drum sound echoed through the village.

People woke up. "Time to start the day!"

The farmers heard the drum. They went to their fields.

The bakers heard the drum. They started making bread.

The children heard the drum. They got dressed for the day.

Everyone knew what the drum meant.

Morning has come!

All day, Thomas helped in the village.

He carried water. He fed chickens. He played with other children.

But he never forgot his drum. He kept it with him always.

Because evening would come soon.

When the sun started to set, Thomas climbed the hill again.

He looked at the orange sky.

Time for the evening drum!

BOOM, BOOM, BOOM!

The drum echoed through the village again.

People heard the evening drum.

The farmers left their fields.

The bakers closed their shops.

The children came home.

Everyone knew: Time to rest!

Thomas walked home, proud. He had an important job.

The whole village counted on him.

questions.question: What was Thomas's important job in the village?
What sound did Thomas's drum make?
What did people do when they heard the morning drum?
What did people do when they heard the evening drum?

title: The Brave Messenger
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about the brave messenger.
content:
Long ago, in a kingdom far away, lived a girl named Sara.

Sara was small but very fast.

She was a messenger! She delivered important notes across the village.

Today, Sara has a very important message to deliver.

"Take this to the baker," says the mayor. "He needs it right away!"

Sara takes the rolled-up note.

She tucks it safely in her pouch.

"I'll run as fast as I can!" says Sara.

She starts running. Her feet move quickly.

Through the village square. Past the fountain.

Sara runs down the cobblestone street.

Left turn. Right turn.

She knows every path in the village!

She's delivered messages many times before.

She's the fastest messenger there is!

Sara reaches the baker's shop.

She's out of breath, but she made it!

"Message from the mayor!" says Sara.

The baker opens the note and reads it.

His face lights up. "Thank you, Sara! This is important news!"

The baker gives Sara a fresh roll as a thank-you.

Warm and delicious!

Sara takes a bite. Yum!

"You're the best messenger we have," says the baker.

Sara smiles proudly.

Sara runs back to the mayor.

"Message delivered!" she reports.

The mayor nods. "Well done, Sara. The village needs fast, brave messengers like you."

Sara stands tall. She may be small, but she's very important.

Being a messenger is a big responsibility!

questions.question: What was Sara's job in the kingdom?
Who gave Sara the important message to deliver?
What did the baker give Sara as a thank-you?
What did the mayor say about Sara's job?
options: The village needs fast, brave messengers like her
She was too small for the job

title: The Blacksmith's Hammer
description: Follow the journey of inanimate hammer, male blacksmith in this story about the blacksmith's hammer.
content:
In a village long ago, there was a blacksmith named Henry. Henry made things from metal! Horseshoes! Tools! Nails! Henry's most important tool was his hammer. A big, heavy hammer with a wooden handle. The hammer helped make everything!

Every morning, Henry lit the fire in his forge. Hot and bright! Orange flames! He put a piece of metal in the fire. The metal got hot. Glowing red! Time to use the hammer!

Henry took the hot metal out with tongs. He put it on the anvil. A big flat block of metal! Henry raised his hammer high. CLANG! The hammer hit the metal! Sparks flew!

Henry hammered again and again. CLANG! CLANG! CLANG! The metal started to change shape! Flat. Curved. Bent. The hammer was strong! It could shape the metal!

After many hits, the metal became a horseshoe! Perfect for a horse's hoof! Henry dipped it in water. Hissssss! Steam rose! The horseshoe was done! "Good work, hammer!" said Henry.

Every day, Henry used his hammer. Making horseshoes. Making tools. Making nails. The hammer worked hard! CLANG, CLANG, CLANG! The whole village needed the things Henry made. And the hammer helped make them all!

questions.question: What did Henry the blacksmith make things from?
What was Henry's most important tool?
What sound did Henry's hammer make when it hit the metal?
What did Henry make that was 'perfect for a horse's hoof'?

title: The Castle Guard
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the castle guard.
content:
Long ago, a boy named William wanted to be a castle guard. Castle guards protected the king and queen! William was too young to be a real guard yet. But the captain of the guards said, "You can be a guard-in-training!" William was so excited!

William got a uniform! A blue tunic with a silver star! He got a wooden practice sword! He stood very tall and proud. "I'm a guard-in-training!" said William. The captain smiled. "Your first job is to watch the gate."

William stood at the castle gate. He watched everyone who came in and out. Farmers with vegetables. Merchants with cloth. Children playing. William watched carefully. Just like a real guard! He stood straight and tall.

A man walked up to the gate. "Who are you?" asked William bravely. "I'm the bread delivery man," said the man. "I bring bread to the castle every day." William recognized him! He'd seen him before! "You may enter!" said William.

All day, William watched the gate. He learned everyone's faces. He learned who belonged in the castle. He asked questions. He stayed alert! The captain walked by. "Good work, William!" William felt proud!

At the end of the day, the captain said, "You did well today. You're learning to be a good guard." William smiled. "I watched carefully! I asked questions!" "That's what guards do," said the captain. "Protect and stay alert." William couldn't wait to guard the gate again tomorrow! One day, he'd be a real castle guard!

questions.question: What did William want to be when he grew up?
What was William's first job as a 'guard-in-training'?
What did William wear as a guard-in-training?
options: A blue tunic with a silver star

questions.question: What did the captain say guards should do?

title: The Pioneer's Wagon
description: Follow the journey of inanimate wagon, family in this story about the pioneer's wagon.
content:
Long ago, a family traveled west in a covered wagon. Mama, Papa, and little Emma! The wagon was big! Made of wood with a white canvas cover! It carried everything the family owned! Clothes, pots, food, blankets!

Every morning, Papa hitched the horses to the wagon. "Ready to go?" asked Papa. "Ready!" said Mama and Emma. The horses pulled. The wagon started rolling! Creak, creak, creak! The wheels turned!

The wagon rolled across the prairie. Flat land! Tall grass! Blue sky! Emma sat in the back of the wagon. She watched the world go by! "Look! A rabbit!" said Emma, pointing. The wagon kept rolling. Mile after mile!

At night, the family stopped. They made camp! Papa unhitched the horses. Mama made dinner over a fire! Emma slept inside the wagon. Under the canvas cover! Cozy and safe! The stars sparkled above!

Some days, the wagon crossed rivers! Splash, splash! Some days, the wagon climbed hills! Slow and steady! Some days, the wheels got stuck in mud! Everyone pushed! The wagon was strong! It kept going!

After many weeks, the wagon reached the new land! Green valleys! Tall trees! A fresh start! "We made it!" said Mama. The wagon had carried them all the way! "Thank you, wagon!" said Emma, patting the wooden side. The wagon stood proudly. It had done its job!

questions.question: What kind of wagon did the family travel in?
What did the wagon carry for the family?
Where did Emma sleep at night?
What happened after many weeks of travel?

title: The Knight's Squire
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the knight's squire.
content:
Long ago, a boy named Peter wanted to be a knight. But first, he had to be a squire! A squire helps a knight. Learns from a knight! Peter became squire to Sir Robert, a brave knight! "I'll teach you," said Sir Robert.

Every morning, Peter helped Sir Robert put on his armor. Heavy metal pieces! Helmet, chest plate, arm guards! "This piece goes here," said Sir Robert. Peter learned where every piece went! Buckle, strap, tie! The armor fit tight!

Peter also took care of Sir Robert's horse. A big gray horse named Thunder! Peter brushed Thunder's coat. Smooth and shiny! Peter fed Thunder hay and oats. "Good horse," said Peter.

Sir Robert taught Peter how to be brave. "A knight protects people," said Sir Robert. "Even when scared." Peter listened carefully. "What if I'm too scared?" asked Peter. "Everyone gets scared," said Sir Robert. "Brave means doing the right thing anyway."

One day, Peter practiced with a wooden sword. Swing, swing, swing! "Good!" said Sir Robert. "You're getting stronger!" Peter felt proud. He was learning! One day, he'd be a knight just like Sir Robert!

At the end of the day, Peter helped Sir Robert take off his armor. Piece by piece. Carefully. "You did well today," said Sir Robert. "You're a good squire." "Thank you, sir," said Peter. Being a squire was hard work. But Peter was learning to be brave and helpful! One day, he'd be a real knight!

questions.question: What did Peter have to be before he could become a knight?
What was the name of Sir Robert's horse?
What did Sir Robert say 'brave' means?
What did Peter practice with to get stronger?

title: The Village Well
description: Follow the journey of inanimate well, female girl in this story about the village well.
content:
Long ago, in the center of a village, stood a stone well. Deep and round! A bucket hung on a rope! Everyone in the village came to the well for water. A girl named Rose came to the well every morning. Her job was to get water for her family!

Rose walked to the well. She carried two wooden buckets. The well stood tall and strong. Made of gray stones! "Good morning, well!" said Rose. She liked to talk to the well. It felt like a friend!

Rose lowered the bucket down, down, down. The rope unwound. Longer and longer! Finally—SPLASH! The bucket hit the water at the bottom! Rose pulled the rope back up. Heavy!

Rose pulled and pulled. The bucket came up slowly! Full of cool, clean water! Rose poured the water into her wooden buckets. One bucket. Two buckets! "Thank you, well!" said Rose.

Other villagers came to the well too. Farmers. Bakers. Mothers with babies. Everyone needed water! The well gave water to everyone. Every day! The well was the most important thing in the village!

At the end of the day, Rose walked home with her buckets. Water for cooking! Water for washing! Water for drinking! "The well takes care of us," said Rose's mother. Rose nodded. "The well is always there!" And it was. The well stood strong, giving water to everyone!

questions.question: What stood in the center of the village?
What was Rose's job every morning?
options: To get water for her family

questions.question: What sound did the bucket make when it reached the water at the bottom of the well?
Why was the well important to the village?
options: It was beautiful to look at

title: The Ancient Coin
description: Follow the journey of inanimate coin, male boy in this story about the ancient coin.
content:
A boy named Jack was digging in his backyard. He dug with a small shovel. Digging for treasure! Suddenly, his shovel hit something hard. Clink! Jack brushed away the dirt. A coin! Old and brown!

Jack picked up the coin. Heavy and round! It had a picture on it. A king's face! And strange letters Jack couldn't read. "This coin is REALLY old!" said Jack. He ran inside to show his grandpa.

Grandpa looked at the coin carefully. He put on his glasses. He turned the coin over. "This is very old," said Grandpa. "Maybe a hundred years!" Jack's eyes went wide. "A hundred years?" "Maybe even older!" said Grandpa.

Jack held the coin. He imagined who used it long ago. Maybe a king! Maybe a merchant! Maybe a farmer! Someone held this coin. Someone bought things with it! "Where did it come from?" asked Jack. "It traveled a long way," said Grandpa. "And now it found you!"

Grandpa told Jack stories about the old days. "Back then, people used coins like this every day." "No paper money?" asked Jack. "Just coins!" said Grandpa. "Gold, silver, bronze." Jack listened, amazed.

Jack kept the ancient coin in a special box. He took it out sometimes to look at it. The coin was a piece of history! A treasure! "Someone a long time ago held this," whispered Jack. The coin connected Jack to the past. To people who lived long ago!

questions.question: What did Jack find while digging in his backyard?
Who did Jack show the ancient coin to first?
What kind of picture was on the coin?
How old did Grandpa think the coin might be?
options: A hundred years or even older

title: The Lighthouse Keeper's Daughter
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about the lighthouse keeper's daughter.
content:
Long ago, a girl named Annie lived in a lighthouse. Her father was the lighthouse keeper! The lighthouse stood tall on a rocky cliff by the ocean. Every night, the lighthouse's light warned ships about the rocks! Annie helped her father every day!

Every evening, Annie and her father climbed the spiral stairs. Round and round. Up and up! One hundred steps to the top! Annie counted as she climbed. "Ninety-eight, ninety-nine, one hundred!" They reached the top!

At the top was the big light. A huge glass lantern! Annie's father lit the lamp inside. Bright and warm! The light shone out across the dark ocean. "Now the ships can see!" said Father. Annie looked out at the water. So many stars above!

Annie's job was to polish the glass every day. She used a soft cloth. She wiped the glass clean! Round and round. Shiny and clear! "The cleaner the glass, the brighter the light!" said Father. Annie worked hard. She wanted the light to shine far!

One foggy night, the fog was very thick. Ships couldn't see the light through the fog! "Ring the bell!" said Father. Annie helped ring the big brass bell. CLANG! CLANG! CLANG! The sound warned ships even when they couldn't see the light!

The ships heard the bell. They turned away from the rocks! Safe! "We did it!" said Annie. Father hugged her. "You're a good lighthouse keeper's daughter!" Annie smiled. She helped keep ships safe! Every night, the lighthouse stood guard. And Annie helped!

questions.question: Where did Annie live with her father?
What was Annie's job every day to help the lighthouse?
What did Annie and her father do when the fog was very thick?
options: They rang a big brass bell

questions.question: What was the purpose of the lighthouse's light?

title: The Explorer's Map
description: Follow the journey of inanimate map, male boy in this story about the explorer's map.
content:
Long ago, a boy named Daniel found an old map in his grandfather's trunk. The map was brown and wrinkled. Very old! It showed mountains, rivers, and forests! "X marks the spot!" said Daniel, pointing to a big X on the map. "What's at the X?" Daniel wondered.

Daniel asked his grandfather about the map. "I drew this when I was young," said Grandfather. "I explored these lands!" "Really?" asked Daniel, amazed. "Really!" said Grandfather. "Want to go exploring?" Daniel nodded excitedly!

Daniel and Grandfather followed the map. First, they walked past the old mill. The map showed it! Then, they crossed the wooden bridge. The map showed that too! "The map is right!" said Daniel. Grandfather smiled. "I drew it carefully!"

Next, they climbed a small hill. At the top, they could see far away! Daniel looked at the map. "What's next?" "The big oak tree!" said Grandfather, pointing. They walked toward a huge oak tree. Just like on the map!

Under the oak tree, Grandfather stopped. "This is the X!" said Grandfather. Daniel looked around. "What's here?" Grandfather pointed at a flat rock. "Lift that rock!" Daniel lifted the rock. Underneath was a small metal box!

Daniel opened the box. Inside were beautiful stones! Smooth and colorful! "I collected these when I was your age," said Grandfather. "I hid them here!" "They're beautiful!" said Daniel. Grandfather smiled. "Now they're yours. And one day, you can make your own map!" Daniel held the map carefully. A treasure from the past!

questions.question: What did Daniel find in his grandfather's trunk?
What did the map show?
What did 'X marks the spot' on the map lead Daniel and Grandfather to?
options: A large rock under an oak tree

questions.question: What was inside the small metal box they found?

title: The First Robin
description: Follow the journey of female robin in this story about Spring.
content:
Winter is ending. The snow is melting.

Ruby the robin has been far away in the warm south.

But now, spring is coming!

Time to fly home.

Ruby spreads her red-feathered wings and flies north.

Ruby flies for many days.

She passes over fields. Over rivers. Over forests.

Finally, she sees her home!

The big oak tree by the pond.

Ruby flies down and lands on a branch.

"I'm home!" chirps Ruby.

Ruby looks around. Everything looks different!

The ground is muddy, not snowy.

Tiny green buds are growing on the trees.

A few flowers are starting to bloom.

Spring is here!

Ruby needs to build a nest.

She flies around collecting twigs. Grass. Soft moss.

She weaves them together in the tree branches.

Round and cozy. The perfect nest!

"This will be my home," chirps Ruby.

Other animals see Ruby.

"The robin is back!" says a squirrel. "Spring has really arrived!"

A rabbit hops over. "Welcome home, Ruby!"

Ruby chirps happily. She sings her spring song.

Tweet-tweet-tweet!

Ruby sits in her new nest.

The sun is warm. The breeze is gentle.

All around, flowers are blooming. Leaves are growing.

Ruby knows that soon, baby robins will hatch in her nest.

Spring is the best season!

questions.question: Where has Ruby the robin been during the winter?
options: Far away in the warm south

questions.question: What season is coming when Ruby flies home?
What does Ruby need to build when she gets home?
What do the other animals say when they see Ruby return?
options: 'The robin is back! Spring has really arrived!'

title: The First Snowflake
description: Follow the journey of inanimate snowflake, male boy in this story about Winter.
content:
Jack looks out the window. The sky is gray.

"Is it going to snow?" asks Jack.

Mom looks up at the clouds. "Maybe!"

Jack presses his nose to the glass. He's never seen snow before!

He waits. And waits.

High up in the sky, a tiny snowflake forms.

She is white and delicate. Six points, perfectly shaped.

"I'm ready!" says the snowflake.

She starts falling. Down, down, down.

Other snowflakes form around her. They fall together.

Jack sees something white outside the window.

A tiny white speck falling from the sky!

"A snowflake!" shouts Jack.

He runs outside. No coat. No shoes. Too excited!

"Jack! Put on your coat!" calls Mom.

Jack stands in the yard. He looks up.

More snowflakes are falling now!

One lands on Jack's nose. Cold!

It melts right away. A tiny drop of water.

"It tickled!" giggles Jack.

Jack sticks out his tongue.

A snowflake lands on it!

Cold and wet. Then it melts.

More snowflakes fall. On Jack's hair. On his hands. On his shoulders.

The first snow!

Jack spins around with his arms out.

Snowflakes fall all around him.

The ground starts to turn white!

"It's snowing! It's really snowing!" Jack shouts.

Mom brings his coat. But Jack doesn't want to go inside.

The first snow is magical!

SPRING STORIES

questions.question: What is Jack doing at the beginning of the story?
How does the first snowflake feel when it lands on Jack's nose?
What does Jack do when he runs outside without his coat and shoes?
options: He starts crying because it's cold.

questions.question: What happens to the ground as more snowflakes fall?

content:

Ruby flies for many days. She passes over fields. Over rivers. Over forests. Finally, she sees her home! The big oak tree by the pond. Ruby flies down and lands on a branch. "I'm home!" chirps Ruby.

Ruby looks around. Everything looks different! The ground is muddy, not snowy. Tiny green buds are growing on the trees. A few flowers are starting to bloom. Spring is here!

Ruby needs to build a nest. She flies around collecting twigs. Grass. Soft moss. She weaves them together in the tree branches. Round and cozy. The perfect nest! "This will be my home," chirps Ruby.

Ruby sits in her new nest. The sun is warm. The breeze is gentle. All around, flowers are blooming. Leaves are growing. Ruby knows that soon, baby robins will hatch in her nest. Spring is the best season!

What does Ruby expect to hatch in her nest soon?

title: The Rainy Day Parade
description: Follow the journey of kids with umbrellas in this story about the rainy day parade.
content:
It's raining! Pitter-patter on the roof! But Mia, Ben, and Emma don't mind! Today is the spring parade! They put on their rain boots. Bright and colorful! They grab their umbrellas!

Mia has a red umbrella with white dots! Ben has a blue umbrella with yellow stripes! Emma has a green umbrella with frogs on it! "Ready for the parade?" asks Mia. "Ready!" say Ben and Emma!

The children march down the sidewalk! Left, right, left, right! Their boots splash in puddles! SPLASH! Their umbrellas keep them dry! The rain pitter-patters on the umbrellas!

More children join the parade! Everyone has rain boots! Everyone has umbrellas! Red, blue, yellow, green, purple, orange! So many colors! The rainy day parade gets bigger!

The children march and splash! They sing a rain song: "Rain, rain, here to play! We love a rainy day!" Splash, splash, splash in the puddles! Everyone laughs!

The parade ends at the park. The children are wet, but happy! Their boots are muddy! Their cheeks are pink! "That was the best parade!" says Emma. Everyone agrees. Rain makes everything more fun!

questions.question: What do Mia, Ben, and Emma wear on their feet for the parade?
What item do the children grab to keep themselves dry?
What sound do the children's boots make when they splash in puddles?
Where does the rainy day parade end?

title: The Baby Bird Arrives
description: Follow the journey of gender-neutral chick in this story about the baby bird arrives.
content:
In a nest high in a tree, an egg sits. Smooth and blue. Warm and safe. Spring has arrived! The sun shines warm! Inside the egg, something is happening. Tap, tap, tap!

The egg is cracking! A tiny crack appears! Tap, tap, tap! The crack gets bigger! A little beak pokes through! Tap, tap, tap!

The shell breaks open! A baby bird tumbles out! Tiny and fluffy! Yellow feathers wet and sticky! The baby bird blinks. First time seeing the world! So bright!

Mama bird lands on the nest. "Welcome, little one!" The baby bird chirps! A tiny, soft sound! Mama bird covers the baby with her wing. Warm and cozy! The baby bird snuggles close.

The baby bird looks around. Blue sky! Green leaves! Warm sunshine! Everything is new! Everything is amazing! The baby bird chirps again. Happy to be here!

Mama bird brings food. A tiny worm! The baby bird eats. First meal! The nest is soft. The sun is warm. Mama is here. The baby bird is home! Spring is the perfect time to be born!

SUMMER STORIES

questions.question: What color is the egg in the nest?
What sound does the egg make right before it hatches?
What does Mama bird bring the baby bird to eat for its first meal?
How does the baby bird feel seeing the world for the first time?

title: The Firefly Jar
description: Follow the journey of inanimate jar, male boy in this story about the firefly jar.
content:
Summer evening. The sun is setting. Leo is in the backyard with a glass jar. Tonight, Leo is catching fireflies! Fireflies are tiny bugs that light up! Leo waits. Watching the grass.

As the sky gets darker, little lights appear! Blink, blink! Fireflies! They fly slowly through the air. Glowing yellow! "There's one!" says Leo. He runs after it. Carefully!

Leo catches a firefly gently in his hands! He opens the jar. He puts the firefly inside! The firefly glows! Bright yellow light! "I caught one!" says Leo happily. The firefly flies around inside the jar. Blink, blink!

Leo catches more fireflies! One, two, three, four, five! The jar is full of glowing bugs! They blink on and off! Like tiny stars! The jar glows in Leo's hands!

Leo sits on the porch. He watches the fireflies in the jar. Blink, blink, blink! So beautiful! "You're like magic lights!" says Leo. The fireflies keep glowing. On, off, on, off!

After a while, Leo knows what to do. He opens the jar. He tips it gently. The fireflies fly out! Up into the dark sky! They join the other fireflies. Free! "Goodbye, fireflies!" says Leo. Watching them is fun. But they belong in the sky!

questions.question: What does Leo use to catch fireflies?
What color do the fireflies glow?
How many fireflies does Leo catch in his jar?
What does Leo do with the fireflies at the end of the story?
options: He keeps them in his room.
He gives them to his mom.
He puts them under his bed.

title: The Ice Cream Truck
description: Follow the journey of inanimate truck, female girl in this story about the ice cream truck.
content:
It's a hot summer day! Ava is playing in her front yard. Suddenly, she hears music! Tinkle-tinkle-tinkle! A truck is coming down the street! The ice cream truck!

The truck is white with colorful pictures! Ice cream cones! Popsicles! Sundaes! The music plays loud! Tinkle-tinkle-tinkle! The truck stops at the corner! "Ice cream!" shouts Ava!

Ava runs inside. "Mom! The ice cream truck is here!" Mom gives Ava some money. "What flavor do you want?" "Chocolate!" says Ava. Mom and Ava walk to the truck!

A friendly man opens the truck window. "What would you like?" he asks. "Chocolate ice cream, please!" says Ava. The man hands her a chocolate cone. Cold and sweet! Ava gives him the money.

Ava licks her ice cream. So cold! So yummy! Chocolate drips down the cone. Ava licks it quickly! The sun is hot, but the ice cream is cold! Perfect!

The ice cream truck plays its music. Tinkle-tinkle-tinkle! It drives to the next street. Other children run to it! Ava waves goodbye. "Thank you, ice cream truck!" Summer days are the best when the ice cream truck comes!

FALL STORIES

questions.question: What sound does the ice cream truck make?
What flavor ice cream does Ava ask for?
What does Ava do quickly when her ice cream starts to drip?
options: She gives it to her mom.
She lets it drip on the ground.

questions.question: Who does Ava wave goodbye to at the end of the story?

title: The Pumpkin Patch
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the pumpkin patch.
content:
Fall is here! The air is cool! Noah and his family go to the pumpkin patch! A big field full of pumpkins! Orange pumpkins everywhere! "I'm going to find the perfect pumpkin!" says Noah.

Noah walks through the pumpkin patch. So many pumpkins! Big ones! Small ones! Round ones! Tall ones! Noah looks at each pumpkin carefully.

Noah sees a HUGE pumpkin! As big as him! He tries to lift it. Too heavy! "This one is too big," says Noah. He keeps looking.

Noah sees a tiny pumpkin. As small as his hand! He picks it up. Very light! "This one is too small," says Noah. He wants a medium pumpkin!

Then Noah sees it! The perfect pumpkin! Round and orange! Not too big! Not too small! Noah picks it up. Just right! "This is the one!" says Noah.

Noah carries his pumpkin to the wagon. At home, Noah and his family carve the pumpkin! Triangle eyes! A big smile! A candle inside! The pumpkin glows at night! Noah found the perfect pumpkin!

questions.question: What season is it when Noah and his family go to the pumpkin patch?
What kind of pumpkin does Noah want to find?
What does Noah try to do with the HUGE pumpkin he finds?
What do Noah and his family put inside the carved pumpkin at home?

title: The Leaf Pile Jump
description: Follow the journey of inanimate leaves, female girl in this story about the leaf pile jump.
content:
Fall is here! Leaves are falling from the trees! Red leaves! Orange leaves! Yellow leaves! Brown leaves! Sophie's yard is covered in leaves! "Let's rake them into a pile!" says Dad.

Sophie helps Dad rake the leaves. Scratch, scratch, scratch! The rake pulls the leaves together! The pile gets bigger and bigger! More leaves! Higher and higher! Soon the pile is as tall as Sophie!

Sophie looks at the big leaf pile. It's so tall! So colorful! The leaves rustle in the breeze. Crunch, crunch! Sophie has an idea! "Can I jump in?" asks Sophie.

"Of course!" says Dad, smiling. Sophie backs up. She runs toward the pile! She jumps! Up in the air! WHOOSH! She lands in the leaves!

CRUNCH! Leaves fly everywhere! Some land on Sophie's head! Sophie laughs! The leaves are crunchy and fun! She's buried in leaves! "Again!" says Sophie.

Sophie jumps in the leaf pile again and again! Crunch, crunch, crunch! Leaves stick in her hair! Leaves stick to her clothes! Sophie giggles. Fall is the best! Jumping in leaf piles is so much fun!

WINTER STORIES

questions.question: What colors are the leaves falling from the trees in Sophie's yard?
How tall does the leaf pile get when Sophie and Dad rake it?
What sound do the leaves make when Sophie jumps into the pile?
What happens to the leaves when Sophie jumps into the pile?

title: The First Snowflake
description: Follow the journey of inanimate snowflake, male boy in this story about the first snowflake.
content:
Jack looks out the window. The sky is gray. "Is it going to snow?" asks Jack. Mom looks up at the clouds. "Maybe!" Jack presses his nose to the glass. He's never seen snow before! He waits. And waits.

High up in the sky, a tiny snowflake forms. She is white and delicate. Six points, perfectly shaped. "I'm ready!" says the snowflake. She starts falling. Down, down, down. Other snowflakes form around her. They fall together.

Jack sees something white outside the window. A tiny white speck falling from the sky! "A snowflake!" shouts Jack. He runs outside. No coat. No shoes. Too excited! "Jack! Put on your coat!" calls Mom.

Jack stands in the yard. He looks up. More snowflakes are falling now! One lands on Jack's nose. Cold! It melts right away. A tiny drop of water. "It tickled!" giggles Jack.

Jack sticks out his tongue. A snowflake lands on it! Cold and wet. Then it melts. More snowflakes fall. On Jack's hair. On his hands. On his shoulders. The first snow!

Jack spins around with his arms out. Snowflakes fall all around him. The ground starts to turn white! "It's snowing! It's really snowing!" Jack shouts. Mom brings his coat. But Jack doesn't want to go inside. The first snow is magical!

questions.question: How many points does the tiny snowflake have?
What does Jack put out to catch a snowflake?
What does Mom bring Jack outside when he's playing in the snow?
How does Jack describe the first snow?

title: The Snowman Builder
description: Follow the journey of female girl, inanimate snowman in this story about the snowman builder.
content:
The yard is covered in snow! White and sparkly! Emma puts on her coat, hat, mittens, and boots. "I'm going to build a snowman!" says Emma. She runs outside into the snow!

Emma makes a small snowball. She rolls it in the snow. Round and round! The snowball picks up more snow. It gets bigger! Bigger and bigger! Soon it's HUGE! As big as Emma!

Emma pushes the big snowball. She makes it the bottom of the snowman! Now she makes a medium snowball. Roll, roll, roll! She lifts it on top of the big one! That's the middle!

Emma makes a small snowball for the head! Roll, roll, roll! Not too big! She puts it on top! Three snowballs stacked! The snowman's body is done!

Now Emma needs to decorate! She finds two stones for eyes! A carrot for the nose! Sticks for arms! A scarf around the neck! The snowman is complete!

Emma steps back to look at her snowman. Tall and round! Smiling with stone eyes! "Hello, Mr. Snowman!" says Emma. The snowman stands in the yard. Silent and happy! Emma built her first snowman! She's so proud!

questions.question: What does Emma want to build in the snowy yard?
How does Emma make the snowballs for her snowman?
options: She rolls them in the snow.
She asks her mom for help.

questions.question: What does Emma use for the snowman's nose?
What is the last thing Emma adds to decorate her snowman?

title: The Cozy Scarf
description: Follow the journey of inanimate scarf, male boy in this story about the cozy scarf.
content:
Winter is here! It's very cold outside! Oliver's grandma is knitting something special. Click, click, click! The knitting needles move fast! Red yarn wraps around the needles. "What are you making, Grandma?" asks Oliver.

"A scarf for you!" says Grandma. "To keep you warm!" Oliver watches Grandma knit. Click, click, click! The scarf gets longer and longer! Red and soft! So cozy!

After many days, the scarf is finished! Grandma ties off the last stitch. She holds up the scarf. Long and beautiful! "Try it on!" says Grandma. Oliver wraps the scarf around his neck.

The scarf is soft and warm! It tickles Oliver's chin! "It's perfect!" says Oliver. Grandma smiles. "Now you'll be warm all winter!" Oliver hugs Grandma. "Thank you!"

Oliver wears his scarf outside. The wind blows. Cold! But Oliver's neck is warm! The scarf protects him! He plays in the snow. Building. Running. Sledding! The scarf keeps him cozy!

At the end of the day, Oliver comes inside. His nose is cold. His fingers are cold. But his neck is warm! "The scarf worked!" says Oliver. Grandma nods. "Made with love to keep you warm!" Oliver wears his scarf every cold day. The best scarf ever!

questions.question: What is Grandma knitting for Oliver?
What color is the yarn Grandma uses for the scarf?
How does Oliver feel when he wears his new scarf outside in the cold?
What does Grandma say the scarf is made with?

title: The Birthday Balloon
description: Follow the journey of inanimate balloon, male boy in this story about the birthday balloon.
content:
Today is Liam's birthday! He's turning three! The house is decorated with streamers and balloons! Red balloons! Blue balloons! Yellow balloons! But Liam's favorite is the big silver balloon shaped like a star!

The star balloon floats near the ceiling. Its string hangs down. Just barely! Liam jumps. He tries to reach the string! Jump, jump, jump! His fingers touch it! He grabs it!

Liam holds the balloon string. The balloon floats above his head! He walks around the house. The balloon follows! Float, float, float! "Look! My balloon is following me!" says Liam.

At the birthday party, Liam shows everyone his balloon! His friends love it! "Can I hold it?" asks his friend Mia. Liam shares. Mia holds the balloon for a minute. Then she gives it back. "Thank you!"

After the party, Liam ties the balloon to his bedpost. The balloon floats above his bed. At night, it glows a little in the moonlight. Silver and sparkly! "Goodnight, balloon," says Liam.

Every day, the balloon floats by Liam's bed. After a week, the balloon starts to sink. Just a little. After two weeks, it sinks more. But Liam still loves it! His special birthday balloon! Even when it's flat, Liam keeps it. A memory of his best birthday!

questions.question: How old is Liam turning on his birthday?
What is Liam's favorite balloon shaped like?
What does Liam do with his star balloon after the party?
options: He ties it to his bedpost.
He hides it under his bed.

questions.question: What happens to the balloon after a week or two?

title: The Gratitude Jar
description: Follow the journey of inanimate jar, female girl in this story about the gratitude jar.
content:
Zoe's family has a special jar. The Gratitude Jar! It's a big glass jar with a label that says "Thank You!" "What's it for?" asks Zoe. Mama explains: "Every day, we write something we're thankful for!"

Mama gives Zoe a small piece of paper. "What are you thankful for today?" asks Mama. Zoe thinks. "My teddy bear!" Mama writes: "Zoe is thankful for her teddy bear." Zoe folds the paper. She drops it in the jar!

Every day, Zoe adds a note to the jar! "I'm thankful for pancakes!" "I'm thankful for my friend Mia!" "I'm thankful for the park!" The jar fills up with folded papers!

Mama adds notes too! Papa adds notes! Even big brother adds notes! "I'm thankful for Zoe!" writes Mama. "I'm thankful for sunshine!" writes Papa. The jar gets fuller and fuller!

At the end of the year, the jar is full! "Let's read them!" says Mama. The family sits together. They open each note and read it. So many good things to be thankful for! Everyone smiles!

"Being thankful makes us happy," says Mama. Zoe nods. "I'm thankful for our family!" Mama writes that down. Into the jar it goes! The Gratitude Jar helps Zoe remember all the good things! Next year, they'll fill another jar!

questions.question: What is the special jar in Zoe's family called?
What does Zoe write in her very first note for the jar?
Who else in Zoe's family adds notes to the jar?
What does the family do with all the notes at the end of the year?
options: They save them for next year.
They make a craft with them.

title: Captain Brave
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about captain brave.
content:
Kai wraps a red towel around his shoulders.

It's his cape!

He puts on his boots.

"I am Captain Brave!" announces Kai.

He stands with his hands on his hips. Hero pose!

Captain Brave hears a call for help!

His teddy bear is stuck on top of the bookshelf!

"Don't worry, Teddy! I'll save you!"

Kai pushes a chair to the bookshelf.

He climbs up carefully.

Kai reaches Teddy. He grabs him!

"I've got you!" says Captain Brave.

He climbs back down with Teddy safe in his arms.

Teddy is rescued!

"Another successful mission!" says Kai.

Next, Captain Brave sees his toy cars scattered everywhere!

"The city needs organizing!" says Kai.

He picks up cars. One by one.

He puts them in the toy box.

"The city is safe now!"

Captain Brave's little sister starts crying.

She dropped her pacifier!

"I'll help you!" says Kai.

He finds the pacifier under the couch.

He gives it to his sister. She stops crying!

"Captain Brave saves the day again!"

At bedtime, Kai takes off his cape.

But he's still a superhero, even without it!

"Being a superhero means helping people," says Kai.

Mom kisses his head. "You're my superhero."

Kai smiles. Tomorrow, Captain Brave will save the day again!

questions.question: What does Kai use as his superhero cape?
Who is the first person or toy Captain Brave rescues?
Where is Teddy stuck before Captain Brave saves him?
What does Kai's mom say to him at bedtime?

title: The Shield of Kindness
description: Follow the journey of inanimate shield, female girl in this story about the shield of kindness.
content:
Emma finds a toy shield in the toy box.

It's round and silver with a star on it.

"This is my superhero shield!" says Emma.

She holds it up. Strong!

"But what does it do?" wonders Emma.

Emma's friend comes over to play.

Her friend is sad. She lost her favorite hairband.

"I'll help you find it!" says Emma.

She uses her shield to gently push aside toys, looking underneath.

"Found it!" Emma holds up the hairband.

Emma's shield glows! (In her imagination.)

"My shield glows when I'm kind!" says Emma.

Her friend hugs her. "Thank you, Emma!"

Emma realizes her shield has a special power.

The power of kindness!

Emma's little brother falls down. He starts to cry.

Emma runs over with her shield.

"Are you okay?" she asks gently.

She helps him stand up. She brushes dirt off his knee.

"All better!" says Emma.

Emma's shield glows again! (In her imagination.)

"When I help people, my shield gets stronger!" says Emma.

She holds it proudly.

Being kind is a superpower!

That night, Emma puts her shield by her bed.

"Tomorrow, I'll help more people!" says Emma.

Mom smiles. "You're a superhero, Emma. The kindest superhero ever."

Emma drifts off to sleep. She dreams of helping everyone!

title: Super Speed Girl
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about super speed girl.
content:
Mia puts on her sneakers. The red ones with lightning bolts!

"These are my super speed shoes!" says Mia.

She ties them tight. Ready!

"I'm Super Speed Girl!" announces Mia.

She can run faster than anyone!

Mia runs around the backyard.

Zoom! Her feet move so fast!

Her hair flies behind her. Whoosh!

"I'm faster than the wind!" shouts Mia.

She runs in circles. Loop-de-loop!

Dad is watering the garden.

"Can Super Speed Girl help me?" asks Dad.

"Yes!" says Mia.

Dad points. "I need the watering can from the shed!"

"I'll get it super fast!" says Mia.

Mia runs to the shed. Zoom!

She gets the watering can.

She runs back to Dad. Zoom!

She's so fast!

"Here you go!" says Mia, barely out of breath.

"Wow! That was super speed!" says Dad.

Mom calls from the door. "Mia! Time to clean up!"

"I can clean up super fast!" says Mia.

She runs to pick up her toys. Zoom!

One toy. Then another. Then another!

She's done in no time!

At dinner, Mia sits down.

She's a little bit tired from running all day.

"Super Speed Girl needs to rest," says Mia.

Dad smiles. "Even superheroes need to rest."

Mia eats her dinner. She'll need energy for more super speed tomorrow!

title: The Invisible Boy
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the invisible boy.
content:
Leo has a special superpower. He can turn invisible!

Well, not really. But he PRETENDS he can!

"I'm invisible!" whispers Leo.

He tiptoes through the house very quietly.

No one can see him! (Or so he thinks.)

Leo sneaks into the kitchen. Tiptoe, tiptoe.

Mom is cooking dinner. She doesn't look at Leo.

"I'm invisible! She can't see me!" thinks Leo.

Leo gets closer. Closer.

He's right behind Mom!

Leo reaches out and taps Mom's leg. "Boo!"

Mom jumps and laughs. "Oh no! The invisible boy got me!"

Leo giggles. "You couldn't see me!"

Mom plays along. "You were completely invisible!"

Leo is so proud of his power!

Leo sneaks into the living room. Still invisible!

Dad is reading on the couch.

Leo crawls across the floor. Quiet as a mouse!

Dad doesn't move. He's reading his book.

"He definitely can't see me," thinks Leo.

Leo sneaks up to the couch. He climbs up quietly.

Then he jumps on Dad! "Surprise!"

Dad pretends to be shocked. "Where did you come from?"

"I was invisible!" says Leo proudly.

Dad hugs him. "The best invisible hugger ever!"

At bedtime, Leo is tucked in.

"Can you be invisible in bed?" asks Mom.

Leo thinks. "No. Because then you couldn't kiss me goodnight!"

Mom kisses his forehead. "Good point!"

Leo smiles. Sometimes it's better to be visible!

questions.question: What special power does Leo pretend to have?
Who does Leo "surprise" first by tapping their leg while pretending to be invisible?
What is Leo's dad doing when Leo sneaks up on him while invisible?
Why does Leo say he can't be invisible in bed?
options: Then his mom couldn't kiss him goodnight.
He wouldn't be able to sleep.

title: The Strong Lifter
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about the strong lifter.
content:
Ava flexes her arms.

"I have super strength!" announces Ava.

She can lift heavy things!

Well, heavy for a little girl!

Today, she'll show everyone how strong she is!

Ava goes to her toy box.

She picks up her teddy bear. It's big!

She lifts it over her head!

"I'm so strong!" says Ava.

Teddy is way up high!

Ava's little brother drops his ball.

It rolls under the couch.

"I'll get it!" says Ava.

She pushes the couch. Just a little bit!

It moves! There's the ball!

"Super strength helped!" says Ava.

Dad is carrying grocery bags.

"These are heavy!" says Dad.

"I can help!" says Ava. "I have super strength!"

Dad gives her a small bag. Light things inside!

Ava carries it carefully. "I'm helping!"

Dad smiles. "You're very strong!"

Ava tries to lift other things.

Her pillow! Easy!

Her book bag! She can do it!

Her laundry basket! With Dad's help!

"I'm getting stronger every day!" says Ava.

At bedtime, Ava is tired.

"Using super strength is hard work," says Ava, yawning.

Mom tucks her in. "Strong muscles need rest."

Ava closes her eyes. "Tomorrow I'll be even stronger!"

Mom smiles. "I'm sure you will."

How does Ava help her little brother get his ball from under the couch?

title: The Flying Cape
description: Follow the journey of inanimate cape, male boy in this story about the flying cape.
content:
Oliver has a blue cape.

It's silky and smooth. Perfect for flying!

Oliver ties it around his neck.

When he runs, the cape flies behind him!

"I can fly!" says Oliver.

Oliver runs across the backyard.

The cape flutters and flows. Whoosh!

It looks like he's flying through the air!

"Look at me!" calls Oliver.

Mom watches and smiles.

Oliver runs faster!

The cape lifts up high behind him!

It catches the wind. Flap, flap!

"The cape makes me fly!" says Oliver.

He feels like a real superhero!

Oliver climbs on the slide.

He sits at the top. Cape spread out behind him.

"Ready for takeoff!" announces Oliver.

He slides down. Whoooosh!

The cape flies up! He's flying down the slide!

Oliver spins in circles. The cape spins too!

Round and round! The cape makes a circle shape!

"Flying in circles!" says Oliver.

He's getting dizzy! But it's so fun!

Oliver is tired from flying all day.

He takes off his cape. Time to rest.

"Even flying superheroes need naps," says Mom.

Oliver yawns. "Tomorrow I'll fly even higher!"

The cape rests too. Ready for tomorrow's adventures!

What does the cape do behind Oliver when he runs?
Where does Oliver sit and announce "Ready for takeoff!"?

options: Spinning in circles with his cape

title: The Super Helper
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about the super helper.
content:
Liam wears his superhero shirt.

It has a big "H" on it. H for Helper!

"I'm Super Helper!" announces Liam.

His superpower? Helping people super fast!

Time to use his powers!

Dad is picking up toys in the living room.

"This will take a while," says Dad.

"I can help super fast!" says Liam.

Liam picks up toys quickly! One, two, three!

Into the toy box they go!

In just five minutes, all the toys are put away!

Liam flexes his arms. "Super Helper powers!"

Dad gives him a high-five.

Mom is folding laundry.

"Can Super Helper match the socks?" asks Mom.

"Yes!" says Liam.

He finds two blue socks. Match!

Two red socks. Match!

He's so fast at matching!

At dinner, Liam helps set the table.

Fork here. Spoon there. Napkin folded!

"Super Helper is super helpful!" says Mom.

Liam beams with pride.

Helping makes him feel strong!

At bedtime, Liam puts on his pajamas all by himself.

"I helped myself get ready for bed!" says Liam.

Dad smiles. "Super Helpers help themselves too."

Liam climbs into bed. "Being helpful feels good!"

Tomorrow, Super Helper will help again!

title: The Freeze Power
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about the freeze power.
content:
Zoe is playing freeze tag with her friends.

But Zoe is special. She has freeze powers!

When she says "Freeze!" everyone has to stop!

"I'm Freeze Girl!" announces Zoe.

Her superpower is ready!

Zoe chases her friend Maya.

"I'm going to freeze you!" says Zoe.

Maya runs and giggles. "You can't catch me!"

Zoe runs faster!

She reaches out her hand!

"Freeze!" shouts Zoe, touching Maya's shoulder.

Maya stops running immediately! Frozen in place!

She stands completely still. Like a statue!

"I froze you!" says Zoe proudly.

Maya giggles but doesn't move.

Another friend runs by. "Catch me!"

Zoe chases him. Running, running!

"Freeze!" says Zoe, tagging him.

He stops! Frozen!

Two friends frozen! Zoe's power is working!

One more friend to freeze!

This one is fast! Running in zigzags!

But Zoe is faster!

She reaches out. "Freeze!"

Got him! All friends are frozen!

"Okay, everyone can unfreeze now!" says Zoe.

All her friends start moving again!

"Your freeze power is so cool!" says Maya.

They play freeze tag again and again!

Being Freeze Girl is the best!

title: The Gadget Belt
description: Follow the journey of inanimate belt, male boy in this story about the gadget belt.
content:
Jack's dad gives him a special belt.

It has pockets all around it! Lots of pockets!

"This is your gadget belt," says Dad. "For your superhero adventures!"

Jack puts it on. It fits perfectly!

Time to fill it with gadgets!

Jack looks for gadgets around the house.

He finds a toy magnifying glass. Perfect!

He puts it in a pocket.

He finds a small toy screwdriver. Great!

Into another pocket it goes!

Jack adds more gadgets.

A small toy flashlight!

A toy compass!

A bouncy ball! (Every superhero needs a bouncy ball!)

His gadget belt is full!

Dad pretends there's a problem. "Oh no! I can't read this small print!"

"I have a gadget for that!" says Jack.

He pulls out his magnifying glass!

Dad looks through it. "Perfect! You saved the day!"

Mom says, "Oh no! It's dark in the closet!"

"I have a gadget for that!" says Jack.

He pulls out his flashlight!

He shines it in the closet. Light!

"You're so prepared!" says Mom.

At bedtime, Jack takes off his gadget belt.

But he keeps it next to his bed.

"In case of nighttime emergencies," says Jack seriously.

Dad smiles. "Good thinking."

Jack falls asleep. His gadget belt ready for tomorrow!
