title: The Team of Heroes
description: Follow the journey of male and female kids in this story about the team of heroes.
content:
Lily, Ben, and Sam are playing superheroes.

But today they're not just heroes. They're a TEAM!

"We're the Super Team!" announces Lily.

Each hero has a special power!

Together, they can solve any problem!

Lily's power is super jumping! She can jump really high!

Ben's power is super strength! He can move heavy things!

Sam's power is super speed! He can run really fast!

"Super Team, ready!" they all shout together.

They find their first problem!

A toy is stuck on top of the play structure. Too high to reach!

"I can jump up there!" says Lily.

She jumps high! She grabs the toy!

"Teamwork!" cheers Ben and Sam.

Next problem! The wagon is full of balls. Too heavy to pull!

"I can use my strength!" says Ben.

He pulls the wagon. It moves!

"Teamwork!" cheer Lily and Sam.

Last problem! They need to bring all the toys inside before dinner. So many toys!

"I can run back and forth super fast!" says Sam.

He carries toys inside. Zoom! Zoom! Zoom!

"Teamwork!" cheer Lily and Ben.

All the problems are solved!

The Super Team sits down. Tired but happy!

"We did it!" says Lily.

"Together!" adds Ben.

Sam agrees. "Teams are better than heroes alone!"

They give each other a big team high-five!

questions.question: What is the name of Lily, Ben, and Sam's superhero group?
What is Lily's special superpower?
How does Ben help the team solve a problem?
What do the Super Team members learn about working together?
options: Teams are better than heroes alone

title: Finn's First Jump
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about finn's first jump.
content:
Finn stands at the edge of the pool.

It's the diving board. Not the high one. The low one.

But it still looks high to Finn.

Other kids are jumping. Splash! Splash!

Finn watches. His tummy feels funny.

"Want to try?" asks Finn's dad from the water.

Finn looks down. The water looks far away.

"I don't know," says Finn.

"I'll be right here to catch you," says Dad.

Finn takes one step forward. Then he stops.

A girl jumps off the board. SPLASH!

She pops up smiling. "That was fun!"

Finn thinks. Maybe he can try.

He walks to the edge of the diving board.

His toes hang over. He looks down.

His heart beats fast.

"You can do it, Finn!" calls Dad.

Finn takes a deep breath.

He bends his knees.

"One, two, three..." Finn counts.

He jumps!

Finn is flying through the air!

Then—SPLASH!

He goes under the water. Cold and bubbly!

Finn kicks his feet and pops back up.

Dad is right there, smiling.

"You did it!" says Dad.

Finn swims to the side. He climbs out.

His heart is still beating fast.

But now he's smiling!

"Can I do it again?" asks Finn.

Dad laughs. "As many times as you want!"

Finn runs back to the diving board.

Jumping isn't scary anymore. It's fun!

questions.question: Where is Finn trying to jump from at the pool?
Who encourages Finn to make his first jump?
How does Finn feel after he makes his first jump into the water?
options: Scared and doesn't want to do it again
Sad and wants to go home
Bored and wants to play something else
Happy and wants to do it again

title: Luna and the Loud Thunder
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about luna and the loud thunder.
content:
Luna is playing in her room when the storm starts.

The sky gets dark. Rain patters on the window.

Then—BOOM!

Thunder crashes!

Luna jumps. Her heart pounds.

She doesn't like loud thunder.

Luna runs to find her dad.

"The thunder is too loud!" says Luna.

Dad picks her up. "I know. Thunder can be scary."

BOOM! Another crash of thunder.

Luna covers her ears.

"Want to know a secret?" asks Dad.

Luna nods.

"Thunder is just the sky's big drum," says Dad. "It makes noise, but it can't hurt you."

"A drum?" asks Luna.

"A very, very big drum," says Dad.

BOOM! More thunder.

Dad pretends to play drums. "Boom, boom, boom!"

Luna giggles a little.

"Want to play drums too?" asks Dad.

He gives Luna a wooden spoon and a pot.

Luna taps the pot. Boom, boom!

Every time the thunder booms, Luna and Dad play their drums.

BOOM! goes the sky.

Boom, boom! go Luna and Dad.

They're playing along with the storm!

Luna isn't covering her ears anymore.

She's drumming!

The storm starts to pass. The thunder gets quieter.

Luna puts down her spoon.

"The thunder wasn't so scary," says Luna.

"Nope," says Dad. "Just the sky playing its drum."

Luna smiles. Next time there's thunder, she knows what to do.

Play along!

questions.question: What makes Luna jump and feel scared at the beginning of the story?
options: A sudden noise from a toy

questions.question: What does Dad tell Luna the thunder is like?
How do Luna and Dad deal with the loud thunder?
options: They play their own drums along with it

title: The Honest Finder
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Oliver is playing at the park.

He sees something shiny under the slide.

Oliver crawls under and picks it up.

It's a toy truck! Red with yellow wheels!

"Cool!" says Oliver.

Oliver plays with the truck. Vroom, vroom!

He rolls it in the dirt. It's so fun!

But then Oliver hears crying.

A little boy is looking around. Sniffling.

"What's wrong?" asks Oliver.

"I lost my truck," says the little boy. "My red truck with yellow wheels."

Oliver looks at the truck in his hand.

Red. With yellow wheels.

This is the boy's truck!

Oliver's tummy feels funny.

Oliver really likes this truck.

He could keep it. The boy doesn't know Oliver found it.

But that wouldn't be right.

Oliver takes a deep breath.

"Is this your truck?" Oliver asks. He holds it out.

The little boy's face lights up!

"Yes! You found it!"

He takes the truck and hugs it.

"Thank you, thank you!" says the boy.

Oliver feels warm inside. Different from before. Better.

The little boy's mom walks over.

"Thank you for being honest," she says to Oliver.

Oliver smiles. "I wanted to keep it. But it wasn't mine."

The mom nods. "That was the right choice."

Oliver feels proud. Being honest feels good!

questions.question: What does Oliver find under the slide at the park?
Why is the little boy crying at the park?
What choice does Oliver make when he realizes the truck belongs to the crying boy?
options: He gives it back to the boy
He asks his mom what to do

questions.question: How does Oliver feel after returning the truck and being honest?
options: Angry that he couldn't keep it

title: Waiting for the Cookies
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Emma's mom is baking cookies!

Chocolate chip cookies! Emma's favorite!

The kitchen smells so good!

"Can I have one now?" asks Emma.

"Not yet," says Mom. "They need to cool first."

Mom puts the hot cookies on the counter.

"Don't touch! They're still too hot," warns Mom.

Emma nods. She'll wait!

Mom leaves the kitchen to answer the phone.

Emma looks at the cookies. They look so good!

Emma walks closer to the counter.

The cookies are right there! Still warm!

Maybe just one bite? Just a tiny taste?

Emma reaches up toward the counter.

Her fingers are almost touching a cookie.

Emma stops. She remembers what Mom said.

The cookies are too hot. And she's supposed to wait!

Emma puts her hand down.

She walks away from the counter.

Waiting is hard! But she can do it!

Emma plays with her toys while she waits.

She builds a tower with blocks.

She reads a book.

She draws a picture.

Finally, Mom comes back. "The cookies are ready now!"

Mom gives Emma a cookie. It's the perfect temperature!

Not too hot. Not too cold. Just right!

Emma takes a bite. Mmm! Delicious!

"Was it worth the wait?" asks Mom.

"Yes!" says Emma. "Waiting made it even better!"

Mom hugs her. "I'm proud of you for being patient."

questions.question: What delicious treat is Emma's Mom baking?
Why can't Emma have a cookie right away?
options: They are for a party later

questions.question: How does Emma distract herself while waiting for the cookies to cool?
options: She builds a tower, reads a book, and draws

questions.question: What does Emma realize about waiting for the cookies?
options: It was a waste of time
It made the cookies taste even better
She should have eaten one hot

title: The Kind Word
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Noah is learning about kind words.

"Please" and "thank you" are magic words!

They make people smile!

Today, Noah will use his magic words.

Let's see what happens!

At breakfast, Mom gives Noah cereal.

"Thank you, Mom!" says Noah.

Mom smiles big! "You're welcome, sweetie!"

The magic worked! Mom is smiling!

Noah feels happy too!

Noah wants more juice.

Instead of pointing, he uses his words.

"May I have more juice, please?"

Dad smiles! "Of course! Here you go."

The magic words worked again!

At the park, Noah wants a turn on the swing.

A girl is swinging.

"Can I have a turn, please?" asks Noah politely.

The girl nods. "Okay! I'm almost done!"

She doesn't say "no" because Noah asked nicely!

At the store, the cashier gives Noah a sticker.

"Thank you!" says Noah with a big smile.

The cashier smiles back! "You're very welcome!"

Everyone loves hearing "thank you"!

At bedtime, Dad tucks Noah in.

"Thank you for being so polite today," says Dad.

Noah smiles. "Please and thank you are magic words!"

Dad laughs. "They really are. They make everyone happy."

Noah closes his eyes. Tomorrow, he'll use his magic words again!

questions.question: What does Noah call the words 'Please' and 'thank you'?
What happens when Noah says 'Thank you' to his Mom for cereal?
How does Noah politely ask for a turn on the swing at the park?
options: He says 'Can I have a turn, please?'

questions.question: What does Noah realize about using his 'magic words'?

title: Cleaning Up Together
description: Follow the journey of male and female kids in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Leo and Maya have been playing all afternoon!

Blocks everywhere! Cars scattered! Dolls on the floor!

The playroom is very messy!

"Time to clean up!" calls Mom.

Leo and Maya look at the mess. So much to clean!

"This will take forever!" says Leo.

"There are so many toys!" agrees Maya.

They both feel tired just looking at the mess!

"Maybe if we work together?" suggests Maya.

Leo thinks. "Okay! Let's try!"

"I'll pick up the blocks!" says Leo.

"I'll get the cars!" says Maya.

They start cleaning! Leo grabs blocks. Maya grabs cars.

Into the toy box they go!

They're working as a team!

"This is going faster!" notices Leo.

"Because we're doing it together!" says Maya.

They keep working. Blocks. Cars. Dolls. Books!

The playroom is getting cleaner and cleaner!

In just ten minutes, the playroom is clean!

All the toys are put away!

Leo and Maya give each other a high-five!

"We did it!" cheers Maya.

"Together!" adds Leo.

Mom comes back in. "Wow! That was fast!"

"We worked together!" explains Leo proudly.

"Teamwork makes cleaning faster!" says Maya.

Mom smiles. "You both did a great job!"

Cleaning together is much better than cleaning alone!

questions.question: What was the main problem in Leo and Maya's playroom?
What did Leo and Maya decide to do to make cleaning easier?
How long did it take Leo and Maya to clean the playroom by working together?
What lesson did Leo and Maya learn about cleaning?

title: The Gentle Touch
description: Follow the journey of female girl, animal in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Lily meets a cat at her grandma's house.

The cat's name is Whiskers.

She has soft orange fur!

Lily wants to pet her!

"Can I touch the cat?" asks Lily.

"Yes," says Grandma. "But be gentle. Cats don't like rough touching."

Lily reaches out. She wants to pet Whiskers so badly!

Her hand moves fast toward the cat.

"Slowly," reminds Grandma. "Gentle."

Lily slows down. She reaches out slowly.

Her hand touches the cat's head. Soft!

But Lily pats too hard. Pat! Pat! Pat!

Whiskers moves away. She doesn't like that!

"Oops," says Lily.

"Try again," says Grandma. "This time, pet very gently. Like this."

Grandma shows Lily. Her hand moves slowly. Softly.

Down the cat's back. So gentle!

Whiskers purrs! She likes that!

"I'll try!" says Lily.

Lily reaches out again. Very slowly this time.

She touches Whiskers gently. Soft, soft, soft.

Down the cat's back. Smooth strokes.

Whiskers starts purring! Purrrrr!

"She likes it!" says Lily happily.

Lily keeps petting Whiskers gently.

The cat leans into Lily's hand. So happy!

"Being gentle means the cat trusts you," explains Grandma.

Lily smiles. "I like being gentle!"

Whiskers purrs louder. She made a new friend!

questions.question: What is the cat's name that Lily meets at Grandma's house?
What did Grandma tell Lily she needed to be when petting the cat?
How did Whiskers react when Lily finally started petting her gently?

title: The Sorry Stone
description: Follow the journey of inanimate stone, male boy in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Jake and his friend Ethan are building with blocks.

They're making a tall tower together!

But Jake swings his arm and knocks it down! CRASH!

All the blocks fall! The tower is gone!

Ethan's face looks sad. They worked so hard!

Jake feels bad. He didn't mean to knock it down!

But now Ethan is sad.

Jake's tummy feels heavy.

"I'm sorry, Ethan," says Jake quietly.

Ethan doesn't answer. He's too sad.

Jake picks up a smooth stone from his pocket.

He found it at the beach. It's his favorite!

He holds it out to Ethan.

"Here. You can have my sorry stone," says Jake.

"Sorry stone?" asks Ethan.

"It's my favorite stone," explains Jake. "I'm giving it to you because I'm really sorry."

Ethan takes the stone. He looks at it.

It's smooth and gray. Pretty!

"Really sorry?" asks Ethan.

"Really, really sorry," says Jake.

Ethan smiles a little. "Okay. I forgive you."

He gives the stone back. "But you can keep your sorry stone."

"Friends again?" asks Jake hopefully.

"Friends again," agrees Ethan.

They hug.

Jake and Ethan build the tower again. Together!

This time they're extra careful!

Jake keeps his sorry stone in his pocket.

He hopes he won't need it. But it's there if he makes a mistake!

Saying sorry helps fix friendships!

questions.question: What did Jake accidentally do to Ethan's block tower?
What special item did Jake offer to Ethan to show he was truly sorry?
What did Ethan do after Jake said he was 'really, really sorry' and offered the stone?
What lesson does Jake learn about saying sorry?
options: Giving gifts is the best way to apologize.

title: The Listening Ears
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Sam's friend Alex looks sad at the playground.

He's sitting on the bench. Not playing.

"What's wrong?" asks Sam.

Alex's eyes look watery. Like he might cry.

"Do you want to talk?" asks Sam.

"I lost my favorite toy car," says Alex quietly.

"The blue one?" asks Sam.

Alex nods. "I brought it to the park yesterday. Now it's gone."

Sam sits down next to Alex.

He doesn't know how to fix this problem.

"Maybe someone took it home by mistake?" suggests Sam.

"Maybe," says Alex. "But I'll never find it."

Sam thinks. He can't make the car come back!

But maybe he can do something else.

"Tell me about your car," says Sam. "What did you like about it?"

Alex talks about his blue car. How fast it went. How the doors opened!

Sam listens. He doesn't interrupt. He just listens.

Sometimes Alex's voice gets sad. Sometimes he almost smiles remembering.

Sam just sits and listens.

After a while, Alex takes a deep breath.

"Thanks for listening, Sam."

"I'm sorry you lost your car," says Sam.

Alex nods. "I'm still sad. But talking about it helped."

"Want to play on the swings?" asks Sam.

"Okay," says Alex. He smiles a little.

Sam and Alex play together. Alex still feels sad about his car.

But he feels a little better. Because Sam listened!

Sometimes you can't fix a problem.

But listening always helps.

Sam learned something important today!

questions.question: Why was Alex sad at the playground?
options: He lost his favorite toy car.

questions.question: What did Sam do to help Alex feel a little better?
options: He found the car for him.
He gave Alex a new car.
He told Alex to stop being sad.
He just sat and listened to Alex talk.

questions.question: What important lesson did Sam learn about helping a sad friend?
options: You should always give your friend a toy.
It's best to ignore sad friends.
You can always fix someone's problem.

title: The Fair Share
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Zoe's mom gives her a pack of crackers.

Four crackers! Yum!

Zoe opens the pack. She's ready to eat them all!

But her little brother walks over.

He looks at the crackers. His tummy rumbles.

"Can I have some?" asks Zoe's brother.

Zoe looks at her four crackers.

If she shares, she'll have less!

"But these are mine," says Zoe.

Her brother's face looks sad.

Zoe thinks. She has four crackers. Her brother has zero.

That's not fair!

Zoe counts her crackers. One, two, three, four.

"I can share," decides Zoe.

Zoe gives two crackers to her brother.

"Here! Two for you. Two for me!"

Her brother smiles big! "Thank you, Zoe!"

He munches his crackers happily.

Zoe eats hers too.

Zoe's two crackers taste good!

But something is different.

They taste even BETTER because she shared!

Her brother is happy. That makes Zoe happy too!

Mom saw everything. "That was very kind, Zoe."

"I shared fairly," says Zoe proudly. "Two and two!"

Mom hugs her. "Fair sharing makes everyone happy."

Zoe agrees. Her crackers tasted better because her brother had some too!

Next time, she'll share right away!

questions.question: How many crackers did Zoe have at the beginning?
Why did Zoe decide to share her crackers with her brother?
options: She thought it wasn't fair for him to have none.

questions.question: How did Zoe feel after she shared her crackers fairly?
What did Zoe learn about sharing?
options: Sharing is only for big kids.
You should never share your favorite snacks.

title: The Helper's Hands
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about Morals & Values.
content:
Ben is at Grandma's house.

Grandma is carrying grocery bags from the car.

The bags look heavy!

Grandma walks slowly. Her arms are full.

Ben wants to help!

"Grandma! Can I help?" asks Ben.

"That would be wonderful!" says Grandma.

She gives Ben a light bag. It has bread inside!

Ben carries it carefully. Not too heavy!

He can do this!

Ben walks slowly to the house.

The bag is lighter than Grandma's bags. But it's still important!

He's helping!

Ben brings the bag inside. He sets it on the table gently.

"I did it!" says Ben.

"Can I help with more?" asks Ben.

"Yes, please!" says Grandma.

She gives him another light bag. This one has bananas!

Ben carries it inside too!

He's such a good helper!

After all the bags are inside, Grandma sits down.

"Thank you, Ben! You have such helpful hands!"

Ben looks at his hands. They look the same as always!

"Helpful hands?" asks Ben.

"Yes!" says Grandma. "Your hands helped carry bags! That made my job easier!"

Ben smiles. He likes having helpful hands!

"I want to help more!" says Ben.

Grandma hugs him. "You're my best helper."

Ben feels proud. His hands helped someone!

questions.question: What was Grandma doing when Ben offered to help?
What kind of bags did Grandma give Ben to carry?
options: Light bags with bread and bananas.

questions.question: What did Grandma call Ben's hands after he helped her?

title: The Brave Little Candle
description: Follow the journey of inanimate candle in this story about Courage & Bravery.
content:
Little Candle sits on a table.

She's small. Just a little birthday candle!

Around her are big candles. Tall candles!

"I'm so small," thinks Little Candle. "I can't do much."

She feels nervous about her first job.

Suddenly, the lights go out! The room is dark!

Everyone gasps. "Oh no! A power outage!"

It's very dark! No one can see!

Little Candle hears people bumping into things.

"We need light!" someone says.

"Where are the big candles?" asks someone.

But the big candles are in the closet. Too far away in the dark!

Then someone remembers. "The birthday candle! On the table!"

Hands reach for Little Candle!

Someone lights Little Candle's wick.

Flicker! Little Candle's flame appears!

It's small. But it's light!

The darkness goes away! Just a little bit!

"I can see!" says a child.

Little Candle's small flame lights up a circle around her.

People can see each other's faces!

They can see the table. The chairs. The room!

"The little candle saved us!" says someone.

Little Candle feels warm and proud!

Even though Little Candle is small, her light is big enough!

She learned something important.

You don't have to be big to be helpful!

Even small lights can push away the dark!

Little Candle burns brightly. Proud and brave!

questions.question: How did Little Candle feel about herself at the beginning of the story?
options: Small and not able to do much.

questions.question: What happened that made Little Candle's light needed?
options: The big candles were too bright.

questions.question: What did Little Candle's small flame do in the dark room?
options: It made the room brighter than ever.
It only made her feel warm.
It lit up a small circle and helped people see.

questions.question: What important lesson did Little Candle learn?
options: Being small means you can't help.
Even small lights can push away the dark.
It's better to be in the closet.

title: The Knight's First Quest
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about Courage & Bravery.
content:
Lucas puts on his cardboard armor.

He holds his foam sword.

"I'm a knight!" announces Lucas.

His first quest: Find the dragon in the backyard!

(The dragon is really his dog, Max. But knights need quests!)

Lucas walks into the backyard carefully.

He holds his sword ready.

"Where's the dragon?" whispers Lucas.

Then he sees Max lying under a tree.

Max is big! And he's panting! Steam! (Breath!)

"Dragon spotted!" whispers Lucas.

Lucas's heart beats fast.

Max is his dog. But right now, Max is a dragon!

Lucas feels a little scared.

"Maybe I should go back inside," thinks Lucas.

But knights are brave!

Lucas takes a deep breath. "I can do this!"

He walks toward the dragon slowly. Step by step.

Max sees Lucas. His tail wags! (Dragons wag their tails?)

Lucas gets closer. Closer.

His hands shake a little. But he keeps going!

Lucas reaches Max. "I... I hereby declare you a friendly dragon!"

Max licks Lucas's face! Slurp!

Lucas giggles. "The friendliest dragon ever!"

He wasn't scary after all!

Lucas sits down and pets Max.

Dad watches from the door. "Did you complete your quest?"

"Yes!" says Lucas proudly. "I faced the dragon! Even though I was scared!"

Dad smiles. "That's what bravery means. Doing something even when you're scared."

Lucas hugs Max. His first quest is complete!

questions.question: Who was the 'dragon' Lucas was looking for in the backyard?
How did Lucas feel when he first spotted the 'dragon'?
What did Lucas do even though he was scared?
options: He walked toward the dragon slowly.

questions.question: According to Dad, what does bravery mean?
options: Doing something only when you're big.
Doing something even when you're scared.

title: Mira Tries Vegetables
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about Courage & Bravery.
content:
Mira's plate has something green on it.

Green beans!

Mira has never tried green beans before.

They look... different!

"I don't think I like them," says Mira.

"Have you ever tasted them?" asks Mom.

"No," admits Mira.

"Then how do you know?" asks Mom gently.

Mira looks at the green beans. They're just sitting there. Not scary!

"Being brave means trying new things," says Mom.

Mira picks up her fork.

She spears one green bean. A tiny piece!

She lifts it up. Closer to her mouth.

Her nose wrinkles. "What if I don't like it?"

"Then you don't have to eat more," promises Mom.

Mira closes her eyes. Opens her mouth.

The green bean touches her tongue.

She chews. Chew, chew, chew.

It's... not bad! Kind of crunchy! A little bit salty!

Mira swallows. "I did it!"

"How was it?" asks Mom.

"It was okay!" says Mira, surprised. "Not yucky!"

She takes another bite. This time with eyes open!

"Actually kind of good!" says Mira.

Mira eats three more green beans!

"I'm proud of you," says Mom. "You were brave!"

Mira smiles. "Being brave with food is easy!"

Mom laughs. "Next time we'll try something else new!"

Mira nods. She can be a brave eater!

questions.question: What new food was on Mira's plate?
What did Mira's Mom tell her about being brave with food?
options: Being brave means trying new things.
Being brave means not eating vegetables.

questions.question: How did Mira feel about the green beans after she tried them?
options: She was surprised they were 'okay' and 'kind of good'.

title: Tying My Shoes
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about Coming of Age.
content:
Jake has new shoes with laces!

Not velcro. Real laces that tie!

"Can you teach me?" Jake asks Dad.

Dad sits down. "Let's learn together!"

Jake is ready to be a big kid!

"First, make an X with the laces," says Dad.

Jake crosses the laces. X!

"Good!" says Dad. "Now pull one lace through the bottom."

Jake pulls. It makes a knot!

"I did it!" says Jake.

"Now comes the tricky part," says Dad. "Make two bunny ears!"

Jake tries to make loops. One lace becomes a loop!

But the other lace won't loop right. It's too short!

"Oops," says Jake.

"That's okay. Try again," says Dad.

Jake tries again. Both laces make loops this time!

They look like bunny ears!

"Perfect!" says Dad. "Now tie the bunny ears together."

Jake tries. The loops twist. They fall apart!

"Argh!" says Jake.

Jake keeps trying. Again and again!

Sometimes the loops are too loose. Sometimes too tight!

Sometimes they fall apart. Sometimes they make a knot!

"I can't do it!" says Jake, frustrated.

"Yes you can," says Dad. "Keep trying!"

Jake tries one more time.

X. Pull through. Two bunny ears. Tie them together. Pull!

The bow stays! A real bow!

"I DID IT!" shouts Jake. "I tied my shoe!"

Dad gives him a high-five. "You didn't give up!"

Jake looks at his tied shoe. He's such a big kid now!

questions.question: What new skill was Jake trying to learn with his new shoes?
What was the 'tricky part' Dad mentioned when teaching Jake?
How did Jake feel when he kept trying but the laces fell apart?
What lesson did Jake learn from tying his shoes?
options: Dad should tie his shoes for him.
You can do it if you don't give up.

title: Ava's Big Bed
description: Follow the journey of female girl in this story about Coming of Age.
content:
Ava has slept in a crib her whole life.

But today is special!

Mama and Papa bring in a new bed. A BIG bed!

"This is your big girl bed," says Mama.

Ava's eyes go wide. It's huge!

The bed has pink sheets and a soft pillow.

Ava climbs up using a step stool!

She sits on the bed. Bounces a little. Boing, boing!

"It's so big!" says Ava.

She lies down. So much space!

That night, bedtime comes.

Mama tucks Ava into the big bed.

"Goodnight, big girl," says Mama.

She turns off the light and leaves.

Ava lies in the dark. The bed feels VERY big.

Ava looks around. Everything looks different from this bed!

She can see the door. The window. The toy shelf.

It's a little bit scary.

The bed is so big. Ava feels so small!

"Mama?" calls Ava quietly.

Mama comes back. "What's wrong, sweetie?"

"The bed is too big," whispers Ava. "I feel small."

Mama sits on the edge. "Want your stuffed bunny?"

Ava nods. Mama gives her the soft bunny.

Ava hugs it close. That's better!

"Big beds are for big girls," says Mama. "And you're getting bigger every day!"

Ava thinks about that. She IS bigger than before!

"I can do this," says Ava. "I'm a big girl!"

Mama kisses her forehead. "Yes you are."

Ava closes her eyes. Her big girl bed doesn't feel scary anymore!

questions.question: What new thing did Ava get today?
How did Ava feel when she was alone in her new bed at night?
options: A little bit scared and small
Like bouncing on the bed more

questions.question: What did Mama give Ava to help her feel better in her big bed?
What did Mama tell Ava that helped her feel brave in her big bed?
options: That she could stay up late
That big beds are for big girls
That the bed would get smaller
That Mama would sleep with her

title: The First Day of School
description: Follow the journey of male boy in this story about Coming of Age.
content:
Today is Noah's first day of school!

He has a new backpack. Blue with stars!

He's excited! But also nervous.

"What if I don't make friends?" asks Noah.

Mama hugs him. "You'll make friends. Just be yourself!"

Mama walks Noah into the classroom.

So many kids! Some are playing with blocks. Some are coloring.

Noah's tummy feels funny.

"I'll pick you up later," says Mama. "Have fun!"

She waves goodbye and leaves.

Noah stands by the door. He doesn't know anyone!

A teacher comes over. "Hi! I'm Ms. Sara. What's your name?"

"Noah," he says quietly.

"Want to play with blocks?" asks Ms. Sara.

Noah nods. Blocks are fun!

Noah walks to the block area.

Another boy is building a tower.

"Hi," says Noah. "Can I help?"

The boy looks up. "Sure! I'm making a castle!"

"I'm Noah," says Noah.

"I'm Tyler!" says the boy.

Noah and Tyler build the castle together.

They add more blocks. Higher and higher!

"This is the tallest castle ever!" says Tyler.

Noah smiles. Building with a friend is fun!

Maybe school isn't so scary after all!

At pickup time, Mama comes back.

"How was school?" asks Mama.

"Good!" says Noah. "I made a friend! His name is Tyler!"

"See?" says Mama. "I knew you would!"

Noah can't wait to go back to school tomorrow!

questions.question: What was Noah worried about on his first day of school?
options: He wouldn't like his new backpack
He wouldn't know where the bathroom was
He wouldn't like the school lunch

questions.question: Who helped Noah feel more comfortable when he first arrived in the classroom?
What did Noah and Tyler do together that made Noah smile?
options: They played with toy cars on the rug
They built a tall castle with blocks
They read a book about animals

questions.question: How did Noah feel about school at the end of his first day?
options: He was still nervous about going back
He was tired and wanted to stay home tomorrow
He was excited to go back to school tomorrow
He didn't want to talk about it
